original: yan lag dang nyid lag dpa' bar mdzes pa yin /
analyzed: yan lag dang nyid lag dpa' bar mdzes pa yin /
translated: The arms and fingers are beautiful and strong.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gzigs pa shin tu dag pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gzigs pa shin tu dag pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas have very pure vision.

original: snang ba rab rib med ces rnam par dag pa yin /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams @245a * //
analyzed: snang ba rab rib med ces rnam par dag pa yin / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams @245a * //
translated: They are pure, with unclouded vision.

original: ni tshul dang ldan pa'i slob ma mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: ni tshul dang ldan pa'i slob ma mnga' ba ste /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas have disciples who are well-disciplined.

original: phyal zlum pa yin /
analyzed: phyal zlum pa yin /
translated: They have round bellies.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'khor ba'i nyes pa thams cad shin tu sbyangs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'khor ba'i nyes pa thams cad shin tu sbyangs pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas have completely purified all the faults of saṃsāra.

original: phyal shin tu byang ba dang lan pa yin /
analyzed: phyal shin tu byang ba dang lan pa yin /
translated: Their bellies are very clean and smooth.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni nga rgyal gyi de'u bcom pa ste ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni nga rgyal gyi de'u bcom pa ste ;
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas have destroyed the demon of pride.

original: phyal ma zhom pa yin /
analyzed: phyal ma zhom pa yin /
translated: Their bellies are not sunken in.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos zad pa rnams bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos zad pa rnams bzlog pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas have turned away from the exhaustion of phenomena.

original: phyal phyam mer 'dug pa yin /
analyzed: phyal phyam mer 'dug pa yin /
translated: Their bellies are even.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos zab mo shin tu thugs su chad pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos zab mo shin tu thugs su chad pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas have completely understood the profound Dharma.

original: lte ba zab pa yin /
analyzed: lte ba zab pa yin /
translated: Their navels are deep.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mthun par 'dzin pa'i slob ma mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mthun par 'dzin pa'i slob ma mnga' ba ste /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas have students who are harmonious.

original: lte ba g-yas phyogs su 'khyil pa yin /
analyzed: lte ba g-yas phyogs su 'khyil pa yin /
translated: They have a navel that is coiled to the right.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni slob ma kun nas mdzes pa'i dge 'dun mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni slob ma kun nas mdzes pa'i dge 'dun mnga' ba ste /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas have a saṅgha of students who are beautiful in every way.

original: kun nas mdzes pa yin /
analyzed: kun nas mdzes pa yin /
translated: They are beautiful in every way.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thugs shin tu gtsang ba dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thugs shin tu gtsang ba dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas have a mind that is very pure.

original: kun tu spyod pa shin tu gtsang ba yin /
analyzed: kun tu spyod pa shin tu gtsang ba yin /
translated: They have a very pure conduct.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos nag po bstan pa dang / bral ba'i chos dang 'dul ba mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos nag po bstan pa dang / bral ba'i chos dang 'dul ba mnga' ba ste /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas have a Dharma and Vinaya that is free of the teaching of the dark Dharma.

original: sku la sme ba med pa yin /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni shing bal ltar rab tu yang ba rab tu mtho ba'i chos ston pa ste /
analyzed: sku la sme ba med pa yin / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni shing bal ltar rab tu yang ba rab tu mtho ba'i chos ston pa ste /
translated: They have a body that is without moles.🔽The Bhagavān Buddhas teach a Dharma that is very light, like cotton.

original: phyag shing bal ltar shin tu 'jam pa yin /
analyzed: phyag shing bal ltar shin tu 'jam pa yin /
translated: They have hands that are very soft, like cotton.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rang gi skye bo dang skye bo phal pa byams pas dge sbyong chen po mnyes pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rang gi skye bo dang skye bo phal pa byams pas dge sbyong chen po mnyes pa ste /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are loving toward their own people and toward ordinary people.

original: phyag gi ri mo snum pa yin /
analyzed: phyag gi ri mo snum pa yin /
translated: They have glossy lines on their hands.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni shin tu zab cing brtan par bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni shin tu zab cing brtan par bzhugs pa ste /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are very profound and stable.

original: phyag gi ri mo zab pa yin /
analyzed: phyag gi ri mo zab pa yin /
translated: They have deep lines on their hands.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bzod pa'i chos yangs pa ston pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bzod pa'i chos yangs pa ston pa ste /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, teach the Dharma of patience.

original: phyag gi ri mo ring ba yin /
analyzed: phyag gi ri mo ring ba yin /
translated: They have long lines on their hands.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bslab pa'i gnas lha cang yang mi ring bar 'cha' ba ste /🔽zhal lha cang mi ring bar 'cha' ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bslab pa'i gnas lha cang yang mi ring bar 'cha' ba ste / zhal lha cang mi ring bar 'cha' ba ste /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, set forth the bases of training not too long.🔽They have faces not too long.

original: zhal lha cang mi ring ba yin /
analyzed: zhal lha cang mi ring ba yin /
translated: They have faces not too long.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gzugs brnyan 'jig rten du skye ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gzugs brnyan 'jig rten du skye ba ste /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are born in the world as reflections.

original: zhal gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan snang ba yin /
analyzed: zhal gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan snang ba yin /
translated: Their faces are reflections of forms.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jam pa sngon du btang zhig 'dul ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jam pa sngon du btang zhig 'dul ba ste /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are gentle and they tame,

original: ljags shin tu 'jam pa yin /
analyzed: ljags shin tu 'jam pa yin /
translated: so their tongues are very tender.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yon tan phra ba'i tshogs dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yon tan phra ba'i tshogs dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are endowed with a multitude of subtle qualities,

original: ljags shin tu srab pa yin /
analyzed: ljags shin tu srab pa yin /
translated: so their tongues are very slender.

original: @245b sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byis pa so so'i skye bo 'dod chags pa rnams kyis ches dang 'dul ba gting dpag par dka' ba ste /
analyzed: @245b sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byis pa so so'i skye bo 'dod chags pa rnams kyis ches dang 'dul ba gting dpag par dka' ba ste /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are difficult to fathom for childish ordinary beings who are attached,

original: ljags shin tu dmar ba yin /
analyzed: ljags shin tu dmar ba yin /
translated: so their tongues are very red.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni glang po'i sgra dang 'brug gi sgra lta bus bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni glang po'i sgra dang 'brug gi sgra lta bus bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba ste /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are fearless like the voice of an elephant or the sound of thunder,

original: glang po'i nga ro dang / 'brug gi sgra dbyangs dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: glang po'i nga ro dang / 'brug gi sgra dbyangs dang ldan pa yin /
translated: so they have the voice of an elephant and the sound of thunder.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni snyan zhing 'jam pa dang / nyams su bde bar smra ba'i slob ma mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni snyan zhing 'jam pa dang / nyams su bde bar smra ba'i slob ma mnga' ba ste /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have disciples who speak pleasantly, gently, and agreeably,🔽so they have a pleasant voice.

original: snyan zhing 'jam pa dang nyams su bde ba'i gsung dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: snyan zhing 'jam pa dang nyams su bde ba'i gsung dang ldan pa yin /
translated: His speech is pleasant, gentle, and delightful.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni srid pa kun tu sbyor ba las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni srid pa kun tu sbyor ba las 'das pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas have transcended the fetters of existence.

original: tshems mche ba shin tu zlum pa yin /
analyzed: tshems mche ba shin tu zlum pa yin /
translated: His canine teeth are very round.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni skye bo rno ba rnams 'dul ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni skye bo rno ba rnams 'dul ba ste /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas tame those with sharp faculties.

original: tshems mche ba rno ba dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: tshems mche ba rno ba dang ldan pa yin /
translated: His canine teeth are sharp.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos dang 'dul ba shin tu dkar ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos dang 'dul ba shin tu dkar ba ste /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas have very white Dharma and Vinaya.

original: tshems mche ba shin tu dkar ba yin /
analyzed: tshems mche ba shin tu dkar ba yin /
translated: His canine teeth are very white.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sa'i phyogs mnyam pa la bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sa'i phyogs mnyam pa la bzhugs pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas sit on even ground.

original: tshems mche ba mnyam pa dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: tshems mche ba mnyam pa dang ldan pa yin /
translated: His canine teeth are even.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rim gyis mngon par rtogs pa'i chos ston pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rim gyis mngon par rtogs pa'i chos ston pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas teach the Dharma of realization in stages.

original: tshems mche ba rim gyis gzhol ba yin /
analyzed: tshems mche ba rim gyis gzhol ba yin /
translated: His canine teeth are gradually tapered.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni shes rab kyi ri bo mthon po la bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni shes rab kyi ri bo mthon po la bzhugs pa ste /
translated: The bhagavat buddhas are on the high mountain of wisdom.

original: shangs legs par mtho ba dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: shangs legs par mtho ba dang ldan pa yin /
translated: They have a high nose.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'dul ba'i skye bo gtsang ba mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'dul ba'i skye bo gtsang ba mnga' ba ste /
translated: The bhagavat buddhas have a pure retinue.

original: shangs shin tu gtsang ba yin /
analyzed: shangs shin tu gtsang ba yin /
translated: They have a very clean nose.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos phul du yangs pa mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos phul du yangs pa mnga' ba ste /
translated: The bhagavat buddhas have the most vast buddha qualities.

original: spyan ring ba dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: spyan ring ba dang ldan pa yin /
translated: They have long eyes.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gzigs pa shin tu rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gzigs pa shin tu rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The bhagavat buddhas have very pure vision.

original: spyan rnam par dag pa yin /
analyzed: spyan rnam par dag pa yin /
translated: They have pure eyes.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sems can gyi tshogs shin tu bsags pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sems can gyi tshogs shin tu bsags pa ste /
translated: The bhagavat buddhas have a very vast accumulation of sentient beings.

original: rdzi ma stug pa yin ;
analyzed: rdzi ma stug pa yin ;
translated: They have thick eyelashes.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin dang skyes bu dang na chung mchog mig dkar nag 'byes shing padmo'i 'dab ma ltar 'dug pa rnams kyis mngon par dga' bar byas pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin dang skyes bu dang na chung mchog mig dkar nag 'byes shing padmo'i 'dab ma ltar 'dug pa rnams kyis mngon par dga' bar byas pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas are delighted by gods, humans, asuras, men, and the most beautiful women, whose eyes are like lotus petals.

original: spyan dkar nag 'byes shing padmo'i 'dab ma ltar 'dug pa yin /🔽sangs rgyas @246a * //
analyzed: spyan dkar nag 'byes shing padmo'i 'dab ma ltar 'dug pa yin / sangs rgyas @246a * //
translated: Their eyes are like lotus petals.🔽The Bhagavān Buddhas

original: bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu yangs par gzigs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu yangs par gzigs pa ste /
translated: always look with a broad gaze.

original: smin ma ring ba dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: smin ma ring ba dang ldan pa yin /
translated: They have long eyebrows.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jam par 'dul ba la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jam par 'dul ba la mkhas pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas are skilled in gentle discipline.

original: smin ma 'jam pa dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: smin ma 'jam pa dang ldan pa yin /
translated: They have smooth eyebrows.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni skyon thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni skyon thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas know all faults.

original: smig ma'i spu mnyam pa dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: smig ma'i spu mnyam pa dang ldan pa yin /
translated: They have even eyelashes.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba'i snum gyis sems can snum par 'gyur ba'i skye bo 'dul ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba'i snum gyis sems can snum par 'gyur ba'i skye bo 'dul ba ste /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas discipline beings who are moistened by the moisture of roots of virtue.

original: smin ma snum pa dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: smin ma snum pa dang ldan pa yin /
translated: Their eyebrows are glossy.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos mchog tu yangs shing don dang ldan pa mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos mchog tu yangs shing don dang ldan pa mnga' ba ste /
translated: The Bhagavān buddhas have the most extensive and meaningful Dharma:

original: snyan shal legs shing snyan shal ring pa yin /
analyzed: snyan shal legs shing snyan shal ring pa yin /
translated: their earlobes are well formed and long.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyud las rnam par rgyal ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyud las rnam par rgyal ba ste /
translated: The Bhagavān buddhas are victorious over the continuum of afflictions:

original: snyan 'jam pa yin /
analyzed: snyan 'jam pa yin /
translated: their ears are smooth.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sems can bsam pa ma nyams pa 'dul ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sems can bsam pa ma nyams pa 'dul ba ste /
translated: The Bhagavān buddhas tame beings with pure intentions:

original: snyan gyi dbang po ma nyams pa dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: snyan gyi dbang po ma nyams pa dang ldan pa yin /
translated: they have unimpaired faculties of hearing.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad yongs su sbyangs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad yongs su sbyangs pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān buddhas have purified all aspects of view:

original: zhal 'phral ba legs par grub pa dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: zhal 'phral ba legs par grub pa dang ldan pa yin /
translated: their faces are well formed.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni phas kyi rgol ba shin tu 'dul ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni phas kyi rgol ba shin tu 'dul ba ste /
translated: The Bhagavān buddhas have thoroughly tamed opponents:

original: zhal 'phral ba yangs pa dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: zhal 'phral ba yangs pa dang ldan pa yin /
translated: their faces are broad.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni smon lam dam pa shin tu rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni smon lam dam pa shin tu rdzogs pa ste /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have fulfilled their excellent aspirations;

original: dbu shin tu rgyas pa yin /
analyzed: dbu shin tu rgyas pa yin /
translated: their heads are very broad.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yul gyi bung ba rnams bzlogs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yul gyi bung ba rnams bzlogs pa ste /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have turned away from the faults of the objects of desire;

original: dbu skra bung ba ltar gnag pa dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: dbu skra bung ba ltar gnag pa dang ldan pa yin /
translated: their hair is as dark as a bee.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa spang ba'i bag la nyal ba zad par byas pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa spang ba'i bag la nyal ba zad par byas pa ste /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have exhausted the latent tendencies to be eliminated by seeing and by cultivation;

original: dbu skra stug pa yin /
analyzed: dbu skra stug pa yin /
translated: their hair is thick.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thugs 'jam pas bstan pa'i snying po thugs su chud pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thugs 'jam pas bstan pa'i snying po thugs su chud pa ste /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have understood the essence of the teaching with a gentle mind;

original: dbu skra 'jam pa yin /
analyzed: dbu skra 'jam pa yin /
translated: their hair is soft.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu ma 'khrugs pa'i thugs dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu ma 'khrugs pa'i thugs dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, always have an undisturbed mind;

original: dbu skra mi 'dzings pa dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: dbu skra mi 'dzings pa dang ldan pa yin /
translated: their hair is not disheveled.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni brlangs pa'i gsung dang yongs su bral ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni brlangs pa'i gsung dang yongs su bral ba ste /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are completely free from the faults of speech;🔽their hair is not frizzy.

original: dbu skra mi rtsub pa yin /
analyzed: dbu skra mi rtsub pa yin /
translated: His hair is not rough.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byang chub kyi yan lag spos kyi me tog gi skye bo @246b mthun par bsgrubs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byang chub kyi yan lag spos kyi me tog gi skye bo @246b mthun par bsgrubs pa ste /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas have the fragrance of the flowers of the branches of enlightenment.

original: dbu skra dri zhim pa yin /
analyzed: dbu skra dri zhim pa yin /
translated: His hair is fragrant.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni phyag dang zhabs dpal gyi be'u dang / bkra shis dang / g-yung drung 'khyil pas brgyan pa yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni phyag dang zhabs dpal gyi be'u dang / bkra shis dang / g-yung drung 'khyil pas brgyan pa yin /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas have hands and feet marked with auspicious signs, with swastikas and spirals.

original: rab 'byor de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'o //
translated: Subhūti, these are the eighty minor marks of a Tathāgata, a Saint, genuinely and fully awake.

original: rab 'byor de ltar de lta bu'i chos kyi rnam pa de dag gzhan la bshad pa dang / bstan pa dang / yang dag par bstan pa de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar de lta bu'i chos kyi rnam pa de dag gzhan la bshad pa dang / bstan pa dang / yang dag par bstan pa de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Subhūti, teaching, demonstrating, and fully teaching those aspects of the Dharma to others in that way is called the gift of the supramundane Dharma.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams zang zing gi sbyin pa dang chos kyi sbyin pas sdud pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams zang zing gi sbyin pa dang chos kyi sbyin pas sdud pa yin te /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, do bodhisattva great beings incorporate beings with the gift of Dharma and the gift of material things.

original: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos so //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos so //
translated: Subhūti, this is the amazing and marvelous Dharma of bodhisattva great beings.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshig snyan pas sems can rnams sdud pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshig snyan pas sems can rnams sdud pa yin zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings incorporate beings with sweet talk?

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis sems can rnams sdud pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis sems can rnams sdud pa yin te /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings incorporate beings with the six perfections.

original: 'di ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: They incorporate beings with the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshig snyan par smra bas sems can rnams sdud do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshig snyan par smra bas sems can rnams sdud do //
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings with these six perfections speak pleasantly to beings and gather them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag gis dge ba'i chos thams cad ma 'dus pa med de /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag gis dge ba'i chos thams cad ma 'dus pa med de /
translated: Because all wholesome dharmas are included in these six perfections.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshig snyan par smra bas sems can rnams sdud do //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshig snyan par smra bas sems can rnams sdud do //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings in that way speak pleasantly to beings and gather them.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po don byas pas sems can rnams sdud pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po don byas pas sems can rnams sdud pa yin zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings with the six perfections gather beings by doing what is beneficial?

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag gis don bya bas sems can rnams sdud do //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag gis don bya bas sems can rnams sdud do //
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings with the six perfections gather beings by doing what is beneficial.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag gis dge ba'i chos thams cad ma 'dus pa med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag gis dge ba'i chos thams cad ma 'dus pa med de /
translated: In this way, there is nothing that is not included in all wholesome dharmas by means of these six perfections.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i don bya bas sems can rnams @247a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i don bya bas sems can rnams @247a * //
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings incorporate beings with the benefit they do.

original: sdud do ; / rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po don mthun pas sems can rnams sdud pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: sdud do ; / rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po don mthun pas sems can rnams sdud pa yin zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings incorporate beings with the same aim?

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag gis don mthun pas sems can rnams sdud do ;
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag gis don mthun pas sems can rnams sdud do ;
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings incorporate beings with the same aim by means of those six perfections.

original: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag gis dge ba'i chos thams cad ma 'dus pa med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag gis dge ba'i chos thams cad ma 'dus pa med de /
translated: In this way, there is nothing that is not included in all wholesome dharmas by means of these six perfections.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po don mthun par sems can rnams sdud do //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po don mthun par sems can rnams sdud do //
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings incorporate beings with the same aim.

original: rab 'byor de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos so zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la 'god pa'i phrin las yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos so zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la 'god pa'i phrin las yin no //
translated: This, Subhūti, is the marvelous and wonderful Dharma of the bodhisattva great beings.” This is the activity of establishing in the four means of gathering.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan dag la 'di skad du 'doms shing 'di skad ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan dag la 'di skad du 'doms shing 'di skad ston to //
translated: they instruct and teach other bodhisattva great beings like this:

original: rigs kyi bu khyod tshur shog yi ge mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas par gyis shig / yi ge gcig la mkhas par gyis shig / yi ge gnyis nas yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyi bar la mkhas par gyis shig / yi ge gcig gis byang ba'i
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod tshur shog yi ge mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas par gyis shig / yi ge gcig la mkhas par gyis shig / yi ge gnyis nas yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyi bar la mkhas par gyis shig / yi ge gcig gis byang ba'i
translated: ‘Come here, son of a good family. Be skilled in the accomplishment of the letters. Be skilled in one letter. Be skilled in two letters up to the forty-two letters. Be skilled in the one-letter

original: rang bzhin thams cad shes par gyis shig / yi ge gnyis kyis byang ba'i rang bzhin thams cad shes par gyis shig / yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyi bar gyis byang ba'i rang bzhin thams cad shes par gyis shig / yi ge gcig tu yi ge bzhi
analyzed: rang bzhin thams cad shes par gyis shig / yi ge gnyis kyis byang ba'i rang bzhin thams cad shes par gyis shig / yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyi bar gyis byang ba'i rang bzhin thams cad shes par gyis shig / yi ge gcig tu yi ge bzhi
translated: You should know the nature of all letters through the purification of up to forty-two letters.🔽You should meditate on the inclusion of forty-two letters in one letter.

original: bcu rtsa gnyis 'dus par sgoms shig / yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis su yi ge gcig 'dus par sgoms shig ces chos ston to //
analyzed: bcu rtsa gnyis 'dus par sgoms shig / yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis su yi ge gcig 'dus par sgoms shig ces chos ston to //
translated: You should meditate on the inclusion of one letter in forty-two letters.”

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de yang yi ge gcig la mkhas pa yin /🔽yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyi bar la mkhas pa yin /🔽yi ge gcig gi nang du yi ge gcig gi nang du yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis su 'dus par sgom pa la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de yang yi ge gcig la mkhas pa yin / yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyi bar la mkhas pa yin / yi ge gcig gi nang du yi ge gcig gi nang du yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis su 'dus par sgom pa la mkhas pa yin /
translated: Subhūti, those bodhisattva great beings are skilled in one letter,🔽up to skilled in forty-two letters.🔽They are skilled in meditating on the inclusion of forty-two letters in one letter.

original: yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis su yi ge gcig 'dus par sgom pa la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis su yi ge gcig 'dus par sgom pa la mkhas pa yin /
translated: They are skilled in meditating on the inclusion of one letter in forty-two letters.

original: de de ltar yi ge mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas par bya na /
analyzed: de de ltar yi ge mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas par bya na /
translated: If one is skilled in the accomplishment of letters in this way,

original: lam la goms shing yi ge med par mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: lam la goms shing yi ge med par mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: one is skilled in the accomplishment of the path and of the absence of letters.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: de bzhin gshegs @247b pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos la mkhas pa dang yi ge la mkhas pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs @247b pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos la mkhas pa dang yi ge la mkhas pa yin te /
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly awakened Buddha is skilled in phenomena and skilled in letters.

original: chos la mkhas pa dang yi ge la mkhas pas yi ge mang pos yi ge med pa'i chos ston kyang /
analyzed: chos la mkhas pa dang yi ge la mkhas pas yi ge mang pos yi ge med pa'i chos ston kyang /
translated: With his skill in phenomena and skill in letters, he teaches the Dharma of the absence of letters with many letters.

original: rab 'byor chos de yi ge'i rnam pa dang bral ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos de yi ge'i rnam pa dang bral ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Subhūti, that Dharma is not devoid of the aspect of letters.

original: rab 'byor de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos te /
translated: Subhūti, that is also a Dharma of marvel and wonder for bodhisattva great beings,

original: gang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: which is not shared with all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:🔽“Lord, how should bodhisattva great beings train in the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te mtha' las 'das pa dang ; thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te mtha' las 'das pa dang ; thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid nye bar bzung ste /
translated: Blessed One, if one takes up the emptiness that is the transcendence of extremes and the emptiness that is the absence of beginning and end,

original: sems can yang shin tu mi dmigs /
analyzed: sems can yang shin tu mi dmigs /
translated: then sentient beings are not apprehended at all.

original: chos kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: chos kyang mi dmigs /
translated: Dharmas are not apprehended.

original: chos kyi dngos po yang mi dmigs pa lags na /
analyzed: chos kyi dngos po yang mi dmigs pa lags na /
translated: The entities of dharmas are not apprehended.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: Blessed One, if that is the case, how do bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la spyod pa dang /
translated: the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity; how do they practice the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, and the four formless absorptions; how do they practice the thirty-seven factors of awakening;

original: stong pa nyid bcu bzhi la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad la spyod pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bcu bzhi la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad la spyod pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang /
translated: the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness meditative stabilizations, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang /
translated: the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, the thirty-two major marks of a great person,

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu la spyod cing /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu la spyod cing /
translated: and the eighty minor marks.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa drug la gnas nas sems can rnams la chos ston par 'gyur /🔽de la ni sems can mi dmigs te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa drug la gnas nas sems can rnams la chos ston par 'gyur / de la ni sems can mi dmigs te /
translated: They teach the doctrine to sentient beings while abiding in the six clairvoyances that arise from maturation.🔽They do not apprehend sentient beings there,

original: sems can gdags pa'ang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sems can gdags pa'ang mi dmigs so //
translated: and they do not apprehend the designation of sentient beings.

original: sems can mi dmigs pas gzugs dmigs su ma @248a * //
analyzed: sems can mi dmigs pas gzugs dmigs su ma @248a * //
translated: Because sentient beings are not apprehended, form is not apprehended.

original: mchis so // sems can mi dmigs pas tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dmigs su ma mchis so //
analyzed: mchis so // sems can mi dmigs pas tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dmigs su ma mchis so //
translated: Because sentient beings are not apprehended, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not apprehended.

original: sems can rnams mi dmigs pas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du dmigs su ma mchis so //
analyzed: sems can rnams mi dmigs pas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du dmigs su ma mchis so //
translated: Because sentient beings are not apprehended, up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are not apprehended.

original: sems can mi dmigs pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dmigs su ma mchis so //
analyzed: sems can mi dmigs pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dmigs su ma mchis so //
translated: Because sentient beings are not apprehended, up to the knowledge of all aspects is not apprehended.

original: sems can mi dmigs pas skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dmigs su ma mchis so //
analyzed: sems can mi dmigs pas skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dmigs su ma mchis so //
translated: Because sentient beings are not apprehended, the thirty-two major marks of a great person are not apprehended.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dmigs su ma mchis so //
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dmigs su ma mchis so //
translated: The eighty minor signs are not apprehended.

original: sems can dmigs su ma mchis pa la ni sems can ma mchis so //
analyzed: sems can dmigs su ma mchis pa la ni sems can ma mchis so //
translated: In the nonapprehension of sentient beings, there are no sentient beings.

original: gzugs ma mchis so //
analyzed: gzugs ma mchis so //
translated: There is no form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma mchis so //
translated: There is no feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du ma mchis so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du ma mchis so //
translated: up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are not there.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ma mchis so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ma mchis so //
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects is not there.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis ma mchis so //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis ma mchis so //
translated: The thirty-two major marks of a great person are not there.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu ma mchis so //
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu ma mchis so //
translated: The eighty minor signs are not there.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, it is because when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang mi dmigs na ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang mi dmigs na ;
translated: they do not apprehend even a bodhisattva,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: so how could they possibly apprehend the dharmas on the side of awakening?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: The Lord said,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: “Exactly so, Subhūti, exactly so!

original: ji skad du smras pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad du smras pa bzhin no //
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na sems can mi dmigs pas nang stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na sems can mi dmigs pas nang stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, in that way, because beings are not apprehended, you should know that it is inner emptiness.

original: phyi stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //🔽phyi nang stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o // phyi nang stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: one should know it as external emptiness.🔽one should know it as the emptiness of external and internal.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du rig par bya'o //🔽phung po stong pa nyid kyi bar du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du rig par bya'o // phung po stong pa nyid kyi bar du rig par bya'o //
translated: one should know it as the emptiness of what is not to be discarded.🔽one should know it as the emptiness of the aggregates.

original: khams stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //🔽skye mched stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khams stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o // skye mched stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: one should know it as the emptiness of the elements.🔽one should know it as the emptiness of the sense sources.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: one should know it as the emptiness of dependent origination.

original: bden pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: one should know it as the emptiness of the truths.

original: bdag stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: one should know it as the emptiness of self.

original: sems can stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: one should know it as the emptiness of sentient beings.

original: srog dang / 'gro ba dang / gso pa dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed can dang / shed bdag dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang / slong @248b ba po dang / kun nas slong ba po dang /
analyzed: srog dang / 'gro ba dang / gso pa dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed can dang / shed bdag dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang / slong @248b ba po dang / kun nas slong ba po dang /
translated: one should know it as the emptiness of a living being, a creature, an individual, a person, a human, a human being, a man, a human youth, one who does, one who makes something happen, one who sends, one who instigates, one who agitates, one who makes something arise, one who makes something appear, one who feels, one who knows, one who sees, and one who perceives.

original: tshor ba po dang / tshor bar byed pa po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba po dang / tshor bar byed pa po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: the one who feels, the one who causes feeling, the one who knows, and the one who sees are to be known as emptiness.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The applications of mindfulness are to be known as emptiness.

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and the eightfold path of the noble ones are to be known as emptiness.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: The noble truths, concentrations, immeasurables, formless absorptions, eight liberations, nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,🔽and

original: smon pa med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha should be known as emptiness.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, and a pratyekabuddha’s awakening should be known as emptiness.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o ;
translated: The knowledge of path aspects and the knowledge of all aspects should be known as emptiness.

original: / sangs rgyas kyi zhing stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: / sangs rgyas kyi zhing stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: A buddhafield should be known as emptiness.

original: sangs rgyas stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: A buddha should be known as emptiness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: A bodhisattva should be known as emptiness.

original: rab 'byor de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: chos de dag thams cad stong par mthong na /
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad stong par mthong na /
translated: see all those dharmas as empty,

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: they teach the Dharma to sentient beings who have gone wrong.

original: ji ltar stong pa nyid de dag la yang mi 'jug pa de ltar ston to //
analyzed: ji ltar stong pa nyid de dag la yang mi 'jug pa de ltar ston to //
translated: They teach so that they do not engage with those emptinesses.

original: des de ltar mthong nas chos thams cad sgrib pa med par shes te /
analyzed: des de ltar mthong nas chos thams cad sgrib pa med par shes te /
translated: Having seen in that way, they know all dharmas without obscuration.

original: chos gang la yang 'khrug par mi byed gnyis su mi byed de /
analyzed: chos gang la yang 'khrug par mi byed gnyis su mi byed de /
translated: They do not disturb any dharma, do not make it dual.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang ston par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang ston par byed do //
translated: They teach just as it is.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa ni sprul pa bye ba phrag du mar sprul zhing sems can la la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa ni sprul pa bye ba phrag du mar sprul zhing sems can la la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor /
translated: For example, a tathāgata emanation emanates many billions of emanations and connects some sentient beings to the perfection of generosity,

original: la la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor /
analyzed: la la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor /
translated: connects some to the perfection of ethical discipline,

original: la la bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor /
analyzed: la la bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor /
translated: Some he joins to the perfection of patience,

original: @249a * // la la brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor /
analyzed: @249a * // la la brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor /
translated: some to the perfection of diligence,

original: la la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor /
analyzed: la la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor /
translated: some to the perfection of concentration,

original: la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor /
analyzed: la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor /
translated: some to the perfection of wisdom,

original: la la bsam gtan bzhi la /
analyzed: la la bsam gtan bzhi la /
translated: some to the four concentrations,

original: la la tshad med pa bzhi la /
analyzed: la la tshad med pa bzhi la /
translated: some to the four immeasurables,

original: la la gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la sbyor ;
analyzed: la la gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la sbyor ;
translated: some to the four formless absorptions,

original: la la byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la sbyor /
analyzed: la la byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la sbyor /
translated: some to the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment,

original: la la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / la la rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / la la mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / la la stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang /
analyzed: la la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / la la rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / la la mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / la la stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang /
translated: some to the four noble truths, some to the eight liberations, some to the nine serial absorptions, some to emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness,

original: la la mngon par shes pa lnga la sbyor /
analyzed: la la mngon par shes pa lnga la sbyor /
translated: some to the five higher perceptions,

original: la la ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / la la gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la sbyor /
analyzed: la la ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / la la gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la sbyor /
translated: some to all the meditative stabilizations, and some to all the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: la la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / la la mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / la la so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / la la byams pa chen po dang / la la snying rje chen po dang ; la la sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sbyor /
analyzed: la la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / la la mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / la la so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / la la byams pa chen po dang / la la snying rje chen po dang ; la la sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sbyor /
translated: some to the four assurances, some to the four kinds of exact knowledge, some to the four kinds of unhindered knowledge, some to great love, some to great compassion, and some to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha;

original: la la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / la la lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / la la phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / la la dgra bcom pa nyid dang / la la rang byang chub la sbyor /
analyzed: la la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / la la lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / la la phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / la la dgra bcom pa nyid dang / la la rang byang chub la sbyor /
translated: some to the result of stream-winner, some to the result of once-returner, some to the result of non-returner, some to the state of a worthy one, and some to a pratyekabuddha’s awakening;

original: la la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la sbyor na /
analyzed: la la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la sbyor na /
translated: and some to the knowledge of all aspects,

original: rab 'byor de la ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de la ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think, Subhūti,

original: sprul pa des chos la la zhig tha dad du phye ba yod dam /🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: sprul pa des chos la la zhig tha dad du phye ba yod dam / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: has that emanation differentiated any dharmas at all?”🔽“No, Lord,” he replied.🔽The Lord said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: they teach the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: de dag phyin ci log rnams las yongs su bkrol nas ma bcings ma grol ba'i tshul du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: de dag phyin ci log rnams las yongs su bkrol nas ma bcings ma grol ba'i tshul du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu 'god do //
translated: Having freed them from mistaken views, they establish them in the real nature, in a way that is neither bound nor freed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar gzugs ma bcings ma grol ba /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar gzugs ma bcings ma grol ba /
translated: Subhūti, it is because form is neither bound nor freed.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnams ma bcings ma grol ba /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnams ma bcings ma grol ba /
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are neither bound nor freed.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: Up to the knowledge of all aspects is neither bound nor freed.

original: gzugs kyi ma bcings ma grol ba gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ma bcings ma grol ba gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin no //
translated: The non-bound and non-freed form is not form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed @249b rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i ma bcings ma grol ba nyid gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed @249b rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i ma bcings ma grol ba nyid gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
translated: The non-bondage and non-liberation of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is not consciousness.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi ma bcings ma grol ba nyid gang yin pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi ma bcings ma grol ba nyid gang yin pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The non-bondage and non-liberation of the knowledge of all aspects is not the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar gzugs ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gzugs ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: It is because form is utterly pure.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are utterly pure.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Up to the knowledge of all aspects is utterly pure.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, in that way, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom

original: sems can rnams la chos ston kyang sems can du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos ston kyang sems can du mi dmigs so //
translated: they teach the Dharma to beings but do not apprehend beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa la de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa la de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas te /
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings stand in the nonapprehension of all dharmas, and they do so by way of nonapprehension.

original: gzugs stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas te /
analyzed: gzugs stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas te /
translated: They stand in the emptiness of form by way of nonapprehension, and they stand in the emptiness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness by way of nonapprehension, up to they stand in the emptiness of the knowledge of all aspects by way of nonapprehension.

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams la ni gang la yang gnas pa med do //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams la ni gang la yang gnas pa med do //
translated: They do not stand in any conditioned or unconditioned dharmas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni 'di ltar gang la gnas par bya ba de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid mi dmigs te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gang la gnas par bya ba de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid mi dmigs te /
translated: Because the intrinsic nature of that in which they would stand is not apprehended.

original: dngos po med pa la dngos po med pa mi gnas so //
analyzed: dngos po med pa la dngos po med pa mi gnas so //
translated: A nonexistent does not stand in a nonexistent.

original: rang bzhin la rang bzhin mi gnas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin la rang bzhin mi gnas so //
translated: A nature does not stand in a nature.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po la gzhan gyi dngos po mi gnas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po la gzhan gyi dngos po mi gnas so //
translated: An other-nature does not stand in an other-nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni 'di ltar de dag thams cad dmigs su med de /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar de dag thams cad dmigs su med de /
translated: Because all those are non-apprehensible.

original: gang dmigs su med pa de ni gang la yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: gang dmigs su med pa de ni gang la yang mi gnas so //
translated: And what is non-apprehensible does not stand anywhere.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, in that way, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: chos de dag thams cad stong pa nyid thams cad kyi rab tu 'byed de /🔽rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos rnams dang /
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad stong pa nyid thams cad kyi rab tu 'byed de / rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos rnams dang /
translated: analyze all those dharmas with all emptinesses,🔽Subhūti, the lord buddhas, bodhisattva great beings, pratyekabuddhas, śrāvakas,

original: 'phags pa thams cad kyis skyon du mi bya'o //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa thams cad kyis skyon du mi bya'o // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: and all the noble ones do not fault bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom in that way.🔽And why is that?

original: de ni 'di @250a * //
analyzed: de ni 'di @250a * //
translated: It is because

original: ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / rang sangs rgyas de dag dang / nyan thos de dag gis kyang chos nyid de'i rjes su rtogs te /
analyzed: ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / rang sangs rgyas de dag dang / nyan thos de dag gis kyang chos nyid de'i rjes su rtogs te /
translated: In this way, those Lord Buddhas, those Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas, those Pratyekabuddhas, and those Sravakas have realized that reality.

original: chos nyid rjes su rtogs nas kyang sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: chos nyid rjes su rtogs nas kyang sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: Having realized that reality, they teach the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: de'ang chos rnams kyi chos nyid las mi 'da'o /
analyzed: de'ang chos rnams kyi chos nyid las mi 'da'o /
translated: And they do not go beyond the reality of dharmas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings ni 'da' ba med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings ni 'da' ba med do //
translated: Subhuti, the dharma-element does not go beyond.

original: de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' ni 'da' ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' ni 'da' ba med do //
translated: Suchness and the very limit of reality do not go beyond.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag la'ang 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: de dag la'ang 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin med do //
translated: Because they do not have a nature that goes beyond.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhuti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar chos kyi dbyings la 'da' ba yang ma mchis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar chos kyi dbyings la 'da' ba yang ma mchis /
translated: Lord, if the dharma-element does not go beyond,

original: de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' la'ang 'da' ba ma mchis na /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' la'ang 'da' ba ma mchis na /
translated: If there is no going beyond suchness and the perfect endpoint,

original: ci lags 'o na gzugs kyang gzhan la chos kyi dbyings kyang gzhan /
analyzed: ci lags 'o na gzugs kyang gzhan la chos kyi dbyings kyang gzhan /
translated: then is form one thing and the expanse of reality another?

analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang gzhan /

original: 'o na ji ltar chos rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par 'god cing nag po'i chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa nag po ni sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dkar po'i chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa dkar po ni lha dang mi /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar chos rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par 'god cing nag po'i chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa nag po ni sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dkar po'i chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa dkar po ni lha dang mi /
translated: “Well then, how are the results of phenomena posited? The ripened result of black dharmas is the black realms of hell, the animal realm, and the world of Yama. The ripened result of white dharmas is the white realms of gods and humans.

original: dkar nag gi chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa dkar nag gi bde ba dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba /
analyzed: dkar nag gi chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa dkar nag gi bde ba dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba /
translated: The ripened result of black-and-white dharmas is the experience of black-and-white happiness and suffering.

original: mi gang cing dkar ba'i chos kyi rnam par smin pa mi gnag cing dkar ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang /
analyzed: mi gang cing dkar ba'i chos kyi rnam par smin pa mi gnag cing dkar ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang /
translated: the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo zhes bgyi bar rnam par dgod par 'gyur /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo zhes bgyi bar rnam par dgod par 'gyur /
translated: and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor kun rdzob kyi bden pa tshad mar byas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor kun rdzob kyi bden pa tshad mar byas te /
translated: “Subhūti, having taken conventional truth as a measure,

original: 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa bstan gyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa bstan gyi /
translated: I have taught the presentation of the fruits.

original: don dam pa'i bden par ni 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden par ni 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa bstan par mi nus so //
translated: But in ultimate truth it is not possible to teach the presentation of the fruits.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: chos de ni rnam par brtag tu med pa /
analyzed: chos de ni rnam par brtag tu med pa /
translated: That dharma is not something to be imagined,

original: brjod du med pa /
analyzed: brjod du med pa /
translated: it is inexpressible,

original: tha snyad med pa ste /
analyzed: tha snyad med pa ste /
translated: and it is beyond convention.

original: 'di ltar mi bden pa dang / gzugs med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi bden pa dang / gzugs med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa ste /
translated: In this way, it is not real, it is formless, it is unborn, it is unceasing, it is uncontaminated, and it is unpurified.

original: 'di ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar kun rdzob kyi bden pa nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar kun rdzob kyi bden pa nye bar bzung ste /
translated: This is the emptiness of what transcends limits and the emptiness of no beginning and no end.🔽Śāriputra then asked, “Blessed One, if the presentation of the results is made on the basis of relative truth

original: 'bras bu rnam par 'god pa lags kyi don dam pa'i bden pas ma lags na /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par 'god pa lags kyi don dam pa'i bden pas ma lags na /
translated: and not on the basis of ultimate truth,

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ro //
translated: then all ordinary, foolish beings would have attained the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, individual enlightenment, and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Śāriputra, it is so.

original: rab 'byor ci @251a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor ci @251a * //
translated: “Subhūti, do you think

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kun rdzob kyi bden pa'am /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kun rdzob kyi bden pa'am /
translated: that ordinary foolish beings know the conventional truth

original: don dam pa'i bden pa shes sam /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa shes sam /
translated: or the ultimate truth?

original: gal te shes na ni de dag kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: gal te shes na ni de dag kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: If they did know it, they would be established in the result of stream enterer,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the result of once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the result of non-returner,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
translated: the state of a worthy one,

original: rang byang chub bam /
analyzed: rang byang chub bam /
translated: the state of a pratyekabuddha,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par 'god par 'gyur na /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par 'god par 'gyur na /
translated: or unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor gyis pa so so'i skye bo rnams la lam yang med /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis pa so so'i skye bo rnams la lam yang med /
translated: Subhūti, ordinary foolish beings do not have the path,

original: lam rnam par dgod pa yang med /
analyzed: lam rnam par dgod pa yang med /
translated: do not have the establishment of the path,

original: lam sgom pa yang med par byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams la 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa lta ga la 'ong /
analyzed: lam sgom pa yang med par byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams la 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa lta ga la 'ong /
translated: and do not cultivate the path. How could ordinary foolish beings be established in the result?

original: rab 'byor 'phags pa'i gang zag la ni lam yang yod /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'phags pa'i gang zag la ni lam yang yod /
translated: Subhūti, noble beings have the path

original: lam sgom pa yang yod pas na /
analyzed: lam sgom pa yang yod pas na /
translated: and cultivate the path.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa'i gang zag de dag la 'bras bu rnam par bkod pa yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa'i gang zag de dag la 'bras bu rnam par bkod pa yod do //
translated: Therefore, those noble beings have the result arrayed.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci lags lam bsgoms pas 'bras bu 'thob pa'am /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci lags lam bsgoms pas 'bras bu 'thob pa'am /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One, is it the case that the result is attained by cultivating the path,

original: 'bras bu 'thob par bgyi ba ma mchis sam /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'thob par bgyi ba ma mchis sam / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: or is it the case that the result is not attained?”

original: rab 'byor de ni ma yin no //🔽lam bsgoms pas 'bras bu 'thob pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni ma yin no // lam bsgoms pas 'bras bu 'thob pa'am /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti, it is not like that.🔽The result is not attained by cultivating the path,

original: 'bras bu thob par bya ba med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob par bya ba med do //
translated: or by attaining the result.

original: rab 'byor lam ma bsgoms par yang 'bras bu thob pa med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor lam ma bsgoms par yang 'bras bu thob pa med de /
translated: Subhūti, the result is not attained without cultivating the path,

original: lam gyi 'bras bu thob par bya ba yang med do ;
analyzed: lam gyi 'bras bu thob par bya ba yang med do ;
translated: and there is no result to be attained by the path.🔽The result is not attained without abiding in the path,

original: / lam la ma gnas par yang 'bras bu thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: / lam la ma gnas par yang 'bras bu thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: and the result is not attained by abiding in the path.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, in that way, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: thabs mkhas par sems can rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par dgod par byed de /
analyzed: thabs mkhas par sems can rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par dgod par byed de /
translated: they skillfully array the results for sentient beings.

original: 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams ris su bcad cing 'bras bu rnam par dgod par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams ris su bcad cing 'bras bu rnam par dgod par mi byed do //
translated: He does not distinguish the compounded element and the uncompounded element, and does not posit the fruits.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar 'dus byas kyi khams sam 'dus ma byas kyi khams ris su bcad cing 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa ma mchis na /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar 'dus byas kyi khams sam 'dus ma byas kyi khams ris su bcad cing 'bras bu rnam par dgod pa ma mchis na /
translated: Śāriputra replied, “Lord, if the compounded element and the uncompounded element are not distinguished, and the fruits are not posited,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ni kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs pas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ni kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs pas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: then why is it that the Lord has said, ‘By abandoning three fetters one becomes a Stream-Winner;

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang gnod sems bsrabs pas lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang gnod sems bsrabs pas lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: by reducing greed, hatred, and delusion, one becomes a Once-Returner;

original: 'og ma'i cha can gyi kun du sbyor ba lnga spangs pas phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //🔽bla ma'i cha can gyi kun du sbyor ba lnga spangs pas @251b dgra bcom pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'og ma'i cha can gyi kun du sbyor ba lnga spangs pas phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //🔽bla ma'i cha can gyi kun du sbyor ba lnga spangs pas @251b dgra bcom pa nyid do //
