translated: by abandoning five of the lower fetters, one becomes a Non-Returner;🔽and by abandoning the five higher fetters and the three roots of corruption, one becomes an Arhat’?

original: gang ci yang rung ste kun 'byung ba'i chos de dag thams cad 'gog pa'i chos can du shes pas rang byang chub bo //
analyzed: gang ci yang rung ste kun 'byung ba'i chos de dag thams cad 'gog pa'i chos can du shes pas rang byang chub bo //
translated: The realization of a pratyekabuddha is the knowledge that all phenomena that arise are phenomena that cease.

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo zhes gsungs na /🔽bcom ldan 'das ris su bcad cing 'dus byas sam /
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo zhes gsungs na / bcom ldan 'das ris su bcad cing 'dus byas sam /
translated: The realization of perfect buddhahood is the abandonment of all afflictive emotions that are connected to habitual tendencies.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa ma mchis na gsungs pa'i don de bdag gis ji ltar 'tshal bar bgyi /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa ma mchis na gsungs pa'i don de bdag gis ji ltar 'tshal bar bgyi / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Blessed One, if there is no division and no establishment of the results of conditioned or unconditioned phenomena, how should I understand the meaning of what you have said?”

original: rab 'byor rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Subhūti, is the result of stream enterer,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am ;
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am ;
translated: the result of once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the result of non-returner,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
translated: the state of a worthy one,

original: rang byang chub bam /
analyzed: rang byang chub bam /
translated: the realization of a pratyekabuddha,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dus byas sam /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dus byas sam /
translated: or unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening conditioned or unconditioned?”

original: 'on te 'dus ma byas pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te 'dus ma byas pa yin /
translated: “Blessed One, they are unconditioned.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni 'dus ma bgyis pa'o //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni 'dus ma bgyis pa'o //
translated: He replied, “Blessed One, it is unconditioned.

original: bde bar gshegs pa de ni 'dus ma bgyis pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa de ni 'dus ma bgyis pa'o //
translated: Sugata, it is unconditioned.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor 'o na 'dus ma byas kyi chos la ris su bcad pa yod dam /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'o na 'dus ma byas kyi chos la ris su bcad pa yod dam /
translated: “Well then, Subhūti, is there a division in unconditioned phenomena?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: He replied, “Blessed One, there is not.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /🔽gang gi tshe rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems / gang gi tshe rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las 'dus byas sam /🔽'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las 'dus byas sam / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams 'di lta ste /
translated: When a son or daughter of noble family understands conditioned

original: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig tu chud par gyur na /🔽de'i tshe 'dus byas shes sam /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig tu chud par gyur na / de'i tshe 'dus byas shes sam /
translated: and unconditioned phenomena to be the same in being devoid of characteristics,🔽at that time, do they divide any phenomena that are known to be conditioned

original: 'dus ma byas shes chos gang la yang ris su gcod pa yod dam /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas shes chos gang la yang ris su gcod pa yod dam /
translated: or unconditioned?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so ;
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so ;
translated: He replied, “Blessed One, they do not.”

original: / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, what do you think?

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / 'di lta ste /
translated: they do not teach the Dharma to sentient beings by way of a division

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du nye bar bzung ste /
translated: into the emptinesses, from the emptiness of internal phenomena up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: sems can rnams la ris su bcad pas chos mi ston to //
analyzed: sems can rnams la ris su bcad pas chos mi ston to //
translated: They do not teach the Dharma by way of a division into the perfections,

original: de dag kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
analyzed: de dag kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
translated: from the perfection of giving up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'am /🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'am / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
translated: They do not teach the Dharma by way of a division into the emptinesses,🔽from the emptiness of internal phenomena up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.🔽They do not teach the Dharma by way of a division into the four applications of mindfulness,🔽the four right efforts,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
translated: the four legs of miraculous power,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
translated: the five faculties,🔽the five powers,🔽the seven limbs of awakening,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
translated: or the eightfold noble path.🔽They do not teach the Dharma by way of a division into the meditative stabilization of emptiness,

original: bsam gtan @252a * //🔽dang po'am / bsam gtan gnyis pa'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan @252a * // dang po'am / bsam gtan gnyis pa'am /
translated: the meditative stabilization of signlessness,

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'am /🔽bsam gtan bzhi pa'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'am / bsam gtan bzhi pa'am /
translated: or the meditative stabilization of wishlessness.🔽They do not teach the Dharma by way of a division into the meditative stabilization of love,🔽compassion,🔽altruistic joy,

original: byams pa'am / snying rje'am /🔽dga' ba'am / btang snyoms sam /
analyzed: byams pa'am / snying rje'am /🔽dga' ba'am / btang snyoms sam /
translated: or equanimity.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'am /
translated: the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite space,

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'am /
translated: the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite consciousness,

original: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'am /
translated: the meditative absorption of the sense field of nothing-at-all,

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'am /
translated: the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams sam /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams sam /
translated: the applications of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams sam /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams sam /
translated: the right efforts,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams sam /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams sam /
translated: the legs of miraculous power,

original: dbang po rnams sam /
analyzed: dbang po rnams sam /
translated: the faculties,

original: stobs rnams sam /
analyzed: stobs rnams sam /
translated: the powers,

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams sam /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams sam /
translated: the branches of awakening,🔽the path,

original: lam mam / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams sam /
analyzed: lam mam / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams sam /
translated: the noble truths,

original: bsam gtan rnams sam /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams sam /
translated: the meditative concentrations,

original: tshad med pa rnams sam /
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams sam /
translated: the immeasurable aspirations,

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /
translated: the formless meditative absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa rnams sam /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams sam /
translated: the liberations,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /
translated: the serial absorptions,

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams sam /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams sam /
translated: emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness,

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams sam /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams sam /
translated: the meditative stabilities,

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams sam /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams sam /
translated: the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams sam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams sam /
translated: the powers of the tathāgatas,

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams sam /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams sam /
translated: the fearlessnesses,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams sam /🔽byams pa chen po'am /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams sam / byams pa chen po'am /
translated: the detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽great love,

original: snying rje chen po'am /
analyzed: snying rje chen po'am /
translated: great compassion,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams sam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams sam /
translated: the distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ram /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ram /
translated: up to or the knowledge of all aspects,

original: chos gang la yang mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: chos gang la yang mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: he does not settle down on any dharma at all.

original: de la mngon par zhen pa med pas gang la yang chags pa med do /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la mngon par zhen pa med pas gang la yang chags pa med do / 'di lta ste /
translated: Since he does not settle down on that, he is not attached to anything.

original: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba yang sbyin pa'i 'bras bu la chags pa med de /
analyzed: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba yang sbyin pa'i 'bras bu la chags pa med de /
translated: It is just as, for example, a tathāgata emanation giving a gift is not attached to the result of the gift

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu nyams su myong ba med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu nyams su myong ba med do //
translated: and does not experience the result of the gift.

original: gzhan du na sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i don du sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan du na sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i don du sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo //
translated: Otherwise, they would not give gifts for the sake of taking all sentient beings beyond suffering.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: They would not practice the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams sam /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams sam /
translated: They would not meditate on contaminated or uncontaminated phenomena.

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / @252b 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams sgom yang /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / @252b 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams sgom yang /
translated: They would not meditate on mundane or supramundane phenomena, or on conditioned or unconditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos kyi 'bras bu la chags pa med /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos kyi 'bras bu la chags pa med /
translated: They would not be attached to the results of conditioned or unconditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos kyi 'bras bu nyams su myong ba med de /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos kyi 'bras bu nyams su myong ba med de /
translated: They would not experience the results of conditioned or unconditioned phenomena.

original: gzhan du na sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i don du /
analyzed: gzhan du na sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i don du /
translated: Otherwise, they would not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of taking all sentient beings beyond suffering.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams sgom mo //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams sgom mo //
translated: He meditates on conditioned and unconditioned dharmas.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / chos thams cad la spyod de /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / chos thams cad la spyod de /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the six perfections and all dharmas,

original: chos gang la yang gnas pa'am chags pa med do //
analyzed: chos gang la yang gnas pa'am chags pa med do //
translated: but he does not abide in or cling to any dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar des chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid shin tu khong du chud pa med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar des chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid shin tu khong du chud pa med do //
translated: Because he has not fully understood the characteristics of dharmas.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' che po chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid rab tu rtogs pa lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' che po chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid rab tu rtogs pa lags /
translated: “Blessed One, how do bodhisattva mahāsattvas understand the characteristics of dharmas?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor sprul pa ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug la yongs su spyod pa med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor sprul pa ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug la yongs su spyod pa med do //
translated: “Subhūti, a magical creation does not engage in desire, anger, or ignorance.

original: bag la nyal ba dang kun nas ldang ba la yongs su spyod pa med do //
analyzed: bag la nyal ba dang kun nas ldang ba la yongs su spyod pa med do //
translated: He does not indulge in latent tendencies and reactive emotions.

original: phyi nang gi chos thams cad la spyod pa med do //🔽zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i chos rnams la yongs su spyod pa med do ;
analyzed: phyi nang gi chos thams cad la spyod pa med do // zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i chos rnams la yongs su spyod pa med do ;
translated: He does not indulge in any inner or outer phenomena.🔽He does not indulge in any phenomena, whether tainted or untainted.

original: /'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams la yongs su spyod pa med do //
analyzed: /'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams la yongs su spyod pa med do //
translated: He does not indulge in any phenomena, whether compounded or uncompounded.

original: gzugs la yongs su spyod pa med do //
analyzed: gzugs la yongs su spyod pa med do //
translated: He does not indulge in form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la yongs su spyod pa med do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la yongs su spyod pa med do //
translated: He does not indulge in feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la yongs su spyod pa med do //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la yongs su spyod pa med do //
translated: He does not indulge in the sense fields, elements, or dependent origination.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la yongs su spyod pa med do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la yongs su spyod pa med do //
translated: He does not indulge in the perfections, the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, or emptiness.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: He does not engage with the four noble truths, the dhyānas, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness,🔽signlessness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la yongs su spyod pa med do //🔽ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la yongs su spyod pa @253a * //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la yongs su spyod pa med do // ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la yongs su spyod pa @253a * //
translated: wishlessness, or the clairvoyances.

original: ; med do //
analyzed: ; med do //
translated: He does not engage with the meditative stabilities, the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la yongs su spyod pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la yongs su spyod pa med do //
translated: or the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, great loving kindness, great compassion, or the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la yongs su spyod pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la yongs su spyod pa med do //
translated: up to and including the knowledge of all aspects, is not a thing.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang chos thams cad la yongs su spyod pa med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang chos thams cad la yongs su spyod pa med do //
translated: Similarly, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings do not engage with any dharma.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid rab tu rtogs pa yin no /🔽// / bam po drug cu brgyad pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid rab tu rtogs pa yin no / // / bam po drug cu brgyad pa /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings thus realize the defining mark of the dharmas of all dharmas.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das sprul pas lam bsgoms pa la brten kyang kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das sprul pas lam bsgoms pa la brten kyang kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord, even though a magical creation practices the path, it does not become defiled,

original: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur /
translated: it does not become purified,

original: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba na yang mi snang na lam bsgom du ci mchis /
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba na yang mi snang na lam bsgom du ci mchis /
translated: and it does not appear in the five forms of life in saṃsāra. So what is there to practice the path?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa dngos po la la zhig la brten te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa dngos po la la zhig la brten te /
translated: Do you think that a tathāgata’s magical creation is based on some thing?

original: kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa'am /
translated: Is there any such thing as a thing that is defiled,

original: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or a thing that is purified,

original: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba na snang bar gyur pa de lta bu'i dngos po gang yang yod dam /
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba na snang bar gyur pa de lta bu'i dngos po gang yang yod dam /
translated: or a thing that appears in the five destinies of cyclic existence?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags te /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags te /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One, there is not.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pas dngos po la la zhig la brten te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pas dngos po la la zhig la brten te /
translated: Blessed One, the emanation of a tathāgata does not depend on any thing

original: kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: that is defiled,

original: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or a thing that is purified,

original: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba nas gdon par 'gyur ba'i dngos po de lta bu gang yang ma mchis so //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba nas gdon par 'gyur ba'i dngos po de lta bu gang yang ma mchis so //
translated: or a thing that is to be removed from the five destinies of cyclic existence.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' che pos chos rnams kyi tshul rab tu rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' che pos chos rnams kyi tshul rab tu rtogs pa yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, that is how bodhisattva great beings understand the way of things.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci lags gzugs thams cad sprul pa lta bu lags sam /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci lags gzugs thams cad sprul pa lta bu lags sam /
translated: He asked, “Blessed One, are all forms like emanations?”

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa thams cad sprul pa lta bu lags sam /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa thams cad sprul pa lta bu lags sam /
translated: Are all feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousnesses also like a magical creation?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “

original: rab 'byor gzugs thams cad ni sprul pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs thams cad ni sprul pa lta bu'o //
translated: Su­bhūti, all physical forms are like a magical creation.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa thams cad ni sprul pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa thams cad ni sprul pa lta bu'o //
translated: All feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousnesses are like a magical creation.

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de ltar @253b gzugs thams cad ni sprul pa lta bu /
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de ltar @253b gzugs thams cad ni sprul pa lta bu /
translated: ” He then said, “Blessed One, if all physical forms are like a magical creation,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa thams cad sprul pa lta bu lags na /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa thams cad sprul pa lta bu lags na /
translated: and if all feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousnesses are like a magical creation,

original: bcom ldan 'das sprul pa la ni gzugs ma mchis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sprul pa la ni gzugs ma mchis /
translated: then, Blessed One, a magical creation has no physical form,

original: tshor ba ma mchis /
analyzed: tshor ba ma mchis /
translated: no feelings,

original: 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma mchis /
analyzed: 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma mchis /
translated: no perceptions, no formative predispositions, and no consciousness.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis /
translated: It has no affliction,

original: rnam par byang ba ma mchis /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ma mchis /
translated: and it has no purification.

original: gang las grol bar 'gyur ba'i 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba ma mchis na /
analyzed: gang las grol bar 'gyur ba'i 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba ma mchis na /
translated: If there is no five-destinies saṃsāra from which one is liberated,

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i skyes bu'i byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i skyes bu'i byed par 'gyur /
translated: how could a bodhisattva mahāsattva be a person who acts?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe /🔽sems can dmyal ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe / sems can dmyal ba'am /
translated: When bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice the conduct of a bodhisattva,🔽do they apprehend any sentient beings to be liberated from the hells,

original: byol song gi skye gnas sam /
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas sam /
translated: the animal realm,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten nam /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten nam /
translated: the world of Yama,

original: lha'am mi dag las yongs su dgrol bar bya ba'i sems can gang yang dmigs sam /
analyzed: lha'am mi dag las yongs su dgrol bar bya ba'i sems can gang yang dmigs sam /
translated: the gods, or humans?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: He replied, “Bhagavān, they do not.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, that is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: That is so!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po khams gsum nas yongs su dgrol bar bya ba'i sems can gang yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po khams gsum nas yongs su dgrol bar bya ba'i sems can gang yang mi dmigs so //
translated: Bodhisattva mahāsattvas do not apprehend any sentient beings to be liberated from the three realms.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar de ni chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur shes so //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar de ni chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur shes so //
translated: Why is it so?

original: mthong ngo // rtogs so /🔽sprul pa lta bur shes so //
analyzed: mthong ngo // rtogs so / sprul pa lta bur shes so //
translated: Because he knows, sees, and realizes that all phenomena are like an illusion.

original: mthong ngo // rtogs so //
analyzed: mthong ngo // rtogs so //
translated: He knows, sees, and realizes that they are like a magical creation.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i skyes bu'i byed par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i skyes bu'i byed par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be known as the activity of a bodhisattva great being.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur 'tshal zhing mthong ste rtogs pa la /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur 'tshal zhing mthong ste rtogs pa la /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Blessed One, if bodhisattva great beings know, see, and realize that all phenomena are like an illusion,

original: sprul pa lta bur 'tshal zhing mthong ste rtogs pa lags na /
analyzed: sprul pa lta bur 'tshal zhing mthong ste rtogs pa lags na /
translated: and know, see, and realize that they are like a magical creation,

original: gang gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa lags /
analyzed: gang gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa lags /
translated: then for whose sake do bodhisattva great beings practice the six perfections?

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la spyod pa lags /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la spyod pa lags /
translated: the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the five kinds of clairvoyance, up to and including the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha?

original: ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam gyi bar la spyod pa lags /
analyzed: ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam gyi bar la spyod pa lags /
translated: Why do bodhisattva great beings practice the path to awakening?

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyid pa lags /🔽sems can @254a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyid pa lags / sems can @254a * //
translated: Why do they purify a buddhafield?

original: yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /
translated: Why do they bring beings to maturity?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, it is because bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom that they practice the four applications of mindfulness, up to and including the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rab 'byor gal te sems can rnams rang rang gis chos thams cad sprul ba lta bur shes su zin na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang sems can rnams kyi don du bskal pa grangs med par byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa mi spyod do
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te sems can rnams rang rang gis chos thams cad sprul ba lta bur shes su zin na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang sems can rnams kyi don du bskal pa grangs med par byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa mi spyod do
translated: Subhūti, if sentient beings were to know for themselves that all phenomena are like a magical creation, then the bodhisattva great beings would not practice the bodhisattva deeds for the sake of sentient beings for countless eons.

original: // rab 'byor sems can rnams rang rang gis chos thams cad sprul pa lta bu mi shes pas /
analyzed: // rab 'byor sems can rnams rang rang gis chos thams cad sprul pa lta bu mi shes pas /
translated: Subhūti, because sentient beings do not know for themselves that all phenomena are like a magical creation,

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bskal pa grangs med par pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bskal pa grangs med par pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod do //
translated: the bodhisattva great beings practice the six perfections for countless eons,

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: they bring sentient beings to full maturity,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: and they purify a buddhafield.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti then said,

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu /🔽sgra brnyan lta bu /🔽smig rgyu lta bu /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu / sgra brnyan lta bu / smig rgyu lta bu /
translated: “Blessed One, if all phenomena are like a dream,🔽like an echo,🔽like a mirage,

original: mig yor lta bu /🔽sgyu ma lta bu /
analyzed: mig yor lta bu / sgyu ma lta bu /
translated: like an apparition,🔽like an illusion,

original: sprul pa lta bu lags na /
analyzed: sprul pa lta bu lags na /
translated: and like a magical creation,

original: bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams ci la gnas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sems can rnams gyen du bskyod par bgyid /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams ci la gnas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sems can rnams gyen du bskyod par bgyid /
translated: “Blessed One, when sentient beings are established in what do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom elevate sentient beings?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor sems can rnams ni ming dang mtshan mar yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su brtags pa la gnas pas na /
analyzed: rab 'byor sems can rnams ni ming dang mtshan mar yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su brtags pa la gnas pas na /
translated: “Su­bhūti, sentient beings are established in names and attributes that are unreal designations.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: de dag ming dang mtshan ma la gyen du bskyod do //
analyzed: de dag ming dang mtshan ma la gyen du bskyod do //
translated: elevate them above names and attributes.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ming ni gang lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ming ni gang lags /
translated: He asked, “Blessed One, what are names?

original: mtshan ma ni gang lags /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni gang lags /
translated: What are attributes?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor 'di lta ste ming zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor 'di lta ste ming zhes bya ba'am /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni glo bur du ming gis sgro btags pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni glo bur du ming gis sgro btags pa'o //
translated: “Su­bhūti, names and attributes are merely adventitious designations.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: ming zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: ming zhes bya ba'am /
translated: names and attributes.

original: mtshan ma zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mtshan ma zhes bya ba'am /
translated: a sign,

original: gzugs zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba'am /
translated: form,

original: tshor ba zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: tshor ba zhes bya ba'am /
translated: feeling,

original: 'du shes zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'du shes zhes bya ba'am /
translated: perception,

original: 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba'am /
translated: volitional factors,

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: consciousness,

original: bud med ces bya ba'am /🔽skyes pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: bud med ces bya ba'am / skyes pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: a woman,🔽a man,

original: khye'u zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: khye'u zhes bya ba'am /
translated: a boy,

original: bu mo zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: bu mo zhes bya ba'am /
translated: a girl,🔽a hell being,

original: sems can dmyal ba zhes bya ba'am /🔽byol song gi skye gnas zhes bya ba'am /🔽gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba zhes bya ba'am / byol song gi skye gnas zhes bya ba'am / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: an animal,🔽a hungry ghost,

original: lha zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: lha zhes bya ba'am /
translated: a god,

original: mi zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi zhes bya ba'am /
translated: a human,

original: 'dus byas kyi chos zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos zhes bya ba'am /
translated: a conditioned phenomenon,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos zhes bya ba'am /
translated: an unconditioned phenomenon,

original: @254b rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: @254b rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'am /
translated: the result of stream enterer,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'am /
translated: the result of once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'am /
translated: the result of non-returner,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid ces bya ba'am /
translated: arhatship,

original: rang byang chub ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: rang byang chub ces bya ba'am /
translated: a pratyekabuddha’s awakening,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces bya ba de ni sgyu ma'i ming gis sgro btags pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces bya ba de ni sgyu ma'i ming gis sgro btags pa ste /
translated: “Perfect complete awakening” is a designation by the name of an illusion.

original: rab 'byor ming thams cad ni ming gi don kyis  btags pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor ming thams cad ni ming gi don kyis  btags pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, all names are designated by the meaning of the name.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams gang la chags par 'gyur ba'i 'dus byas thams cad ni ming tsam ste /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams gang la chags par 'gyur ba'i 'dus byas thams cad ni ming tsam ste /
translated: All conditioned things, to which foolish ordinary beings become attached, are mere names.

original: de dag la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de dag la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: thabs mkhas pas ming thams cad ni yongs su rtogs pa las byung ba yin gyis /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas ming thams cad ni yongs su rtogs pa las byung ba yin gyis /
translated: they skillfully encourage them, saying, “All names arise from conceptualization.🔽Do not become attached to what is imputed, which is empty of the entity of the absence of things.

original: yongs su brtags pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa la khyed chags par ma byed cig / chos thams cad stong pa la mkhas pa rnams ni mngon par zhen par mi byed do zhes skul bar byed de /
analyzed: yongs su brtags pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa la khyed chags par ma byed cig / chos thams cad stong pa la mkhas pa rnams ni mngon par zhen par mi byed do zhes skul bar byed de /
translated: Those who are skilled in the emptiness of all phenomena do not become fixated.”

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams la chos ston pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams la chos ston pa yin no //
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom teach the Dharma to sentient beings with skillful means.

original: rab 'byor mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor mtshan ma gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what are the causal signs?

original: gnyis po 'di dag ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams gang la chags par 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: gnyis po 'di dag ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams gang la chags par 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma ste /
translated: These two are the causal signs that childish ordinary beings are attached to.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: gzugs kyi mtshan ma dang / gzugs med pa'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan ma dang / gzugs med pa'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: the causal signs of form and the causal signs of formlessness.

original: rab 'byor gzugs kyi mtshan ma gang zhe na /🔽'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i gzugs rags pa'am /🔽phra ba'am / bzang ba'am /🔽ngan pa'am / rgyang ring ba'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyi mtshan ma gang zhe na / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i gzugs rags pa'am / phra ba'am / bzang ba'am / ngan pa'am / rgyang ring ba'am /
translated: “Subhūti, what are the causal signs of form?

original: thag nye ba gang chos thams cad skad cig ma la kun du rtog pas bzung ba ste /
analyzed: thag nye ba gang chos thams cad skad cig ma la kun du rtog pas bzung ba ste /
translated: It is the conceptual grasping of all phenomena as momentary, whether past, future, or present, coarse or subtle, good or bad, far or near.

original: 'di ni gzugs kyi mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs kyi mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the causal signs of form.

original: rab 'byor gzugs med pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs med pa'i mtshan ma gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what are the formless signs?

original: gzugs med pa'i chos gang la yang rung ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i chos gang la yang rung ste /
translated: Any formless phenomena

original: mtshan mar bzung bas yongs su brtags shing nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mtshan mar bzung bas yongs su brtags shing nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: are apprehended as signs, and then imagined and afflictions arise.

original: 'di ni gzugs med pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs med pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the formless signs.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: thabs mkhas pas mtshan ma de dag las bkrol zhing mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings su 'god cing rab tu gzhog ste /🔽ci nas kyang 'di ni mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas mtshan ma de dag las bkrol zhing mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings su 'god cing rab tu gzhog ste / ci nas kyang 'di ni mtshan ma'o //
translated: with skillful means they liberate from those signs and establish them in the realm without signs.🔽They establish them in such a way that they do not fall into the duality of ‘this is a sign’

original: 'di ni mtshan ma med pa'o zhes bya ba gnyis su mi ltung ba de ltar 'god cing gzhog ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan ma med pa'o zhes bya ba gnyis su mi ltung ba de ltar 'god cing gzhog ste /
translated: and ‘this is signlessness.’

original: rab 'byor de ltar na @255a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na @255a * //
translated: Subhūti, in that way

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams mtshan ma las rnam par bkrol zhing mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings su rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams mtshan ma las rnam par bkrol zhing mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings su rab tu 'god do //
translated: With skillful means, they liberate sentient beings from characteristics and establish them in the realm of signlessness.

original: gsol pa / gal te chos 'di dag thams cad ni de tsam du bas te ;
analyzed: gsol pa / gal te chos 'di dag thams cad ni de tsam du bas te ;
translated: Subhūti said, “If all these phenomena are just that—

original: ming dang mtshan mar bas la btags pa tsam du bas te /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan mar bas la btags pa tsam du bas te /
translated: names, characteristics, and designations—

original: yongs su btags pa las byung ba lags na /
analyzed: yongs su btags pa las byung ba lags na /
translated: and arise from imputation,

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Blessed One, how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: bdag kyang dge ba'i chos kyi khyad par thob la /
analyzed: bdag kyang dge ba'i chos kyi khyad par thob la /
translated: attain the distinctive qualities of virtue themselves

original: gzhan yang dge ba'i chos kyi khyad par 'thob pa la gzhog cing dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis sa nas sa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge ba'i chos kyi khyad par 'thob pa la gzhog cing dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis sa nas sa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa lags /
translated: and establish others in the distinctive qualities of virtue, and with those roots of virtue complete the levels one by one,

original: sems can rnams theg pa gsum la sbyor ba lags /
analyzed: sems can rnams theg pa gsum la sbyor ba lags /
translated: and connect sentient beings to the three vehicles?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: rab 'byor gal te dngos po'am dngos po'i mtshan ma zhig yod na ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te dngos po'am dngos po'i mtshan ma zhig yod na ni /
translated: Subhūti, if there were a thing or a causal process,

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: khyad par 'thob par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyad par 'thob par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: they would not attain distinction.

original: gzhan yang khyad par 'thob pa la sbyor bar mi 'gyur gyi /🔽'di ltar dngos po'i mtshan ma yang med /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyad par 'thob pa la sbyor bar mi 'gyur gyi / 'di ltar dngos po'i mtshan ma yang med /
translated: They would not apply themselves to attaining distinction.

original: dngos po yang med pas na /
analyzed: dngos po yang med pas na /
translated: But because there are no causal processes and no things,

original: rab 'byor de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: complete the perfection of meditative stability by way of the absence of causal processes.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //🔽mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do // mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the perfection of effort, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity by way of the signless.🔽He perfects the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, and the four formless absorptions by way of the signless.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the four applications of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, and the eightfold noble path by way of the signless.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: In the manner of signlessness, they perfect the emptiness of inner phenomena, the emptiness of outer phenomena, and the emptiness of both outer and inner phenomena.

original: @255b mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: @255b mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: In the manner of signlessness, they perfect the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang ; mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang ; mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: In the manner of signlessness, they perfect the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, the four noble truths, and the three gateways to liberation, namely, emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: In the manner of signlessness, they perfect the superknowledges, the meditative stabilities, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: and by way of signlessness, he perfects the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de dge ba'i chos de dag yongs su rdzogs par byas nas mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis gzhan yang dge ba'i chos de dag la sbyor te /
analyzed: de dge ba'i chos de dag yongs su rdzogs par byas nas mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis gzhan yang dge ba'i chos de dag la sbyor te /
translated: Having perfected those wholesome dharmas, he also connects others to those wholesome dharmas by way of signlessness.

original: rab 'byor gal te chung du na skra'i rtse mo'i cha shes bzhag pa tsam gyi khyon cig mtshan ma yod na yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te chung du na skra'i rtse mo'i cha shes bzhag pa tsam gyi khyon cig mtshan ma yod na yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, if even the size of something as small as the tip of a hair were a sign, then when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom

original: chos mtshan ma med pa dang dran pa med pa dang / yid la byed pa med pa de mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos mtshan ma med pa dang dran pa med pa dang / yid la byed pa med pa de mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: “Subhūti, if the Dharma were not signless, not involving anything to be remembered, and not involving any mental activity, then one would not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sems can rnams kyang de bzhin nyid dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams la gzhog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang de bzhin nyid dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams la gzhog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And one would not establish beings in suchness and in the uncontaminated dharmas.

original: rab 'byor zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni mtshan ma med pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni mtshan ma med pa /
translated: “Subhūti, the uncontaminated dharmas are signless,

original: dran pa med pa /
analyzed: dran pa med pa /
translated: not involving anything to be remembered,

original: yid la bya ba med pa ste /
analyzed: yid la bya ba med pa ste /
translated: and not involving any mental activity.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Subhūti, in that way, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyis sems can thams cad kyi don byed do //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyis sems can thams cad kyi don byed do //
translated: they work for the welfare of all beings through the uncontaminated dharmas.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar chos thams cad mtshan ma mchis shing /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar chos thams cad mtshan ma mchis shing /
translated: Subhūti then asked, “Lord, if all dharmas are like that—signless,

original: dran pa ma mchis te /
analyzed: dran pa ma mchis te /
translated: not involving anything to be remembered,

original: yid la bgyi ba ma mchis na /
analyzed: yid la bgyi ba ma mchis na /
translated: and not involving any mental activity—

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar 'di dag ni dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar 'di dag ni dge ba'i chos so //
translated: ‘These are wholesome dharmas,

original: 'di dag ni mi dge ba'i chos so //🔽'di dag ni 'jig rten pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni mi dge ba'i chos so // 'di dag ni 'jig rten pa'i chos so //
translated: These are unwholesome dharmas.🔽These are mundane dharmas.

original: 'di dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos so //🔽'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos so // 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos so //
translated: These are supramundane dharmas.🔽These are dharmas with outflows.

original: 'di dag ni zag pa dang med pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni zag pa dang med pa'i chos so //
translated: These are dharmas without outflows.

original: 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos so //
translated: These are conditioned dharmas.

original: 'di dag ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos so //
translated: These are unconditioned dharmas.

original: 'di dag ni thun mong gi chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni thun mong gi chos so //
translated: These are shared dharmas.

original: @256a * // 'di dag ni thun mong ma yin pa'i chos so //
analyzed: @256a * // 'di dag ni thun mong ma yin pa'i chos so //
translated: These are unshared dharmas.

original: 'di dag ni nyan thos kyi chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni nyan thos kyi chos so //
translated: These are the dharmas of the śrāvakas.

original: 'di dag ni rang sangs rgyas kyi chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rang sangs rgyas kyi chos so //
translated: These are the dharmas of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos so //
translated: These are the dharmas of the bodhisattvas.

original: 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos so zhes ji ltar bgrang bar bgyi /
analyzed: 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos so zhes ji ltar bgrang bar bgyi /
translated: These are the dharmas of the buddhas.’

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: mtshan ma med pa yang gzhan la /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa yang gzhan la /
translated: Are signlessness and

original: nyan thos kyi chos rnams kyang gzhan nam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos rnams kyang gzhan nam /
translated: the dharmas of the śrāvakas different?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de lta ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de lta ma lags so //
translated: He replied, “Blessed One, it is not so.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: mtshan ma med pa yang gzhan la /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa yang gzhan la /
translated: Are the signless and

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang gzhan nam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang gzhan nam /
translated: the qualities of a pratyekabuddha different?

original: mtshan ma med pa yang gzhan la /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa yang gzhan la /
translated: Are the signless and

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams kyang gzhan nam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams kyang gzhan nam /
translated: the qualities of a bodhisattva different?

original: mtshan ma med pa yang gzhan la /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa yang gzhan la /
translated: Are the signless and

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang gzhan nam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang gzhan nam /
translated: the qualities of a buddha different?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de lta ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de lta ma lags so //
translated: He replied, “Blessed One, it is not so.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor mtshan ma med pa nyid rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor mtshan ma med pa nyid rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: “Subhūti, the signless is the fruit of stream enterer,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: the fruit of once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: the fruit of non-returner,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid do //
translated: the state of a worthy one,

original: rang byang chub bo //
analyzed: rang byang chub bo //
translated: the awakening of a pratyekabuddha,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos so //
translated: the qualities of a bodhisattva,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos so //
translated: and the qualities of a buddha.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de de lta lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de de lta lags so //
translated: He replied, “Blessed One, that is so.

original: bde bar gshegs pa de de lta lags so ;
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa de de lta lags so ;
translated: Sugata, that is so.🔽”

original: / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na /
translated: “Subhūti, for these reasons

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni mtshan ma med par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni mtshan ma med par rig par bya ste /
translated: you should know that all phenomena are signless.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni mtshan ma med pa 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dge ba'i chos mang po rnam par 'phel te /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni mtshan ma med pa 'di la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dge ba'i chos mang po rnam par 'phel te /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who train in this signlessness of all phenomena increase in many virtuous qualities.

original: 'di lta ste pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang /
translated: They are the six perfections, the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, the emptiness of essential nature, the emptiness of other entities, the emptiness of the nature of non-entities, the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four kinds of exact knowledge, the four kinds of unhindered knowledge, great love, great compassion, the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, and the thirty-two major marks of a great being.

original: dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang /
translated: the five powers, the five strengths, the seven branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the four noble truths, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon @256b pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon @256b pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang /
translated: the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the five kinds of superknowledge, all the meditative stabilities,

original: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang /
translated: all the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four kinds of intrepid confidence, the four kinds of precise knowledge, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: de ma yin pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos dpag tu med pa dag gis rnam par 'phel lo //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos dpag tu med pa dag gis rnam par 'phel lo //
translated: and by means of the immeasurable other qualities of a Buddha.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la bslab par bya ba ma gtogs par gzhan la bslab par bya ba med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la bslab par bya ba ma gtogs par gzhan la bslab par bya ba med do //
translated: Because the bodhisattva-mahāsattva has no other training than the training in emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo 'di gsum du dge ba'i chos thams cad ma 'dus pa med de /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo 'di gsum du dge ba'i chos thams cad ma 'dus pa med de /
translated: Because all wholesome dharmas are included in these three gates of liberation.

original: 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo'o //🔽mtshan ma dang bral ba ni mtshan ma med pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo'o // mtshan ma dang bral ba ni mtshan ma med pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo'o //
translated: Thus, emptiness by way of its own characteristic is the gate of liberation of emptiness.🔽Freedom from signs is the gate of liberation of signlessness.

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa ni smon pa med pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa ni smon pa med pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo ste /
translated: The absence of purposeful activity is the gate of liberation of wishlessness.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po 'di dag la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phung po lnga la slob pa yin /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po 'di dag la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phung po lnga la slob pa yin /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattvas who train in these three gateways to liberation train in the five aggregates,

original: skye mched bcu gnyis la slob pa yin /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis la slob pa yin /
translated: train in the twelve sense fields,

original: khams bco brgyad la slob pa yin /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad la slob pa yin /
translated: train in the eighteen elements,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis la slob pa ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis la slob pa ste /
translated: and train in the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la slob pa yin /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la slob pa yin /
translated: They train in the six perfections,

original: nang stong pa nyid la slob pa yin /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la slob pa yin /
translated: train in inner emptiness,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la slob pa yin /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la slob pa yin /
translated: up to train in the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la slob pa yin /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la slob pa yin /
translated: They train in the four establishments of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang ; stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la slob pa yin /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang ; stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la slob pa yin /
translated: train in the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: signlessness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la slob pa yin /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la slob pa yin /
translated: wishlessness, the clairvoyances, all the meditative stabilizations, and all the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa @257a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa @257a * //
translated: They train in the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses,

original: bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos pa 'dres pa bco brgyad la slob pa yin /
analyzed: bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos pa 'dres pa bco brgyad la slob pa yin /
translated: the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la slob pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la slob pa yin no //
translated: They train in the knowledge of all aspects up to omniscience.”

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,🔽“Lord, how do bodhisattva great beings train in the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa gang gi tshul du ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la slob pa lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa gang gi tshul du ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la slob pa lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Blessed One, in what way and how do bodhisattva great beings train in the five appropriated aggregates when practicing the perfection of wisdom?”

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Su­bhūti, this is how bodhisattva great beings train in the five appropriated aggregates when practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs rab tu shes te /
analyzed: gzugs rab tu shes te /
translated: They know form.

original: gzugs ji ltar skye ba dang / gzugs ji ltar 'gag pa dang / gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta bu yin par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gzugs ji ltar skye ba dang / gzugs ji ltar 'gag pa dang / gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta bu yin par rab tu shes so //
translated: They know how form arises, how form ceases, and what the real nature of form is.

original: de la ji ltar na gzugs shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na gzugs shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: “How do they know form?

original: 'di lta ste dper na dbu ba'i phung po snying po med pa ltar shin tu gsod ldong dang / shin tu gse tshags dang / shin tu snying po med par rab tu shes te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na dbu ba'i phung po snying po med pa ltar shin tu gsod ldong dang / shin tu gse tshags dang / shin tu snying po med par rab tu shes te /
translated: They know it to be like a mass of foam, which is very fragile, very insubstantial, and utterly insubstantial.

original: de ltar gzugs shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gzugs shes pa yin no //
translated: That is how they know form.

original: ji ltar gzugs kyi skye ba dang / 'jig pa shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs kyi skye ba dang / 'jig pa shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is the arising and passing away of form known?🔽Form does not come from anywhere or go anywhere.

original: gzugs ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du yang 'gro ba med pas gang nas kyang mi 'ong /
analyzed: gzugs ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du yang 'gro ba med pas gang nas kyang mi 'ong /
translated: It does not come from anywhere,

original: gang du yang mi 'gro ste /🔽gang gang nas kyang ma 'ongs pa de gang du yang ma song bar shes te /
analyzed: gang du yang mi 'gro ste / gang gang nas kyang ma 'ongs pa de gang du yang ma song bar shes te /
translated: and it does not go anywhere.

original: de ltar na gzugs kyi skye ba dang / 'jig pa shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs kyi skye ba dang / 'jig pa shes pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the arising and passing away of form is known.

original: ji ltar na gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid shes pa yin zhe na /🔽gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ni mi skye mi 'gag 'ong ba med 'gro ba med kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin /🔽rnam par byang ba ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid shes pa yin zhe na / gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ni mi skye mi 'gag 'ong ba med 'gro ba med kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin / rnam par byang ba ma yin /
translated: How is the suchness of form known?

original: 'bri ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'bri ba ma yin /
translated: The suchness of form is not produced and does not cease, does not come and does not go, is not defiled and is not purified,

original: 'phal ba ma yin te /🔽phyin ci log ma yin zhing de bzhin nyid du gnas pa ste /
