analyzed: 'phal ba ma yin te / phyin ci log ma yin zhing de bzhin nyid du gnas pa ste /
translated: is not diminished and is not increased.🔽It is not inverted and is not non-inverted.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
translated: It is thusness.

original: de ltar na gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid shes pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the suchness of form is known.

original: ji ltar na tshor ba shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na tshor ba shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that they understand feelings?

original: 'di lta ste dper na chu'i chu bur gsog tu 'dug pa skye zhing 'gag pa ltar shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na chu'i chu bur gsog tu 'dug pa skye zhing 'gag pa ltar shes pa ste /
translated: They understand that feelings are like bubbles on water, arising and ceasing.

original: de ltar na tshor ba shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na tshor ba shes pa yin no //
translated: This is how they understand feelings.

original: ji ltar na tshor ba'i skye ba dang / 'jig pa shes pa yin zhe na /🔽tshor ba ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du yang 'gro ba med pas gang nas kyang mi 'ong gang du yang mi 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na tshor ba'i skye ba dang / 'jig pa shes pa yin zhe na / tshor ba ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du yang 'gro ba med pas gang nas kyang mi 'ong gang du yang mi 'gro ba ste /
translated: How is it that they understand the arising and cessation of feelings?🔽They understand that feelings do not come from anywhere or go anywhere.

original: gang gang nas kyang ma 'ongs pa de gang du yang ma 'ongs par shes @257b pa ste ;
analyzed: gang gang nas kyang ma 'ongs pa de gang du yang ma 'ongs par shes @257b pa ste ;
translated: They understand that feelings do not come from anywhere or go anywhere.

original: de ltar na tshor ba'i skye ba dang / 'jig pa shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na tshor ba'i skye ba dang / 'jig pa shes pa yin no //
translated: This is how they understand the arising and cessation of feelings.

original: ji ltar na tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid shes pa yin zhe na /🔽tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid ni mi skye ste mi 'gag 'ong ba med 'gro ba med kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin /🔽rnam par byang ba ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid shes pa yin zhe na / tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid ni mi skye ste mi 'gag 'ong ba med 'gro ba med kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin / rnam par byang ba ma yin /
translated: How is it that they understand the suchness of feelings?

original: 'bri ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'bri ba ma yin /
translated: The suchness of feelings is unborn, unceasing, non-arriving, non-departing, not afflicted, not purified, not diminished, and not increased.

original: 'phel ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'phel ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not increasing.

original: phyin ci log ma yin zhing de bzhin nyid du gnas pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log ma yin zhing de bzhin nyid du gnas pa ste /
translated: It is not inverted, and it abides in reality.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “reality.”

original: de ltar na tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid shes pa yin no //
translated: Thus, there is knowledge of the reality of feeling.

original: ji ltar na 'du shes shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'du shes shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: “How is there knowledge of conceptualization?”

original: 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: It is like this:

original: smig rgyu la chu shin tu mi dmigs pa ltar shes pa ste /
analyzed: smig rgyu la chu shin tu mi dmigs pa ltar shes pa ste /
translated: Knowledge is like the complete non-apprehension of water in a mirage.

original: de ltar na 'du shes shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'du shes shes pa yin no //
translated: Thus, there is knowledge of conceptualization.

original: ji ltar na 'du shes kyi skye ba dang / 'jig pa shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'du shes kyi skye ba dang / 'jig pa shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: “How is there knowledge of the arising and cessation of conceptualization?”

original: 'du shes ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du yang 'gro ba med pas gang nas kyang mi 'ong gang du yang mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: 'du shes ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du yang 'gro ba med pas gang nas kyang mi 'ong gang du yang mi 'gro ste /
translated: Conceptualization does not come from anywhere or go anywhere, and so it does not come from anywhere or go anywhere.

original: gang gang nas kyang ma 'ongs pa de gang du yang ma song par shes pa ste /
analyzed: gang gang nas kyang ma 'ongs pa de gang du yang ma song par shes pa ste /
translated: That which does not come from anywhere does not go anywhere.

original: de ltar na 'du shes kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'du shes kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa shes pa yin no //
translated: Thus, there is knowledge of the arising and cessation of conceptualization.

original: ji ltar na 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one understand the suchness of perception?

original: 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid ni mi skye mi 'gag 'ong ba med 'gro ba med /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid ni mi skye mi 'gag 'ong ba med 'gro ba med /
translated: The suchness of perception is unborn, unceasing, not coming, not going,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin /🔽rnam par byang ba ma yin /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin / rnam par byang ba ma yin /
translated: not defiled,🔽not purified,

original: 'bri ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'bri ba ma yin /
translated: not diminished,

original: 'phel ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'phel ba ma yin te /
translated: and not increased.

original: de phyin ci log ma yin zhing de bzhin nyid du gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de phyin ci log ma yin zhing de bzhin nyid du gnas pa ste /
translated: It is not erroneous and abides as suchness.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called suchness.

original: de ltar na 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid shes pa yin no //
translated: Thus, one understands the suchness of perception.

original: ji ltar na 'du byed rnams shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'du byed rnams shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one understand volitions?

original: 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: It should be understood as follows:

original: chu shing gi shun pa so sor phye na snying po shin tu mi dmigs pa ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: chu shing gi shun pa so sor phye na snying po shin tu mi dmigs pa ltar shes par bya ste /
translated: Just as when the bark of a plantain tree is peeled away, the core is not found at all,

original: de ltar na 'du byed rnams shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'du byed rnams shes pa yin no //
translated: so should one understand volitions.

original: ji ltar na 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa shes pa yin zhe na ;
analyzed: ji ltar na 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa shes pa yin zhe na ;
translated: How does one understand the arising and cessation of volitions?

original: 'du byed rnams ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du yang 'gro ba med pas gang nas kyang mi 'ong /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du yang 'gro ba med pas gang nas kyang mi 'ong /
translated: Formations do not come from anywhere and do not go anywhere, so they do not come from anywhere.

original: gang du yang mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: gang du yang mi 'gro ste /
translated: They do not go anywhere.

original: gang gang nas kyang ma 'ongs pa de gang du yang ma song bar shes pa ste /
analyzed: gang gang nas kyang ma 'ongs pa de gang du yang ma song bar shes pa ste /
translated: That which does not come from anywhere does not go anywhere.

original: de ltar na 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa shes pa yin no //
translated: Thus, one understands the arising and cessation of formations.

original: ji ltar na 'du byed kyi de bzhin nyid shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'du byed kyi de bzhin nyid shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one understand the suchness of formations?

original: 'du byed kyi de bzhin nyid ni mi skye mi 'gag 'ong ba med 'gro ba med /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi de bzhin nyid ni mi skye mi 'gag 'ong ba med 'gro ba med /
translated: The suchness of formations is not produced and does not cease, does not come and does not go,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin /🔽rnam par byang ba ma yin /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin / rnam par byang ba ma yin /
translated: is not defiled🔽and is not purified,

original: 'bri ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'bri ba ma yin /
translated: does not diminish

original: 'phel ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'phel ba ma yin te /
translated: and does not increase.

original: phyin ci log ma yin zhing de bzhin nyid du gnas pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log ma yin zhing de bzhin nyid du gnas pa ste /
translated: It is not erroneous and abides as suchness.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //🔽de ltar na 'du byed rnams @258a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid ces bya'o // de ltar na 'du byed rnams @258a * //
translated: Therefore, it is called suchness.

original: kyi de bzhin nyid shes pa yin no //
analyzed: kyi de bzhin nyid shes pa yin no //
translated: Thus, one understands the suchness of formations.

original: ji ltar na rnam par shes pa shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam par shes pa shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is consciousness known?

original: 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: It is like

original: sgyu ma byed par sprul pa'i dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa ltar shes pa ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma byed par sprul pa'i dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa ltar shes pa ste /
translated: an illusory army of four divisions conjured up by a magician.

original: de ltar na rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par shes pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is consciousness.

original: ji ltar na rnam par shes pa'i skye ba dang 'jig pa shes pa yin zhe na ;
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam par shes pa'i skye ba dang 'jig pa shes pa yin zhe na ;
translated: How is the arising and passing away of consciousness known?🔽Consciousness does not come from anywhere or go anywhere.

original: rnam par shes pa ni gang gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du yang 'gro ba med pas gang nas kyang mi 'ong ba gang du yang mi 'gro ba ste /🔽gang gang nas kyang ma 'ongs pa de gang du yang ma song bar shes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni gang gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing gang du yang 'gro ba med pas gang nas kyang mi 'ong ba gang du yang mi 'gro ba ste / gang gang nas kyang ma 'ongs pa de gang du yang ma song bar shes pa ste /
translated: It does not come from anywhere or go anywhere.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa'i skye ba dang 'jig pa shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa'i skye ba dang 'jig pa shes pa yin no //
translated: This is the knowledge of the arising and passing away of consciousness.

original: ji ltar na rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid shes pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid shes pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is the suchness of consciousness known?

original: rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ni mi skye mi 'gag 'ong ba med 'gro ba med /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ni mi skye mi 'gag 'ong ba med 'gro ba med /
translated: The suchness of consciousness is not produced or stopped, does not come or go,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin /🔽rnam par byang ba ma yin /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin / rnam par byang ba ma yin /
translated: It is not defiled.🔽It is not purified.

original: 'bri ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'bri ba ma yin /
translated: It is not diminished.

original: 'phel ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'phel ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not increased.

original: phyin ci log ma yin zhing de bzhin nyid du gnas pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log ma yin zhing de bzhin nyid du gnas pa ste /
translated: It is not inverted, and it abides in reality.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “suchness.”

original: de ltar na rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid shes pa yin no //
translated: Thus, there is knowledge of the suchness of consciousness.

original: ji ltar na skye mched rnams shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na skye mched rnams shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: “How is there knowledge of the sense bases?

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid rnams ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid rnams kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid rnams ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid rnams kyis stong ngo //
translated: The eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are empty of the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: nang gi chos rnams ni nang gi chos rnams kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: nang gi chos rnams ni nang gi chos rnams kyis stong ngo //
translated: Inner phenomena are empty of inner phenomena.

original: phyi'i chos rnams kyang phyi'i chos rnams kyis stong par shes te /
analyzed: phyi'i chos rnams kyang phyi'i chos rnams kyis stong par shes te /
translated: Outer phenomena are empty of outer phenomena.

original: de ltar na skye mched rnams shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na skye mched rnams shes pa yin no //
translated: Thus, there is knowledge of the sense bases.

original: ji ltar na khams rnams shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na khams rnams shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: “How is there knowledge of the constituents?

original: mig gi khams kyang mig gi khams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: mig gi khams kyang mig gi khams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The eye constituent is empty of the intrinsic nature of the eye constituent.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyang gzugs kyi khams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyang gzugs kyi khams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The form constituent is empty of the intrinsic nature of the form constituent.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The eye consciousness constituent is empty of the intrinsic nature of the eye consciousness constituent.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi khams kyang yid kyi khams rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi khams kyang yid kyi khams rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking-mind constituents are empty of the intrinsic nature of the thinking-mind constituent.

original: chos kyi khams kyang chos kyi khams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi khams kyang chos kyi khams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The mental-object constituent is empty of the intrinsic nature of the mental-object constituent.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar shes te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar shes te /
translated: The thinking-mind consciousness constituent is empty of the intrinsic nature of the thinking-mind consciousness constituent.

original: de ltar na khams rnams shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na khams rnams shes pa yin no //
translated: That is the knowledge of the constituents.

original: sa'i khams ni sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: sa'i khams ni sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The earth element is empty of the intrinsic nature of the earth element.

original: de bzhin du chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rang gi ngo bos stong par shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rang gi ngo bos stong par shes so //
translated: In the same way, the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element are known to be empty of their own intrinsic reality.

original: ji ltar na rten cing @258b 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa yin zhe na /🔽rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med par shes pa dang / de bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gag pa med pa dang / chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa dang / don gcig pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar na rten cing @258b 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa yin zhe na / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med par shes pa dang / de bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gag pa med pa dang / chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa dang / don gcig pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: “How is dependent origination known?”

original: don tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa dang / spros pa dang bral zhing zhi bar shes pa de ltar na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa yin no //
analyzed: don tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa dang / spros pa dang bral zhing zhi bar shes pa de ltar na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa yin no //
translated: Dependent origination is known to be unborn, and in the same way, dependent origination is known to be unceasing, not annihilated, not permanent, not identical, not different, not coming, not going, free from mental proliferation, and peaceful.

original: ji ltar na 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: “How are the noble truths known?”

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa shes pa yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa shes pa yin /
translated: The noble truth of suffering is known.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa shes pa yin te /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa shes pa yin te /
translated: It is the knowledge of the noble truth of the origin, of the noble truth of cessation, and of the noble truth of the path leading to cessation.

original: ji ltar na sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the knowledge of the noble truth of suffering?

original: sdug bsngal shes pa yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa yin /
translated: It is the knowledge of suffering.

original: bden pa shes pa yin /
analyzed: bden pa shes pa yin /
translated: It is the knowledge of the truth.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa shes pa yin /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa shes pa yin /
translated: It is the knowledge of the noble truth.

original: gnyis las rnams par grol ba 'phags pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis las rnams par grol ba 'phags pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: It is the noble truth of the liberation from duality.

original: gnyis su med pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba shes pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba shes pa yin no //
translated: It is the knowledge that non-duality is called the noble truth.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa shes pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, it is the knowledge of the noble truth of the origin, of the noble truth of cessation, and of the noble truth of the path leading to cessation.

original: de ltar na 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams shes pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is the knowledge of the noble truths.

original: ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi de bzhin nyid shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi de bzhin nyid shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the knowledge of the suchness of suffering?

original: sdug bsngal gyi de bzhin nyid ni ma nor ba zhes bya bar shes pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi de bzhin nyid ni ma nor ba zhes bya bar shes pa yin no //
translated: It is the knowledge that the suchness of suffering is non-erroneous.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba ba dang ; 'gog pa dang / lam gyi de bzhin nyid kyang rab tu shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba ba dang ; 'gog pa dang / lam gyi de bzhin nyid kyang rab tu shes pa yin te /
translated: Likewise, he knows the suchness of the origination of suffering, of the cessation of suffering, and of the path.

original: de ltar na 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid shes pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he knows the suchness of the four noble truths.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Lord, if a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: phan tshun tha dad pa'i chos de dag de ltar 'tshal na /
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad pa'i chos de dag de ltar 'tshal na /
translated: knows those phenomena that are mutually different in that way,

original: des chos kyi dbyings rnam par dkrugs par mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: des chos kyi dbyings rnam par dkrugs par mi 'gyur ram /
translated: won’t he confuse the dharma-constituent?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor gal te chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos la la zhig yod na ni rnam par dkrugs par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos la la zhig yod na ni rnam par dkrugs par yang 'gyur te /
translated: Subhūti, if there were any phenomena not included in the dharma-constituent, then there would be confusion.

original: rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan gang yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan gang yang mi dmigs so //
translated: Subhūti, no other phenomenon is observed apart from the dharma-constituent.

original: gal te dmigs na ni chos kyi dbyings kyang rnam par dkrugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dmigs na ni chos kyi dbyings kyang rnam par dkrugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were observed, the dharma-constituent would be disturbed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: Subhūti, no phenomenon is observed by a tathāgata,

original: byang chub sems dpa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'am /
translated: a bodhisattva,

original: rang sangs rgyas sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas sam /
translated: a pratyekabuddha,

original: @259a * // de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyis dbyings sum gtogs pa'i chos gang yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: @259a * // de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyis dbyings sum gtogs pa'i chos gang yang mi dmigs so //
translated: or a śrāvaka of the Tathāgata that is not included in the dharma-constituent.

original: de ltar mi dmigs pas chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan no zhes btags pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs pas chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan no zhes btags pa med do //
translated: Since it is not observed in that way, there is no designation of ‘another phenomenon that is not included in the dharma-constituent.’

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i chos kyi dbyings la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i chos kyi dbyings la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom in that way should train in the dharma-constituent.”

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti then inquired,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi dbyings la slob pas gang la bslab par 'gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi dbyings la slob pas gang la bslab par 'gyur /
translated: “Blessed One, if bodhisattva great beings train in the expanse of reality, what do they train in?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni chos thams cad la bslab par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni chos thams cad la bslab par 'gyur te /
translated: “Su­bhūti, bodhisattva great beings who practice the expanse of reality will train in all things.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: Su­bhūti, it is because all things are the expanse of reality.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings lags /
translated: ” “Blessed One, why are all things the expanse of reality?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
translated: “Su­bhūti, it is like this:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: Whether the tathāgatas have appeared or not,

original: dbyer med pa'i tshul gyis chos rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings ni de bzhin nyid du gnas pa ste /
analyzed: dbyer med pa'i tshul gyis chos rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings ni de bzhin nyid du gnas pa ste /
translated: the expanse of reality of all things remains just as it is, in a manner that is indivisible.

original: rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Su­bhūti, the expanse of reality is as follows:

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang ; zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i chos dang /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang ; zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i chos dang /
translated: the wholesome and the unwholesome, the mundane and the supramundane, the contaminated and the uncontaminated, the reprehensible and the irreproachable,

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad de rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa chos kyi dbyings la slob pas chos thams cad la bslab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad de rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa chos kyi dbyings la slob pas chos thams cad la bslab par 'gyur ro //
translated: the conditioned and the unconditioned—in all these phenomena, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings training in the expanse of reality train in all phenomena.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings lags na /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings lags na /
translated: Subhūti then asked, “Blessed One, if all phenomena are the expanse of reality,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ji ltar gzugs la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ji ltar gzugs la bslab par bgyi /
translated: how should bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom train in form?

original: ji ltar tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness?

original: ji ltar skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination?

original: ji ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the perfection of giving?

original: ji ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin @259b pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin @259b pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar nang stong pa nyid la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar nang stong pa nyid la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in inner emptiness?

original: ji ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in . . . up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature?

original: ji ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la bslab par bgyi ;
analyzed: ji ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la bslab par bgyi ;
translated: How should they train in the four establishments of mindfulness?

original: ji ltar yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la bslab par bgyi /🔽ji ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la bslab par bgyi / ji ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: How should they train in the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path?🔽How should they train in the four noble truths, the four meditative concentrations, the four immeasurable aspirations, the four formless absorptions, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la bslab par bgyi /
translated: signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the six forms of supernatural knowledge, all the meditative stabilities, and all the dhāraṇī gateways?

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen po dang /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen po dang /
translated: “How should they train in the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, great loving kindness, great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity?

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la bslab par bgyi /
translated: “How should they train in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha?

original: ji ltar mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yongs su grub par bgyi ba la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yongs su grub par bgyi ba la bslab par bgyi /
translated: “How should they train in the thirty-two major marks of a great being and the eighty minor marks?

original: ji ltar rgyal rigs che zhing mtho ba'i rigs su skye bar bgyi ba la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal rigs che zhing mtho ba'i rigs su skye bar bgyi ba la bslab par bgyi /
translated: “How should they train in being born into a great and high family of the ruling class?

original: ji ltar bram ze'i rigs che zhing mtho ba'i rigs dang / ji ltar khyim bdag gi rigs che zhing mtho pa'i rigs su skye bar bgyi ba la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar bram ze'i rigs che zhing mtho ba'i rigs dang / ji ltar khyim bdag gi rigs che zhing mtho pa'i rigs su skye bar bgyi ba la bslab par bgyi /
translated: “How should they train in being born into a great and high family of brahmins, and how should they train in being born into a great and high family of householders?

original: ji ltar rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lhar skye bar bgyi ba dang / sum cu rtsa gsum dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lhar skye bar bgyi ba dang / sum cu rtsa gsum dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang /
translated: “I will train in order to be born among the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm, and among the gods of the Trayas­triṃśa, Yāmā, Tuṣita, Nirmāṇa­rata, Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin, Brahmakāyika, Brahmapurohita,

original: tshangs 'khor dang / tshangs chen dang / snang ba dang / 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal dang / dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas dang / sprin med dang / bsod nams skyes dang / 'bras su che ba dang /
analyzed: tshangs 'khor dang / tshangs chen dang / snang ba dang / 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal dang / dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas dang / sprin med dang / bsod nams skyes dang / 'bras su che ba dang /
translated: Brahmapārṣadya, Mahābrahma, Parīttābha, Apramāṇābha, Ābhāsvara, Parīttaśubha, Apramāṇaśubha, Śubhakṛtsna, Anabhraka, Puṇyaprasava, Bṛhatphala,🔽and the non-percipient gods.

original: 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyi lha rnams su skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi /🔽ji ltar gnas @260a * //🔽gtsang ma'i ris kyi lhar skye bar bgyi ba la bslab cing /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyi lha rnams su skye bar bgyi ba'i slad du bslab par bgyi / ji ltar gnas @260a * // gtsang ma'i ris kyi lhar skye bar bgyi ba la bslab cing /
translated: “I will train in order to be born among the gods of the Śuddhāvāsa realm,

original: der yang mi skye bar bgyi /
analyzed: der yang mi skye bar bgyi /
translated: and I will not be born there.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched kyi lhar skye bar bgyi ba la bslab cing der yang mi skye bar bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched kyi lhar skye bar bgyi ba la bslab cing der yang mi skye bar bgyi /
translated: How should they train in order to be reborn as gods in the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sphere of nothingness, and the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, and not be reborn there?

original: ji ltar sems dang po bskyed pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar sems dang po bskyed pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the first generation of the mind of awakening?

original: ji ltar sems bskyed pa gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / lnga pa dang / drug pa dang / bdun pa dang / brgyad pa dang / dgu pa dang / sems bskyed pa bcu pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar sems bskyed pa gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / lnga pa dang / drug pa dang / bdun pa dang / brgyad pa dang / dgu pa dang / sems bskyed pa bcu pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the second, third, fourth, fifth, sixth, seventh, eighth, ninth, and tenth generations of the mind of awakening?

original: ji ltar nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the level of the hearers and the level of the solitary buddhas?

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyi ba la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyi ba la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the faultlessness of the bodhisattvas, in bringing sentient beings to maturity, and in purifying a buddhafield?

original: ji ltar byang chub kyi lam la bslabs shing chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du btsal bar bgyi ba'i byang chub kyi lam la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub kyi lam la bslabs shing chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du btsal bar bgyi ba'i byang chub kyi lam la bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the bodhisattva path and how should they train in the bodhisattva path by which they should investigate all phenomena in all their aspects?

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gzugs la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gzugs la bslab par bgyi /
translated: Blessed One, if bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should train in form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnams par shes pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnams par shes pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: they should train in feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness;

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la bslab par bgyi /
translated: they should train in the sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination;

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: they should train in the perfection of generosity;

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: and the perfection of wisdom.

original: nang stong pa nyid la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la bslab par bgyi /
translated: “We should train in inner emptiness,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid bar la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid bar la bslab par bgyi /
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la bslab par bgyi /
translated: We should train in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening,🔽the four noble truths,🔽the four concentrations,🔽the four immeasurables,🔽the four formless absorptions,🔽the eight deliverances,🔽the nine serial absorptions,🔽the emptiness gate of liberation,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the signlessness gate of liberation,🔽and the wishlessness gate of liberation.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la bslab par bgyi /
translated: They should train in the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and in the meditative stabilizations, dhāraṇī gateways,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / @260b so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / @260b so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la bslab par bgyi /
translated: and the powers, fearlessnesses, detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bslab par bgyi /
translated: They should train in the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, and the result of non-returner.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub la bslab par bgyi /
translated: They should train in the state of a worthy one and in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la bslab par bgyi na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la bslab par bgyi na /
translated: They should train in the knowledge of all aspects up to

original: bcom ldan 'das de'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyin ci log la spyod pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyin ci log la spyod pa'am /
translated: Blessed One, for that reason, bodhisattva great beings will not engage in error,

original: mi spro ba spro bar bgyid par mi 'gyur ba lags grang /
analyzed: mi spro ba spro bar bgyid par mi 'gyur ba lags grang /
translated: or will not be inspired to be inspired.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Blessed One, why is that?

original: chos kyi dbyings la ni rnam par rtog pa de dag ma mchis te /🔽gzugs kyang chos kyi dbyings ma lags /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la ni rnam par rtog pa de dag ma mchis te / gzugs kyang chos kyi dbyings ma lags /
translated: Because those concepts do not exist in the dharma-constituent.🔽Form is not the dharma-constituent.

original: gzugs las gud na yang chos kyi dbyings ma mchis te /🔽gzugs nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: gzugs las gud na yang chos kyi dbyings ma mchis te / gzugs nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The dharma-constituent is not other than form.🔽Form itself is the dharma-constituent.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyang gzugs so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyang gzugs so //
translated: The dharma-constituent itself is form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang chos kyi dbyings ma lags /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang chos kyi dbyings ma lags /
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not the dharma-constituent.

original: rnam par shes pa las gud na yang chos kyi dbyings ma mchis te /🔽rnam par shes pa nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las gud na yang chos kyi dbyings ma mchis te / rnam par shes pa nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The dharma-constituent is not other than consciousness.🔽Consciousness itself is the dharma-constituent.

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The dharma-constituent itself is consciousness.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang chos kyi dbyings ma lags /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang chos kyi dbyings ma lags /
translated: The sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination are not the dharma-constituent.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las gud na yang chos kyi dbyings ma mchis te /🔽rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las gud na yang chos kyi dbyings ma mchis te / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The dharma-constituent is not other than dependent origination.🔽Dependent origination itself is the dharma-constituent.

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang chos kyi dbyings ma lags /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o // pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang chos kyi dbyings ma lags /
translated: The dharma-constituent itself is dependent origination.🔽The perfections, the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are not the dharma-constituent.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos las gud na yang chos kyi dbyings ma mchis te /🔽byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos las gud na yang chos kyi dbyings ma mchis te / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The dharma-constituent is not other than the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.🔽The thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are the dharma-constituent.

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams so //
translated: The dharma-constituent itself is the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the meditative stabilities, the immeasurable aspirations, the formless meditative stabilizations, the liberations, the serial absorptions, emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyang chos kyi dbyings ma lags /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyang chos kyi dbyings ma lags /
translated: signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways are not the dharma-constituent;

original: @261a * // gzungs kyi sgo rnams las gud na yang chos kyi dbyings ma mchis te /🔽gzungs kyi sgo nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: @261a * // gzungs kyi sgo rnams las gud na yang chos kyi dbyings ma mchis te / gzungs kyi sgo nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: the dharma-constituent is not other than the dhāraṇī gateways;🔽the dhāraṇī gateways themselves are the dharma-constituent;

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang gzungs kyi sgo rnams so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang gzungs kyi sgo rnams so //
translated: and the dharma-constituent itself is the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang ; byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang chos kyi dbyings ma lags /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang ; byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang chos kyi dbyings ma lags /
translated: the powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are not the dharma-constituent.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams las gud na yang chos kyi dbyings ma mchis te /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams las gud na yang chos kyi dbyings ma mchis te / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The dharma-constituent is not other than the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽The eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are the dharma-constituent.

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so //
translated: The dharma-constituent itself is the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub kyang chos kyi dbyings ma lags /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub kyang chos kyi dbyings ma lags /
translated: The result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, and a pratyekabuddha’s awakening are not the dharma-constituent.

original: rang byang chub las gud na yang chos kyi dbyings ma mchis te /
analyzed: rang byang chub las gud na yang chos kyi dbyings ma mchis te /
translated: The dharma-constituent is not other than a pratyekabuddha’s awakening.

original: rang byang chub nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: rang byang chub nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: and the reality-limit is also the element of the Tathāgata.

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang rang byang chub bo //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang chos kyi dbyings ma lags /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las gud na yang chos kyi dbyings ma mchis te /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang rang byang chub bo // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang chos kyi dbyings ma lags / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las gud na yang chos kyi dbyings ma mchis te / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The element of the Tathāgata is also the reality-limit.🔽The reality-limit is also the element of the Tathāgata.🔽The element of the Tathāgata is also the Dharma element.🔽The Dharma element is also the element of the Tathāgata.🔽The element of the Tathāgata is also the perfection of giving.

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: The perfection of giving is also the element of the Tathāgata.🔽The element of the Tathāgata is also the perfection of morality, patience, perseverance, and concentration.🔽The perfection of concentration is also the element of the Tathāgata.

original: de de bzhin te /🔽ji skad du smras pa de bzhin no //🔽gzugs nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: de de bzhin te / ji skad du smras pa de bzhin no // gzugs nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The element of the Tathāgata is also the perfection of wisdom.🔽The perfection of wisdom is also the element of the Tathāgata.🔽The element of the Tathāgata is also the emptiness of form.

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang gzugs so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang gzugs so //
translated: The emptiness of form is also the element of the Tathāgata.🔽The element of the Tathāgata is also the emptiness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.🔽The emptiness of consciousness is also the element of the Tathāgata.🔽The element of the Tathāgata is also the emptiness of the eyes.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The emptiness of the eyes is also the element of the Tathāgata.🔽The element of the Tathāgata is also the emptiness of the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind.🔽The emptiness of the mind is also the element of the Tathāgata.🔽The element of the Tathāgata is also the emptiness of a form.🔽The emptiness of a form is also the element of the Tathāgata.🔽The element of the Tathāgata is also the emptiness of a sound, a smell, a taste, a feeling, and a dharma.🔽The emptiness of a dharma is also the element of the Tathāgata.🔽The element of the Tathāgata is also the emptiness of the eye constituent.🔽The emptiness of the eye constituent is also the element of the Tathāgata.🔽The element of the Tathāgata is also the emptiness of the form constituent, the eye consciousness constituent, and the eye contact constituent.🔽The emptiness of eye contact is also the element of the Tathāgata.🔽The element of the Tathāgata is also the emptiness of the ear constituent,

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The realm of phenomena is also consciousness.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The sense sources, elements, and dependent origination are also the realm of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The realm of phenomena is also dependent origination.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The perfections, all the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven aspects of awakening are also the realm of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams so //
translated: The realm of phenomena is also the aspects of awakening.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa @261b dang ; mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa @261b dang ; mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: The noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The doors of retention, the dhāraṇīs, are also the realm of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang gzungs kyi sgo rnams so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang gzungs kyi sgo rnams so //
translated: The realm of phenomena itself is the doors of retention.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang ; mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang ; mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are also the realm of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so //
translated: The realm of phenomena itself is the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub nyid kyang chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, and a pratyekabuddha’s awakening are also the realm of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang rang byang chub bo //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang rang byang chub bo //
translated: The realm of phenomena itself is a pratyekabuddha’s awakening.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: up to and the knowledge of all aspects is the dharma-constituent.

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do ;🔽/ rab 'byor gal te yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do ; / rab 'byor gal te yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: The dharma-constituent itself is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan 'ga' zhig mthong na ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gnas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan 'ga' zhig mthong na ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gnas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Subhūti, if bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom were to see any dharma other than the dharma-constituent, they would not stand in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: chos thams cad ni chos kyi dbyings yin pas /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni chos kyi dbyings yin pas /
translated: Because all dharmas are the dharma-constituent.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Therefore, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings su shes nas chos thams cad ming med pa la ming gi brdas chos ston te /
analyzed: chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings su shes nas chos thams cad ming med pa la ming gi brdas chos ston te /
translated: know all dharmas as the dharma-constituent, they teach the Dharma with the conventional term of a name for all dharmas that are without names.

original: 'di ni gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang ; rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang ; rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.

original: 'di dag ni skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination.

original: 'di dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams so //
translated: These are the noble truths.🔽These are the concentrations, immeasurables, formless absorptions, eight liberations, nine serial absorptions, emptiness,

original: bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / @262a * //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / @262a * //
translated: and wishlessness; and the higher knowledges, meditative stabilizations,

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: and dhāraṇī gateways.

original: 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so //
translated: These are the powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽This is called up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar zhes bya'o zhes chos ston to zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba rtogs pa la 'god pa'i phrin las yin no /
analyzed: 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar zhes bya'o zhes chos ston to zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba rtogs pa la 'god pa'i phrin las yin no /
translated: This is the deeds of establishing in the realization of affliction and purification.

original: // / rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na sgyu ma'i mkhan po'am sgyu ma byed pa'i mtshan bu mkhas pa zhig gis rdzas kyi rnam pa 'ga' zhig la brten te /
analyzed: // / rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na sgyu ma'i mkhan po'am sgyu ma byed pa'i mtshan bu mkhas pa zhig gis rdzas kyi rnam pa 'ga' zhig la brten te /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this: a magician or magician’s apprentice, having relied on some kind of substance,

original: gzugs kyi bye brag sna tshogs 'di lta ste /🔽glang po'i gzugs sam /
analyzed: gzugs kyi bye brag sna tshogs 'di lta ste / glang po'i gzugs sam /
translated: creates various kinds of forms, such as🔽an elephant form,

original: rta'i gzugs sam /🔽ba lang gi gzugs sam /
analyzed: rta'i gzugs sam / ba lang gi gzugs sam /
translated: a horse form,🔽an ox form,

original: rnga mo dang lug gi gzugs sam /
analyzed: rnga mo dang lug gi gzugs sam /
translated: a camel or sheep form,

original: skyes pa dang / bud med dang / khye'u dang / bu mo'i gzugs sam /
analyzed: skyes pa dang / bud med dang / khye'u dang / bu mo'i gzugs sam /
translated: the forms of men, women, boys, and girls,

original: skyed mos tshal lam /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal lam /
translated: or gardens,

original: gzhal med khang dang / dka' thub kyi nags tshal dang / kun dga'i ra ba mdangs dga' ba dang / rdzing bu mdangs dga' ba dang / nags tshal mdangs dga' ba dag sprul zhing de dag tu bstan /
analyzed: gzhal med khang dang / dka' thub kyi nags tshal dang / kun dga'i ra ba mdangs dga' ba dang / rdzing bu mdangs dga' ba dang / nags tshal mdangs dga' ba dag sprul zhing de dag tu bstan /
translated: or palaces, or forests for ascetics, or delightful parks, or delightful ponds, or delightful groves, and then show them to those beings.

original: 'khor gyi stan dang / gzhi rnam pa sna tshogs bting ste /
analyzed: 'khor gyi stan dang / gzhi rnam pa sna tshogs bting ste /
translated: They spread out various kinds of seats and foundations,

original: me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / kha zas dang / spyan gzigs zhim po dag bstan tam /
analyzed: me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / kha zas dang / spyan gzigs zhim po dag bstan tam /
translated: and show them to those beings, and they show them delightful flowers, garlands, perfumes, ointments, foods, and drinks,

original: glu dang sil snyan gyis skye bo dga' bar byas sam /
analyzed: glu dang sil snyan gyis skye bo dga' bar byas sam /
translated: and they delight beings with songs and music,

original: sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'am /
analyzed: sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'am /
translated: and they give gifts,

original: tshul khrims srung ba'am /🔽bzod pa sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims srung ba'am / bzod pa sgrub pa'am /
translated: and they guard morality,🔽and they cultivate patience,

original: brtson 'grus rtsom pa'am /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom pa'am /
translated: and they undertake perseverance,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par rtse ba'am /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par rtse ba'am /
translated: and they play with meditative stabilization,

original: shes rab sgom pa'am /
analyzed: shes rab sgom pa'am /
translated: and they cultivate wisdom,

original: rnam pa de lta bu dag gis skye bo dga' bar byas te /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu dag gis skye bo dga' bar byas te /
translated: and they delight beings with such kinds of things.

original: rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i rigs bstan tam /
analyzed: rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i rigs bstan tam /
translated: the kṣatriya caste like a great sāla tree,

original: bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i rigs dang / khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i rigs bstan tam /
analyzed: bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i rigs dang / khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i rigs bstan tam /
translated: the brahmin caste like a great sāla tree, the householder caste like a great sāla tree,

original: ri rab bstan tam /
analyzed: ri rab bstan tam /
translated: or Mount Sumeru,

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams bstan tam /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams bstan tam /
translated: the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika gods,

original: sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang ; 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs rigs dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang / tshangs 'khor dang / tshangs chen dang / 'od chung dang /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang ; 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs rigs dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang / tshangs 'khor dang / tshangs chen dang / 'od chung dang /
translated: the Trāyastriṃśa gods, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇa­rata gods, the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin gods, the Brahmakāyika gods, the Brahmapurohita gods, the Brahmapārṣadya gods, the Mahābrahma gods, the Parīttābha gods,

original: tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal dang / dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas dang / sprin med dang / gsod nas skyes dang / 'bras @262b bu che dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyi lha rnams stan tam /
analyzed: tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal dang / dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas dang / sprin med dang / gsod nas skyes dang / 'bras @262b bu che dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyi lha rnams stan tam /
translated: the Apramāṇābha gods, the Ābhāsvara gods, the Parīttaśubha gods, the Apramāṇaśubha gods, the Śubhakṛtsna gods, the Anabhraka gods, the Puṇyaprasava gods, the Bṛhatphala gods, the Asaṃjñisattva gods,

original: mi che ba'i lha rnams bstan tam /
analyzed: mi che ba'i lha rnams bstan tam /
translated: or the Vrhatphalas gods?

original: mi gdung ba'i lha rnams bstan tam /
analyzed: mi gdung ba'i lha rnams bstan tam /
translated: or the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife,🔽or the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, or the gods of the Heaven of Yama, or the gods of the Joyous Heaven, or the gods of the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, or the gods of the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations, or the gods of the Brahma Heavens, or the gods of the Heaven of Limited Radiance, or the gods of the Heaven of Boundless Radiance, or the gods of the Heaven of Luster, or the gods of the Heaven of the Cloudless, or the gods of the Heaven of Merit, or the gods of the Heaven of Great Fruition, or the gods of the Heaven of Clear Light, or the gods of the Heaven of Merit Born of Others’ Actions, or the gods of the Heaven of Great Result, or the gods of the Heaven of Manifest Action, or the gods of the Heaven of Great Reward, or the gods of the Heaven of Not Greater, or the gods of the Heaven of Not Lower, or the gods of the Heaven of No Hardship,

original: legs mthong gi lha rnams dang / rab lta'i lha rnams dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams bstan tam /
analyzed: legs mthong gi lha rnams dang / rab lta'i lha rnams dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams bstan tam /
translated: or the gods of the Heaven of Excellent Vision, or the gods of the Heaven of Excellent View, or the gods of the Highest Heaven,

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lha gzugs med pa rnams bstan tam /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lha gzugs med pa rnams bstan tam /
translated: or the gods of the Sphere of Infinite Space, or the gods of the Sphere of Infinite Consciousness, or the gods of the Sphere of Nothingness, or the gods of the Sphere of Neither Perception nor No Perception,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas mang po bstan tam /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas mang po bstan tam /
translated: or the stream enterers, or the once-returners, or the nonreturners, or the arhats, or the pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: or the bodhisattva great beings from the first generation of the mind of awakening

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: They are the perfection of generosity, the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of meditative concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyems par 'jug pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyems par 'jug pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: and the perfection of wisdom. They are the emptinesses, the factors of awakening, the meditative concentrations, the liberations, the meditative stabilizations, and the absorptions.

original: sa dang po yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / sa bcu pa'i bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyen med pa dang / mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / mngon par shes pa de dag gis rnam par rtse zhing 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: sa dang po yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / sa bcu pa'i bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyen med pa dang / mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / mngon par shes pa de dag gis rnam par rtse zhing 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar byed pa dang /
translated: It is to perfect the first bhumi up to the tenth bhumi. It is to be without the pride of a bodhisattva. It is to accomplish the superknowledges. It is to play with those superknowledges and illuminate the world systems.

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa dang / yan lag dang nying lag yongs su gtong pa dang / spyad par dka' ba'i spyad pa spyod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams yongs su sgrub pa dang /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa dang / yan lag dang nying lag yongs su gtong pa dang / spyad par dka' ba'i spyad pa spyod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams yongs su sgrub pa dang /
translated: It is to ripen beings. It is to purify a buddha realm. It is to give away one’s major and minor body parts. It is to practice difficult practices. It is to accomplish the powers of the tathagatas.

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams yongs su sgrub pa dang / snying rje chen po yongs su sgrub pa de dag bstan tam /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams yongs su sgrub pa dang / snying rje chen po yongs su sgrub pa de dag bstan tam /
translated: He demonstrates the accomplishment of the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha, and great compassion.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku yan lag dang nying lag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bstan na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku yan lag dang nying lag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bstan na /
translated: He demonstrates the complete body of the Buddha, with all its major and minor marks.

original: de la sems can byis pa'i ngang tshul can dag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la sems can byis pa'i ngang tshul can dag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then, the childish beings think,

original: kye ma mi 'dis legs par bslabs pa ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: kye ma mi 'dis legs par bslabs pa ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: “Oh, this person is well trained. How amazing!

original: re mdzes dag byed /
analyzed: re mdzes dag byed /
translated: He is so beautiful!

original: de ltar skye bo dga' bar byed cing /🔽gzugs kyi bye brag @263a * //
analyzed: de ltar skye bo dga' bar byed cing / gzugs kyi bye brag @263a * //
translated: He delights the people in this way,

original: sna tshogs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs 'di lta ste /
translated: demonstrating various different forms,🔽such as the form of an elephant, the form of a horse,
