original: glang po'i gzugs dang / rta'i gzugs dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i bar du ston pa ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes ngo mtshar cher 'dzin to //
analyzed: glang po'i gzugs dang / rta'i gzugs dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i bar du ston pa ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes ngo mtshar cher 'dzin to //
translated: up to the complete body of the Buddha, with all its major and minor marks. How amazing!”

original: de la skyes bu mkhas shing gsal ba yid rno ba dang ldan pa spyod pa dam pa dang ldan pa rnams ni 'di snyam ste /
analyzed: de la skyes bu mkhas shing gsal ba yid rno ba dang ldan pa spyod pa dam pa dang ldan pa rnams ni 'di snyam ste /
translated: The wise, the clear, the intelligent, the noble ones think as follows:

original: 'di la chos gang yang dmigs su med na mi 'di de ltar med pa'i chos kyis skye bo mang po 'di dag dga' bar byed pa ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos so snyam ste /
analyzed: 'di la chos gang yang dmigs su med na mi 'di de ltar med pa'i chos kyis skye bo mang po 'di dag dga' bar byed pa ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos so snyam ste /
translated: “If no phenomenon is apprehended here, then it is amazing and marvelous that this person delights this great crowd of people with a nonexistent phenomenon.”

original: sems can de dag ni dngos po med pa la dngos por 'du shes pa'o zhes bya bar de dag gis shes par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems can de dag ni dngos po med pa la dngos por 'du shes pa'o zhes bya bar de dag gis shes par 'byung ngo //
translated: They know that those sentient beings have the notion of a thing with regard to a nonthing.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos gang yang mi mthong ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos gang yang mi mthong ste /
translated: they do not see any phenomenon that is not included in the dharma-constituent.

original: thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed kyang /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed kyang /
translated: With skillful means they bring sentient beings to maturity.

original: sems can mi dmigs sems can du gdags pa yang mi dmigs te zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams don ji lta ba bzhin du 'god pa'i phrin las yin no /
analyzed: sems can mi dmigs sems can du gdags pa yang mi dmigs te zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams don ji lta ba bzhin du 'god pa'i phrin las yin no /
translated: Not observing sentient beings and not observing the designation of sentient beings is the activity of establishing sentient beings in their true goal.

original: // / de bdag kyang sbyin pa gtong ba yin /
analyzed: // / de bdag kyang sbyin pa gtong ba yin /
translated: I myself give gifts.

original: gzhan yang sbyin pa la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyin pa la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: I encourage others to give gifts.

original: sbyin pa'i legs pa brjod pa yin /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i legs pa brjod pa yin /
translated: I speak in praise of giving gifts.

original: sems can gang sbyin pa gtong ba de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byed pa yin /
analyzed: sems can gang sbyin pa gtong ba de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byed pa yin /
translated: I speak in praise of those who give gifts, welcoming it with words of joy.

original: bdag kyang tshul khrims srung ba yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang tshul khrims srung ba yin /
translated: I myself maintain ethical discipline.

original: gzhan yang tshul khrims la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang tshul khrims la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: I encourage others to maintain ethical discipline.

original: tshul khrims kyi legs pa brjod pa yin /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi legs pa brjod pa yin /
translated: I speak in praise of maintaining ethical discipline.

original: sems can gzhan gang tshul khrims srung ba de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gang tshul khrims srung ba de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /
translated: I speak in praise of those who maintain ethical discipline, welcoming it with words of joy.

original: bdag kyang bzod pa sgom pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang bzod pa sgom pa yin /
translated: I myself cultivate patience.

original: gzhan yang bzod pa sgom pa la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang bzod pa sgom pa la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: I encourage others to cultivate patience.

original: bzod pa'i legs pa brjod pa yin /
analyzed: bzod pa'i legs pa brjod pa yin /
translated: I praise the virtues of patience.

original: sems can gzhan gang bzod pa sgom pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gang bzod pa sgom pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /
translated: I rejoice in the patience of others.

original: bdag kyang brtson 'grus rtsom pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang brtson 'grus rtsom pa yin /
translated: I myself make an effort at diligence.

original: gzhan yang brtson 'grus rtsom pa la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang brtson 'grus rtsom pa la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: I encourage others to make an effort at diligence.

original: brtson 'grus kyi legs pa brjod pa yin /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi legs pa brjod pa yin /
translated: I praise the virtues of diligence.

original: sems can gzhan gang brtson 'grus rtsom 'grus rtsom pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gang brtson 'grus rtsom 'grus rtsom pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /
translated: I rejoice in the diligence of others.

original: bdag kyang ting nge 'dzin la @263b snyoms par 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang ting nge 'dzin la @263b snyoms par 'jug pa yin /
translated: I myself enter into the concentration of meditative stabilization.

original: gzhan yang ting nge 'dzin la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang ting nge 'dzin la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: I encourage others to enter into the concentration of meditative stabilization.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi legs pa brjod pa yin /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi legs pa brjod pa yin /
translated: I praise the virtues of meditative stabilization.

original: sems can gzhan gang gis ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gang gis ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /
translated: I rejoice in the meditative stabilization of others.

original: bdag kyang shes rab sgom pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang shes rab sgom pa yin /
translated: I myself cultivate wisdom.

original: gzhan yang shes rab sgom pa la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang shes rab sgom pa la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: They are also those who encourage others to cultivate wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi legs pa brjod pa yin /
analyzed: shes rab kyi legs pa brjod pa yin /
translated: They are those who speak in praise of wisdom.🔽They are those who speak in praise of others cultivating wisdom and who rejoice in harmony with that.

original: sems can gzhan gang shes rab sgom pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la 'god pa'i phrin las yin no /🔽// / bam po drug cu dgu pa /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gang shes rab sgom pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la 'god pa'i phrin las yin no / // / bam po drug cu dgu pa /
translated: This is the activity of establishing others in the six perfections.

original: bdag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang yang dag par 'dzin pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang yang dag par 'dzin pa yin /
translated: They are those who personally uphold the path of the ten virtues.

original: gzhan yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: They are those who encourage others to uphold the path of the ten virtues.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi legs pa brjod pa yin /
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi legs pa brjod pa yin /
translated: They are those who speak in praise of the path of the ten virtues.

original: sems can gzhan yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par 'dzin pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /
analyzed: sems can gzhan yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par 'dzin pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /
translated: They are those who speak in praise of others upholding the path of the ten virtues and who rejoice in harmony with that.

original: bdag kyang bslab pa'i gnas lnga yang dag par 'dzin pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang bslab pa'i gnas lnga yang dag par 'dzin pa yin /
translated: They are those who personally uphold the five precepts.

original: gzhan yang bslab pa'i gnas lnga la yang dag par bskul ba yin /🔽bslab pa'i gnas lnga'i legs pa brjod pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang bslab pa'i gnas lnga la yang dag par bskul ba yin / bslab pa'i gnas lnga'i legs pa brjod pa yin /
translated: They encourage others to follow the five precepts.🔽They speak in praise of the five precepts.

original: sems can gzhan gang bslab pa'i gnas lnga yang dag par 'dzin pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyad pa yin /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gang bslab pa'i gnas lnga yang dag par 'dzin pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyad pa yin /
translated: They speak in praise of those who follow the five precepts and rejoice in them.

original: bdag kyang yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong la nye bar gnas pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong la nye bar gnas pa yin /
translated: They themselves observe the eight-branched poṣadha.

original: gzhan yang yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong la yang dag par bskul ba yin /🔽yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong gi legs pa brjod pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong la yang dag par bskul ba yin / yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong gi legs pa brjod pa yin /
translated: They encourage others to observe the eight-branched poṣadha.🔽They speak in praise of the eight-branched poṣadha.

original: sems can gzhan gang yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong la nye bar gnas pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gang yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong la nye bar gnas pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /
translated: They speak in praise of those who observe the eight-branched poṣadha and rejoice in them.

original: bdag kyang bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa yin /
translated: They themselves enter into the first concentration.

original: gzhan yang bsam gtan dang po la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang bsam gtan dang po la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: They encourage others to enter the first concentration.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i legs pa brjod pa yin /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i legs pa brjod pa yin /
translated: They speak in praise of the first concentration.

original: sems can gzhan gang bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /🔽bdag kyang bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam @264a * //
analyzed: sems can gzhan gang bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin / bdag kyang bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam @264a * //
translated: They speak in praise of others who enter the first concentration, and they rejoice in that.

original: gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug pa yin /
translated: They themselves enter the second concentration, the third concentration, and the fourth concentration.

original: gzhan yang bsam gtan bzhi pa la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang bsam gtan bzhi pa la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: They encourage others to enter the fourth concentration.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i legs pa brjod pa yin /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i legs pa brjod pa yin /
translated: They speak in praise of the fourth concentration.

original: sems can gzhan gang bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gang bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /
translated: They speak in praise of others who enter the fourth concentration, and they rejoice in that.

original: bdag kyang byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la snyoms par 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la snyoms par 'jug pa yin /
translated: They themselves enter loving kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: gzhan yang btang snyoms la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang btang snyoms la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: They encourage others to be impartial.

original: btang snyoms kyi legs pa brjod pa yin /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi legs pa brjod pa yin /
translated: They speak in praise of impartiality.

original: sems can gzhan gang btang snyoms la snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gang btang snyoms la snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /
translated: They speak in praise of those other sentient beings who are resting in the meditative absorption of impartiality, and they rejoice in that.

original: bdag kyang nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa yin /
translated: They themselves rest in the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite space, the sense field of infinite consciousness, the sense field of nothing-at-all, and the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: gzhan yang 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: They encourage others to rest in the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi legs pa brjod pa yin /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi legs pa brjod pa yin /
translated: They speak in praise of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: sems can gzhan gang 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gang 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /
translated: They speak in praise of those other sentient beings who are resting in the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception, and they rejoice in that.

original: bdag kyang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun sgom pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun sgom pa yin /
translated: I myself cultivate the thirty-seven aspects of the path to enlightenment.

original: gzhan yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: I encourage others to cultivate the thirty-seven aspects of the path to enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi legs pa brjod pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi legs pa brjod pa yin /
translated: I praise the cultivation of the thirty-seven aspects of the path to enlightenment.

original: sems can gzhan gang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun sgom pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun sgom pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /
translated: I rejoice in those who cultivate the thirty-seven aspects of the path to enlightenment.

original: bdag kyang rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams sgom pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams sgom pa yin /
translated: I myself cultivate the three gateways to liberation, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, the five kinds of supernormal knowledge, the meditative stabilities, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: gzhan yang gzungs kyi sgo la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzungs kyi sgo la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: I encourage others to cultivate the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi legs pa brjod pa yin /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi legs pa brjod pa yin /
translated: I praise the cultivation of the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: sems can gzhan gang gzungs kyi sgo rnams sgom pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gang gzungs kyi sgo rnams sgom pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /
translated: They are those who speak in praise of the retention of the dhāraṇī gateways of others and who rejoice in accord with them.

original: bdag kyang de bzhin gshegs @264b pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad sgom pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang de bzhin gshegs @264b pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad sgom pa yin /
translated: “They are those who cultivate the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the fourfold fearlessness, the fourfold detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: They are those who encourage others to cultivate the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi legs pa brjod pa yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi legs pa brjod pa yin /
translated: They are those who speak in praise of the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: sems can gzhan gang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad sgom pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad sgom pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /
translated: They are those who speak in praise of the cultivation of the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas by others and who rejoice in accord with them.

original: bdag kyang skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu sgrub pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu sgrub pa yin /
translated: I too am practicing to achieve the thirty-two marks of a great person and the eighty minor marks.

original: gzhan yang skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: I also encourage others to achieve the thirty-two marks of a great person and the eighty minor marks.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i legs pa brjod pa yin /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i legs pa brjod pa yin /
translated: I speak in praise of the thirty-two marks of a great person and the eighty minor marks.

original: sems can gzhan gang skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu sgrub pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi lam la 'god pa'i phrin las yin no /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gang skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu sgrub pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi lam la 'god pa'i phrin las yin no /
translated: I speak in praise of others who achieve the thirty-two marks of a great person and the eighty minor marks, and I rejoice in them.

original: // / rab 'byor gal te chos kyi dbyings sngon ji lta bar phyis kyang de bzhin ma yin /
analyzed: // / rab 'byor gal te chos kyi dbyings sngon ji lta bar phyis kyang de bzhin ma yin /
translated: Subhūti, if the dharma-constituent were not just as it was before,

original: bar du yang de bzhin du ma yin du zin na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bar du yang de bzhin du ma yin du zin na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: If it were not so, then when the bodhisattva great being is practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams la chos kyi dbyings ston par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams la chos kyi dbyings ston par mi 'gyur /
translated: he would not teach the dharma-constituent to sentient beings with skillful means.

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed par mi 'gyur /
translated: He would not bring sentient beings to maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: He would not purify a buddhafield.

original: rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings de sngon ji lta bar phyis kyang de bzhin /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings de sngon ji lta bar phyis kyang de bzhin /
translated: Subhūti, that dharma-constituent is just as it was before, just as it will be later,

original: bar du yang de bzhin du bas /
analyzed: bar du yang de bzhin du bas /
translated: and just as it is in the present.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, when the bodhisattva great being is practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams la chos kyi dbyings ston to //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams la chos kyi dbyings ston to //
translated: he teaches the dharma-constituent to sentient beings with skillful means.

original: sems can rnams kyi don du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyod do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyod do //
translated: He practices the bodhisattva’s way of life for the sake of sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: He brings sentient beings to maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: and they purify a buddhafield.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar gal te sems can yang shin tu dmigs su ma mchis la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar gal te sems can yang shin tu dmigs su ma mchis la /
translated: “Lord, if a being is not apprehended at all,

original: sems can du dmigs pa yang ma mchis na /
analyzed: sems can du dmigs pa yang ma mchis na /
translated: and a being is not apprehended as a real fact,
whose

original: don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sgom pa lags /
analyzed: don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sgom pa lags /
translated: is the bodhisattva great beings’ meditation on the perfection of wisdom?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Venerable Subhūti having said that, the Lord said to him,

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni yang dag pa'i mtha' tshad mar byas shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sgom ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni yang dag pa'i mtha' tshad mar byas shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sgom ste /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, having taken the very limit of reality as their measure, meditate on the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor gal te yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan la /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan la /
translated: Subhūti, if the very limit of reality were one thing,🔽and the perfection of wisdom another,

original: sems can gyi mtha' yang gzhan zhig yin na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgom par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can gyi mtha' yang gzhan zhig yin na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgom par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the end of beings were different, then the bodhisattva great being would not cultivate the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan ma yin /
translated: Subhūti, the end of reality is not different,

original: sems can gyi mtha' yang gzhan ma yin pas /
analyzed: sems can gyi mtha' yang gzhan ma yin pas /
translated: and the end of beings is not different.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang sems can rnams kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang sems can rnams kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom ste /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva great being cultivates the perfection of wisdom for the sake of beings.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang dag pa'i mtha' rnam par 'khrugs pa med par sems can rnams yang dag pa'i mtha' la 'god do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang dag pa'i mtha' rnam par 'khrugs pa med par sems can rnams yang dag pa'i mtha' la 'god do //
translated: The bodhisattva great being who cultivates the perfection of wisdom, without disturbing the end of reality, establishes beings in the end of reality.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan ma lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan ma lags /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One, if the end of reality is not different,

original: sems can gyi mtha' yang gzhan ma lags na /
analyzed: sems can gyi mtha' yang gzhan ma lags na /
translated: and the end of beings is not different,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas par 'gyur ram /
translated: Will the very limit of reality stand in the very limit of reality?

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te yang dag pa'i mtha' yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas par 'gyur na ni des rang bzhin rang bzhin la gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te yang dag pa'i mtha' yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas par 'gyur na ni des rang bzhin rang bzhin la gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: Lord, if the very limit of reality were to stand in the very limit of reality, then by that the intrinsic nature would stand in the intrinsic nature.

original: bcom ldan 'das rang bzhin la rang bzhin la rang bzhin gnas pa ma mchis na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rang bzhin la rang bzhin la rang bzhin gnas pa ma mchis na /
translated: Lord, if the intrinsic nature does not stand in the intrinsic nature,

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Lord, how will bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: sems can rnams yang dag pa'i mtha' la 'god pa lags /
analyzed: sems can rnams yang dag pa'i mtha' la 'god pa lags /
translated: establish beings in the very limit of reality?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor yang dag pa'i mtha' la yang dag pa'i mtha' gnas par 'gyur ba yang med /
analyzed: rab 'byor yang dag pa'i mtha' la yang dag pa'i mtha' gnas par 'gyur ba yang med /
translated: “Subhūti, the very limit of reality does not stand in the very limit of reality,

original: rang bzhin la rang bzhin gnas par 'gyur ba yang med na /
analyzed: rang bzhin la rang bzhin gnas par 'gyur ba yang med na /
translated: and the intrinsic nature does not stand in the intrinsic nature.

original: 'on te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'on te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Or, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: thabs mkhas pas sems can gyi mtha' yang dag pa'i mtha' la 'god de /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas sems can gyi mtha' yang dag pa'i mtha' la 'god de /
translated: with skillful means they establish the limit of sentient beings in the limit of reality,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: without disturbing the limit of reality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na @265b sems can gyi mtha' yang gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na @265b sems can gyi mtha' yang gzhan ma yin /
translated: Why is that? The limit of sentient beings is not one thing,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan ma yin te /
translated: and the limit of reality is not another.

original: de ltar na sems can gyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na sems can gyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, the limit of sentient beings and the limit of reality are not two and cannot be divided into two.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Blessed One, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pas sems can rnams yang dag pa'i mtha' la 'god kyang yang dag pa'i mtha' rnam par 'khrug par mi bgyid pa de lta bu'i thabs gang lags /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pas sems can rnams yang dag pa'i mtha' la 'god kyang yang dag pa'i mtha' rnam par 'khrug par mi bgyid pa de lta bu'i thabs gang lags /
translated: with skillful means they establish sentient beings in the limit of reality without disturbing the limit of reality. What is that skillful means?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Subhūti, here, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: starting from the first production of the thought,

original: sems can rnams sbyin pa la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: sems can rnams sbyin pa la rab tu 'god do //
translated: they establish sentient beings in generosity.

original: sbyin pa la rab tu bkod nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa la rab tu bkod nas /
translated: Having established them in generosity,

original: sbyin pa de'i thog ma'i mtha' dang / tha ma'i mtha' dang dbus ston te /
analyzed: sbyin pa de'i thog ma'i mtha' dang / tha ma'i mtha' dang dbus ston te /
translated: they teach them the beginning, end, and middle of that generosity.

original: ji ltar sbyin pa de'i thog ba'i mtha' yang stong /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin pa de'i thog ba'i mtha' yang stong /
translated: ‘Just as that generosity is empty of a beginning,

original: tha ma'i mtha' yang stong /
analyzed: tha ma'i mtha' yang stong /
translated: empty of an end,

original: dbus kyang stong pa de ltar sbyin pa'i 'bras bu yang stong /
analyzed: dbus kyang stong pa de ltar sbyin pa'i 'bras bu yang stong /
translated: and empty of a middle, so the result of generosity is also empty,

original: sbyin bdag kyang stong /
analyzed: sbyin bdag kyang stong /
translated: the benefactor is also empty,

original: len pa yang stong par ston zhing /
analyzed: len pa yang stong par ston zhing /
translated: and the recipient is also empty.’

original: rigs kyi bu de ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' la don de dag med kyis /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' la don de dag med kyis /
translated: ‘Son of noble family, since those things do not exist in the very limit of reality,

original: sbyin pa yang gzhan la sbyin pa'i 'bras bu yang gzhan no snyam du ma sems shig /
analyzed: sbyin pa yang gzhan la sbyin pa'i 'bras bu yang gzhan no snyam du ma sems shig /
translated: do not think that generosity is one thing and the result of generosity is another.’

original: sbyin bdag kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: sbyin bdag kyang gzhan la /
translated: The giver is one thing, the recipient another, and the gift another still.

original: len pa yang gzhan no snyam du ma sems shig / rigs kyi bu khyod nam sbyin pa yang gzhan la sbyin pa'i 'bras bu yang gzhan no snyam du mi sems /
analyzed: len pa yang gzhan no snyam du ma sems shig / rigs kyi bu khyod nam sbyin pa yang gzhan la sbyin pa'i 'bras bu yang gzhan no snyam du mi sems /
translated: Son of noble family, when you do not think that the gift is one thing and the fruit of the gift another,

original: sbyin bdag kyang gzhan la len pa yang gzhan no snyam du mi sems ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: sbyin bdag kyang gzhan la len pa yang gzhan no snyam du mi sems ba de'i tshe /
translated: that the giver is one thing and the recipient another,

original: khyod kyi sbyin pa 'di bdud rtsi dang bdud rtsi'i 'bras bu dang mthar bdud rtsir 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyod kyi sbyin pa 'di bdud rtsi dang bdud rtsi'i 'bras bu dang mthar bdud rtsir 'gyur te /
translated: then this gift of yours will be nectar, the fruit of nectar, and will end in nectar.

original: sbyin pa 'dis gzugs yongs su ma 'dzin cing //
analyzed: sbyin pa 'dis gzugs yongs su ma 'dzin cing //
translated: Do not grasp at form through this gift,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su ma 'dzin cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su ma 'dzin cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: do not grasp at feeling, perception, volitions, or consciousness. And why?

original: 'di ltar khyod kyis sbyin pa 'di ni sbyin pas stong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyod kyis sbyin pa 'di ni sbyin pas stong ngo //
translated: Because this gift of yours is empty of gift,

original: de'i 'bras bu yang 'bras bus stong ngo //🔽sbyin bdag kyang sbyin bdag gis stong ngo //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yang 'bras bus stong ngo // sbyin bdag kyang sbyin bdag gis stong ngo //
translated: its fruit is empty of fruit,🔽the giver is empty of giver,

original: len pa yang len bas stong ste /
analyzed: len pa yang len bas stong ste /
translated: and the recipient is empty of recipient.

original: stong pa nyid la ni sbyin pa mi dmigs /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la ni sbyin pa mi dmigs /
translated: In emptiness, generosity is not apprehended,

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu dang / sbyin bdag dang len pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu dang / sbyin bdag dang len pa mi dmigs so //
translated: the result of generosity is not apprehended, the one who gives and the one to whom it is given are not apprehended.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar chos de dag ni ngo bo nyid kyis shin tu stong ngo zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos de dag ni ngo bo nyid kyis shin tu stong ngo zhes brjod do //
translated: Because those phenomena are utterly empty of their own intrinsic nature.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor @266a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor @266a * //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams tshul khrims la 'god de /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams tshul khrims la 'god de /
translated: they skillfully establish sentient beings in morality,

original: tshur rigs kyi bu srog gcod pa spongs la srog gcod pa las phyir ldog par gyis shig / ma sbyin par len pa dang 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / zhe gcod pa dang / tshig 'khyal pa dang /
analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu srog gcod pa spongs la srog gcod pa las phyir ldog par gyis shig / ma sbyin par len pa dang 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / zhe gcod pa dang / tshig 'khyal pa dang /
translated: saying, ‘Come here, son of a good family! Abandon killing and turn away from killing. Abandon taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, lying, slander, harsh speech, and idle talk.

original: chags sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba spongs la /
analyzed: chags sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba spongs la /
translated: Abandon covetousness, malice, and wrong views.

original: log par lta ba las phyir ldog par gyis shig / rigs kyi bu chog de dag la ji ltar yongs su brtags pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin gang yang med kyis /
analyzed: log par lta ba las phyir ldog par gyis shig / rigs kyi bu chog de dag la ji ltar yongs su brtags pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin gang yang med kyis /
translated: “Son of noble family, there is no intrinsic nature in any of these things, as you have imagined them.

original: rigs kyi bu soms dang / gang gis srog gcad par bya ba'i srog chags dang / gang gis srog gcod par byed pa de lta bu'i chos kyang gang zhig yin /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu soms dang / gang gis srog gcad par bya ba'i srog chags dang / gang gis srog gcod par byed pa de lta bu'i chos kyang gang zhig yin /
translated: Son of noble family, consider this: What is the phenomenon that is the living being whose life is to be taken? What is the phenomenon that is the one who takes life?

original: gang ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / zhe gcod pa'i tshig dang / tshig 'khyal pa dang / chags sems dang / gnod sems dang / gang log par lta ba dang /
analyzed: gang ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / zhe gcod pa'i tshig dang / tshig 'khyal pa dang / chags sems dang / gnod sems dang / gang log par lta ba dang /
translated: What is the phenomenon that is the one who takes what is not given, engages in sexual activity out of desire, tells lies, speaks divisively, speaks harshly, or engages in idle talk? What is the phenomenon that is the one who has covetousness, ill will, or wrong views?

original: gang gis log par lta bar brtogs pa dang / gang gis log par lta bar mthong ba de lta bu'i chos kyang gang zhig yin zhes ston zhing tshul khrims la 'god de /
analyzed: gang gis log par lta bar brtogs pa dang / gang gis log par lta bar mthong ba de lta bu'i chos kyang gang zhig yin zhes ston zhing tshul khrims la 'god de /
translated: What is the phenomenon that is the one who conceives of wrong views? What is the phenomenon that is the one who sees wrong views?”

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings with such skill in means, when practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: sems can rnams kyi 'bras bu bstan te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi 'bras bu bstan te /
translated: teach the fruits of sentient beings.

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu dang / tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu bstan te /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu dang / tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu bstan te /
translated: They teach the fruit of generosity and the fruit of moral discipline.

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu dang / tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu de yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong par bstan pas rigs kyi bu des sbyin pa dang tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu ngo bo nyid stong par rig nas de la mngon par zhen par mi byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu dang / tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu de yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong par bstan pas rigs kyi bu des sbyin pa dang tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu ngo bo nyid stong par rig nas de la mngon par zhen par mi byed do //
translated: The fruit of generosity and the fruit of moral discipline are also taught to be empty of an intrinsic nature. The children of good family, knowing that the fruit of generosity and moral discipline is empty of an intrinsic nature, do not settle down on it.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pas 'khrug par mi 'gyur zhing shes rab bskyed do //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pas 'khrug par mi 'gyur zhing shes rab bskyed do //
translated: Not settling down, they do not get agitated and they develop wisdom.

original: shes rab des kyang bag la nyal ba dang / kun nas ldang ba thams cad bcad nas phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ste /
analyzed: shes rab des kyang bag la nyal ba dang / kun nas ldang ba thams cad bcad nas phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ste /
translated: and with that wisdom, having cut off all latent and manifest [afflictions], they will pass into parinirvāṇa in the realm of nirvāṇa without remainder.

original: de yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: But that is in terms of the ultimate truth of worldly convention,🔽not in terms of the ultimate truth.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽stong pa nyid la gang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / stong pa nyid la gang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'am /
translated: And why is that?🔽In emptiness, no dharma whatsoever is apprehended

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba de lta bu'i chos gang yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba de lta bu'i chos gang yang mi dmigs te /
translated: that passes into parinirvāṇa or that has passed into parinirvāṇa.

original: de'i @266b mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i @266b mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called parinirvāṇa

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: of those

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: is just the emptiness beyond extremes.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: sems can phan tshun gnod par sems shing 'khrug par 'gyur ba dang ldan pa dag mthong na 'di snyam du 'dems shing ston te /
analyzed: sems can phan tshun gnod par sems shing 'khrug par 'gyur ba dang ldan pa dag mthong na 'di snyam du 'dems shing ston te /
translated: When he sees beings who are hostile to each other, he thinks, “You should practice patience, child of family!🔽You should cultivate patience!🔽You should be gentle, calm, and peaceful!

original: rigs kyi bu bzod pa sgrubs shig / bzod pa sgoms shig / des pa dang sems zhi ba dang nang du sems pa'i dang tshul du gyis shig / gang gnod ba byed pa dang / gang gis gnod par bya ba dang / gang la gnod par bya ba'i chos de dag ni thams cad kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin gyis /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu bzod pa sgrubs shig / bzod pa sgoms shig / des pa dang sems zhi ba dang nang du sems pa'i dang tshul du gyis shig / gang gnod ba byed pa dang / gang gis gnod par bya ba dang / gang la gnod par bya ba'i chos de dag ni thams cad kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin gyis /
translated: All these things that are harmed, that harm, and that are harmed by what—are all empty of inherent nature.

original: rigs kyi bu gnod par byed pa ni su yod /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gnod par byed pa ni su yod /
translated: Child of family, who is the one who is harmed?

original: gnod par ni su la bya /
analyzed: gnod par ni su la bya /
translated: Who is the one who harms?

original: cis ni gnod par bya /
analyzed: cis ni gnod par bya /
translated: By what is the harm done?

original: sems dang chos de dag thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: sems dang chos de dag thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: The mind and all these phenomena are empty of inherent nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de ni nam yang mi stong par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de ni nam yang mi stong par mi 'gyur te /
translated: That which is empty of inherent nature is never not empty.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ma mdzad do//
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ma mdzad do//
translated: This is not made by the Tathāgatas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos rnams kyis ma byas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos rnams kyis ma byas so //
translated: nor by the pratyekabuddhas, nor by the śrāvakas.

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyis ma byas so //
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyis ma byas so //
translated: It was not done by the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, or mahoragas.

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyis ma byas so //🔽sum cu rtsa gsum dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs pa dang / dge rgyas dang / gnas gtsang ma dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyis ma byas so // sum cu rtsa gsum dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs pa dang / dge rgyas dang / gnas gtsang ma dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang /
translated: It was not done by the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm.

original: cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lha rnams kyis ma byas te /
analyzed: cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lha rnams kyis ma byas te /
translated: It was not done by the gods of the Trayas­triṃśa, Yāmā, Tuṣita, Nirmāṇa­rata, or Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin realms, nor by the Brahmakāyika, Brahmapurohita, Brahmapārṣadya, Parīttābha, Apramāṇābha, Ābhāsvara, Parīttaśubha, Apramāṇaśubha, Śubhakṛtsna, Bṛhatphala, Asaṃjñisattva, Śuddhāvāsa, Ākāśānantya, Vijñānānantya,🔽Ākiñcanyāyatana, or Naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñāyatana realms.

original: de ni rtag par yang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: de ni rtag par yang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: It is always empty by nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa ni su la yang gnod par mi byed do zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa ni su la yang gnod par mi byed do zhe na /
translated: “But emptiness does not harm anything!”

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sems can rnams thabs mkhas pas rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid dang rgyu dang 'bras bu la sbyor te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sems can rnams thabs mkhas pas rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid dang rgyu dang 'bras bu la sbyor te /
translated: “Subhūti, in this way bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom, with skillful means, connect beings to emptiness of intrinsic nature and to cause and effect.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la bkod cing rim gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par ston to //🔽yang dag par bskul lo //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la bkod cing rim gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par ston to // yang dag par bskul lo //
translated: They establish them in emptiness of intrinsic nature and gradually show them unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽They encourage them.

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod do //
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod do //
translated: They inspire them.

original: yang dag par dga' bar byed do //🔽gzhog go // 'dul lo //
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar byed do // gzhog go // 'dul lo //
translated: They delight them.🔽They establish them.🔽They tame them.

original: rab tu @267a * //
analyzed: rab tu @267a * //
translated: They cause them to enter.

original: 'god do // de yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'god do // de yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: And that is in terms of the conventional meaning of the world, not in terms of the ultimate.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la gang thob par byed pa dang / gang gis thob par bya ba dang / gang thob par bya ba gang yang med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la gang thob par byed pa dang / gang gis thob par bya ba dang / gang thob par bya ba gang yang med do //
translated: In emptiness there is no attainment, and there is no one who attains, nor anything that is attained.

original: rab 'byor 'di ni yang dag pa'i mtha' stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni yang dag pa'i mtha' stong pa nyid de /
translated: Subhūti, this is the emptiness of the ultimate,

original: de la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams kyi don du gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: de la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams kyi don du gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
translated: in which the bodhisattva great beings, for the sake of beings, practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la sems can du dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: de la sems can du dmigs pa med do //
translated: In it, beings are not apprehended.

original: sems can du gdags pa dmigs su med do //
analyzed: sems can du gdags pa dmigs su med do //
translated: The designation of beings is not apprehended.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad sems can gyis dben pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad sems can gyis dben pa'o //
translated: Because all phenomena are empty of beings.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: thabs mkhas pas sems can le lo can brtson 'grus chung ba dag mthong na /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas sems can le lo can brtson 'grus chung ba dag mthong na /
translated: they see lazy beings with little diligence.

original: 'di ltar lus dang sems kyis brtson 'grus la yang dag par bskul te /
analyzed: 'di ltar lus dang sems kyis brtson 'grus la yang dag par bskul te /
translated: In this way, they should arouse physical and mental perseverance.

original: rigs kyi bu dag ngang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni chos gang yang zhum zhi le lor 'gyur ba'am /🔽gang la zhum zhing le lor 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag ngang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni chos gang yang zhum zhi le lor 'gyur ba'am / gang la zhum zhing le lor 'gyur ba'am /
translated: ‘Noble children, in the emptiness of inherent nature, there is no dharma that is discouraged or lazy,🔽no one who is discouraged or lazy,

original: gang gis zhum zhing le lor 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gang gis zhum zhing le lor 'gyur ba'am /
translated: no one who is discouraged or lazy,

original: gang zhum zhing le lor 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang med do //
analyzed: gang zhum zhing le lor 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang med do //
translated: and no dharma that is discouraged or lazy.

original: chos de dag thams cad kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid las mi 'da' ba yin gyis /
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid las mi 'da' ba yin gyis /
translated: All these dharmas do not go beyond emptiness of inherent nature.

original: lus dang sems kyis brtson 'grus bskyed la /
analyzed: lus dang sems kyis brtson 'grus bskyed la /
translated: Therefore, arouse physical and mental perseverance.

original: le lo bor te dge ba'i chos sbyin pa'am /
analyzed: le lo bor te dge ba'i chos sbyin pa'am /
translated: Abandon laziness and cultivate virtuous dharmas such as generosity,

original: tshul khrims sam /
analyzed: tshul khrims sam /
translated: discipline,🔽patience,

original: bzod pa'am / brtson 'grus sam /
analyzed: bzod pa'am / brtson 'grus sam /
translated: diligence,

original: bsam gtan nam /
analyzed: bsam gtan nam /
translated: concentration,

original: shes rab bam /
analyzed: shes rab bam /
translated: wisdom,

original: nang stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dam /
translated: inner emptiness,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ram /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ram /
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of intrinsic nature,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams sam /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams sam /
translated: the applications of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong pa rnams sam /
analyzed: yang dag par spong pa rnams sam /
translated: the right efforts,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams sam /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams sam /
translated: the bases of supernatural powers,

original: dbang po rnams sam /
analyzed: dbang po rnams sam /
translated: the powers,

original: stobs rnams sam /
analyzed: stobs rnams sam /
translated: the strengths,

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams sam /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams sam /
translated: the branches of enlightenment,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'am /
translated: the noble eightfold path,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams sam /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams sam /
translated: the noble truths,

original: bsam gtan rnams sam /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams sam /
translated: the dhyānas,

original: tshad med pa rnams sam ;
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams sam ;
translated: the immeasurables,

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /
translated: the formless absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa rnams sam /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams sam /
translated: the liberations,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /
translated: the serial absorptions,🔽emptiness,🔽signlessness,🔽wishlessness,

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams sam /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams sam /
translated: the clairvoyances,

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams sam /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams sam /
translated: the meditative stabilizations,

original: gzungs kyi @267b sgo rnams sam /
analyzed: gzungs kyi @267b sgo rnams sam /
translated: the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams sam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams sam /
translated: the powers of the tathāgatas,

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams sam /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams sam /
translated: the fearlessnesses,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams sam /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams sam /
translated: the detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dag la brtson par gyis shig / rigs kyi bu dag stong pa nyid kyis chos de dag thams cad sgrib pa med par rtogs shig / sgrib pa med pa'i chos la zhum par 'gyur ba gnag yang med do zhes rab 'byor🔽de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams la rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid yang dag par ston to //
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dag la brtson par gyis shig / rigs kyi bu dag stong pa nyid kyis chos de dag thams cad sgrib pa med par rtogs shig / sgrib pa med pa'i chos la zhum par 'gyur ba gnag yang med do zhes rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams la rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid yang dag par ston to //
translated: You should understand that all those dharmas are empty of an intrinsic nature, and you should understand that emptiness is empty of emptiness, and you should understand that the emptiness of an intrinsic nature is empty of the emptiness of an intrinsic nature, and you should understand that the emptiness of the compounded is empty of the emptiness of the compounded.

original: yang dag par bskul lo ;🔽/ yang dag par gzengs bstod do //🔽yang dag par dga' bar byed do //🔽gzhog go /'dul lo //
analyzed: yang dag par bskul lo ; / yang dag par gzengs bstod do // yang dag par dga' bar byed do // gzhog go /'dul lo //
translated: You should understand that all those dharmas are empty of an intrinsic nature, and you should understand that emptiness is empty of emptiness, and you should understand that the emptiness of an intrinsic nature is empty of the emptiness of an intrinsic nature, and you should understand that the emptiness of the compounded is empty of the emptiness of the compounded, and you should understand that the emptiness of the uncompounded is empty of the emptiness of the uncompounded.🔽You should understand that all those dharmas are empty of an intrinsic nature, and you should understand that emptiness is empty of emptiness, and you should understand that the emptiness of an intrinsic nature is empty of the emptiness of an intrinsic nature, and you should understand that the emptiness of the compounded is empty of the emptiness of the compounded, and you should understand that the emptiness of the uncompounded is empty of the emptiness of the uncompounded, and you should understand that the emptiness of what is beyond the compounded and the uncompounded is empty of the emptiness of what is beyond the compounded and the uncompounded.

original: rab tu 'god do //🔽ci nas kyang gnyis la mi gnas par de ltar rab tu 'god do //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu 'god do //🔽ci nas kyang gnyis la mi gnas par de ltar rab tu 'god do //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: You should understand that all those dharmas are empty of an intrinsic nature, and you should understand that emptiness is empty of emptiness, and you should understand that the emptiness of an intrinsic nature is empty of the emptiness of an intrinsic nature, and you should understand that the emptiness of the compounded is empty of the emptiness of the compounded, and you should understand that the emptiness of the uncompounded is empty of the emptiness of the uncompounded, and you should understand that the emptiness of what is beyond the compounded and the uncompounded

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Emptiness of essential nature is nondual and cannot be made dual.

original: gnyis su med pa'i chos ni gang la yang gnas par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i chos ni gang la yang gnas par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: A nondual dharma does not stand anywhere.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi brtson 'grus la 'dems shing rjes su ston te /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi brtson 'grus la 'dems shing rjes su ston te /
translated: they skillfully encourage and teach sentient beings to be diligent in the emptiness of essential nature.🔽‘Come here, son of a good family!🔽Give gifts,🔽or observe moral discipline,🔽or be patient,

original: tshur rigs kyi bu sbyin pa'am /
analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu sbyin pa'am /
translated: or make an effort,🔽or become concentrated,🔽or cultivate wisdom,🔽or cultivate the emptiness of internal phenomena,🔽up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,🔽or cultivate the applications of mindfulness,

original: tshul khrims sam ;
analyzed: tshul khrims sam ;
translated: or cultivate the right efforts,🔽or cultivate the legs of miraculous power,🔽or cultivate the faculties,🔽or cultivate the powers,🔽or cultivate the seven limbs of awakening,🔽or cultivate the eightfold noble path,🔽or cultivate the emptiness of conditioned phenomena,🔽or cultivate the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena,🔽or cultivate the emptiness of the unlimited,🔽or cultivate the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end,🔽or cultivate the emptiness of nonrepudiation,🔽or cultivate the emptiness of essential nature,🔽or cultivate the emptiness of all phenomena,🔽or cultivate the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics,🔽or cultivate the emptiness of nonapprehension,🔽or cultivate the emptiness of the nonapprehension of an intrinsic nature,🔽or cultivate the perfection of giving,🔽or cultivate the perfection of patience,

original: bzod pa'am / brtson 'grus sam /
analyzed: bzod pa'am / brtson 'grus sam /
translated: or cultivate the perfection of diligence,

original: bsam gtan nam /
analyzed: bsam gtan nam /
translated: or cultivate the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab bam /🔽nang stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: shes rab bam / nang stong pa nyid dam /
translated: or cultivate the perfection of wisdom,🔽or cultivate the emptiness of emptiness,🔽or cultivate the signless,🔽or cultivate the wishless,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ram /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ram /
translated: or cultivate the unconditioned,

analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams sam /
translated: or cultivate the applications of mindfulness,

analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams sam /
translated: or cultivate the right efforts,🔽or cultivate the legs of miraculous power,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams sam /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams sam /
translated: or cultivate the faculties,

original: dbang po rnams sam /

translated: or cultivate the powers,🔽or cultivate the seven limbs of awakening,🔽or cultivate the eightfold noble path,🔽or cultivate the ten powers of a tathāgata,🔽or cultivate the four fearlessnesses,🔽or cultivate the four detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽or cultivate the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽or cultivate the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment,🔽or cultivate the ten perfections,🔽or cultivate the emptiness of internal phenomena,🔽up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,🔽or cultivate the applications of mindfulness,

translated: or cultivate the right

analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /

translated: and the distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽“You should strive in the perfection of generosity,

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni gnyis par yid la bya ba ma yin /

translated: and it is not to be paid attention to as nondual.

analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: In that way, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

analyzed: thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: with skillful means bring beings to maturity in the emptiness of a basic nature.

original: yongs su smin par byas nas rim gyis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub la 'god do //
analyzed: yongs su smin par byas nas rim gyis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub la 'god do //
translated: Having brought them to maturity, they gradually establish them in the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, and in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu 'god do //
translated: and to the knowledge of path aspects, and to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: thabs mkhas pas sems can sems g-yeng pa rnams la 'di skad du 'dems shing rjes su ston te /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas sems can sems g-yeng pa rnams la 'di skad du 'dems shing rjes su ston te /
translated: skillfully instruct and teach distracted beings, saying,

original: tshur rigs kyi bu ting nge 'dzin sgoms shig ; g-yeng ba'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu ting nge 'dzin sgoms shig ; g-yeng ba'i 'du shes sam /
translated: ‘Come here, son of a good family. Meditate in samādhi.🔽Don’t make a perception of distraction or

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi 'du shes su ma byed cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi 'du shes su ma byed cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: a perception of samādhi. And why?

original: chos de dag ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /🔽rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni gang yang g-yeng ba'am /
analyzed: chos de dag ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni gang yang g-yeng ba'am /
translated: Those dharmas are empty of a basic nature.🔽In emptiness of a basic nature, no dharma can be apprehended that is distracted or

original: rtse gcig tu 'gyur ba'i chos de yang dmigs su med do //
analyzed: rtse gcig tu 'gyur ba'i chos de yang dmigs su med do //
translated: that is one-pointed.

original: khyed kyi ting nge 'dzin de la gnas te /
analyzed: khyed kyi ting nge 'dzin de la gnas te /
translated: You should abide in that samādhi

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la spyad na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la spyad na /
translated: and practice emptiness of a basic nature.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis dge ba'i chos gang ci byed kyang rung ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis dge ba'i chos gang ci byed kyang rung ste /
translated: Whatever virtuous activities they undertake, whether physical, verbal, or mental,

original: sbyin pa gtong ba'am /
analyzed: sbyin pa gtong ba'am /
translated: whether they are practicing generosity,

original: tshul khrims srung ba'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims srung ba'am /
translated: upholding ethical discipline,

original: bzod pa sgom pa'am /
analyzed: bzod pa sgom pa'am /
translated: cultivating patience,

original: brtson 'grus rtsom pa'am /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom pa'am /
translated: engaging in diligence,

original: bsam gtan skyed pa'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan skyed pa'am /
translated: meditating on concentration,

original: shes rab sgom pa'am /
analyzed: shes rab sgom pa'am /
translated: or practicing wisdom,

original: nang stong pa nyid la spyod dam /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la spyod dam /
translated: whether they are practicing the emptiness of internal phenomena,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod dam /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod dam /
translated: or the other aspects of emptiness, up to and including the emptiness of the essential nature of nonthings,🔽whether they are practicing the four establishments of mindfulness,🔽the four perfect abandonments,🔽the four legs of manifestation,🔽the five powers,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan @268b lag brgyad pa la spyod dam /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan @268b lag brgyad pa la spyod dam /
translated: the five strengths,🔽the seven branches of enlightenment,🔽or the noble eightfold path,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the four noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang ; smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod dam /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang ; smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod dam /
translated: signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod dam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod dam /
translated: the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha?

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis la spyod dam /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis la spyod dam /
translated: Do you practice the thirty-two major marks of a great person?

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu la spyod dam /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu la spyod dam /
translated: Do you practice the eighty minor marks?

original: nyan thos kyi lam dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam la spyod dam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam la spyod dam /
translated: Do you practice the path of the śrāvakas and the path of the pratyekabuddhas?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang / sangs rgyas kyi lam la spyod dam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang / sangs rgyas kyi lam la spyod dam /
translated: Do you practice the path of the bodhisattvas and the path of the buddhas?

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub la spyod dam /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub la spyod dam /
translated: Do you practice the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, and a pratyekabuddha’s awakening?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod dam /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spyod dam /
translated: Do you practice up to the knowledge of all aspects?

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la spyod dam /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la spyod dam /
translated: Do you practice bringing sentient beings to maturity?

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba la spyod kyang rung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba la spyod kyang rung ste /
translated: Do you practice purifying a buddhafield?

original: dge ba'i chos de dag tshegs chung ngus 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes 'dems shing rjes su ston te /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos de dag tshegs chung ngus 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes 'dems shing rjes su ston te /
translated: Those wholesome dharmas will be accomplished with little difficulty.’

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, in that way, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams kyi don byas te /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams kyi don byas te /
translated: they use skillful means to work for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung nas bar 'ga' yang las mi byed par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung nas bar 'ga' yang las mi byed par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: From the time they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment, they never stop working for a moment.

original: dge ba thams cad tshol zhing sems can rnams kyi don byed de /
analyzed: dge ba thams cad tshol zhing sems can rnams kyi don byed de /
translated: They seek out all that is wholesome and work for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bsnyen bkur byed cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bsnyen bkur byed cing /
translated: They constantly and always serve the lord buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du yongs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du yongs su 'gro ste /
translated: They travel from buddha realm to buddha realm.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la chos thob pa de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du tshe rabs brjes kyang nam du'ang rnam par chud mi za ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la chos thob pa de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du tshe rabs brjes kyang nam du'ang rnam par chud mi za ste /
translated: And until they fully and completely awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, they never lose the Dharma they have attained from those lord buddhas, even in subsequent lives.

original: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par gzungs thob cing lus kyi dbang po'am /🔽ngag gi dbang po'am /🔽yid kyi @269a * //
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par gzungs thob cing lus kyi dbang po'am / ngag gi dbang po'am / yid kyi @269a * //
translated: They always and constantly attain dhāraṇīs and do not lose the faculty of their bodies,🔽the faculty of their speech,
