original: dbang po mi nyams pa yin /
analyzed: dbang po mi nyams pa yin /
translated: or the faculty of their minds.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shin tu bsgom pa des lam thams cad shin tu bsgom par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shin tu bsgom pa des lam thams cad shin tu bsgom par 'gyur te /
translated: It is because those bodhisattva great beings always and constantly cultivate the knowledge of path aspects, and by that they cultivate all paths.

original: nyan thos kyi lam mam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam mam /
translated: They cultivate the śrāvaka path,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mam /
translated: the pratyekabuddha path,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam mam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam mam /
translated: the bodhisattva path,

original: sangs rgyas kyi lam la shin tu bsgom par 'gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi lam la shin tu bsgom par 'gyur /
translated: and the buddha path.

original: mngon par shes pa gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la rnam par chud mi za ba'i tshul gyis phan par 'gyur ba de dag kyang shin tu bsgom par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la rnam par chud mi za ba'i tshul gyis phan par 'gyur ba de dag kyang shin tu bsgom par 'gyur te /
translated: They also cultivate the superknowledges that are helpful to bodhisattva great beings by means of the method of non-loss.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa de dag la gnas shing sems can rnams kyi don byed na 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor bar 'khor ba yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las kyang yongs su mi nyams so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa de dag la gnas shing sems can rnams kyi don byed na 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor bar 'khor ba yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las kyang yongs su mi nyams so //
translated: “If they stand in those superknowledges that have arisen from maturation and work for the welfare of beings, they do not regress from the knowledge of all aspects even while wandering in the five classes of existences.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: In that way, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gnas shing thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gnas shing thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
translated: stand in the emptiness of the essential original nature and work for the welfare of beings with skillful means.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gnas shing sems can shes rab 'chal ba can blo chung ba rnams mthong na /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gnas shing sems can shes rab 'chal ba can blo chung ba rnams mthong na /
translated: stand in the emptiness of the essential original nature and see beings with poor wisdom, with little understanding,

original: 'di skad du 'dems shing rjes su ston te /
analyzed: 'di skad du 'dems shing rjes su ston te /
translated: they instruct and teach them like this:

original: tshur rigs kyi bu lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi las ci byed kyang rung ste /
analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi las ci byed kyang rung ste /
translated: “Son of noble family, whatever actions you undertake, whether physical, verbal, or mental,

original: de dag thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du rtogs shig dang / khyod kyi las thams cad bdud rtsi'i 'bras bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du rtogs shig dang / khyod kyi las thams cad bdud rtsi'i 'bras bur 'gyur te /
translated: realize that they are all empty by nature, and all your actions will bear the fruit of immortality.

original: mthar bdud rtsir 'gyur ro //🔽rang bzhin stong pa nyid la ni gang mngon par shes par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: mthar bdud rtsir 'gyur ro // rang bzhin stong pa nyid la ni gang mngon par shes par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: In the end, they will be immortal.🔽In the emptiness of nature, no phenomenon can be observed that would attain any higher knowledge

original: yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos gang yang dmigs su med do //
analyzed: yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos gang yang dmigs su med do //
translated: or fall into any lower state.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur /
translated: Because the emptiness of nature does not fall into any lower state.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la yongs su nyams pa'i chos kyang gang yang med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la yongs su nyams pa'i chos kyang gang yang med do //
translated: In the emptiness of nature, there is nothing that falls into any lower state.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni dngos po yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni dngos po yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: Because the emptiness of nature is neither an existent thing

original: dngos po med pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang ma yin /
translated: nor a nonexistent thing.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid la ci zhig yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhes rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid la ci zhig yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhes rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “What is it that is lost in the intrinsic unreality of all things?”

original: @269b thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams la 'dems shing rjes su ston to //
analyzed: @269b thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams la 'dems shing rjes su ston to //
translated: Subhūti, in this way, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they instruct and teach sentient beings with skillful means.

original: de ltar 'dems shing rjes su ston pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar 'dems shing rjes su ston pa'i tshe /
translated: When they instruct and teach in this way,

original: nam yang rjes su ma bsgrubs pa ma yin /
analyzed: nam yang rjes su ma bsgrubs pa ma yin /
translated: they never fail to follow through.

original: de ni bdag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs shing gnas pa yin /
analyzed: de ni bdag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs shing gnas pa yin /
translated: They themselves take up and maintain the path of the ten virtues,

original: gzhan yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: and they encourage others to take up the path of the ten virtues.

original: bdag kyang bslab pa'i gnas lnga la yang dag par blangs shing gnas pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang bslab pa'i gnas lnga la yang dag par blangs shing gnas pa yin /
translated: They themselves take up and maintain the five precepts,

original: gzhan yang bslab pa'i gnas lnga la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang bslab pa'i gnas lnga la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: and they encourage others to take up the five precepts.

original: bdag kyang yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong la nye bar gnas par yang dag par blangs shing gnas pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong la nye bar gnas par yang dag par blangs shing gnas pa yin /
translated: I myself take up and abide by the observance of the purificatory fast endowed with eight components.

original: gzhan yang yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong la nye bar gnas par yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong la nye bar gnas par yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: I encourage others to take up and abide by the observance of the purificatory fast endowed with eight components.

original: bdag kyang bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa yin /
translated: I myself enter into the first meditative concentration.

original: gzhan yang bsam gtan dang po la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang bsam gtan dang po la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: I encourage others to enter into the first meditative concentration.

original: bdag kyang bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la yang dag par snyoms par 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la yang dag par snyoms par 'jug pa yin /
translated: I myself enter into the second meditative concentration, the third meditative concentration, and the fourth meditative concentration.

original: gzhan yang bsam gtan bzhi pa la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang bsam gtan bzhi pa la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: I encourage others to enter into the fourth meditative concentration.

original: bdag kyang rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par byams pa la gnas pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par byams pa la gnas pa yin /
translated: I myself constantly abide in loving kindness.

original: gzhan yang rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par byams pa sgom pa la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par byams pa sgom pa la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: I encourage others to cultivate loving kindness constantly.

original: bdag kyang rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la gnas pa yin gzhan yang rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par btang snyoms sgom pa la yang dag par bskul ba yin /🔽bdag kyang rtag tu nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la gnas pa yin gzhan yang rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par btang snyoms sgom pa la yang dag par bskul ba yin / bdag kyang rtag tu nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug pa yin /
translated: I myself will always be absorbed in compassion, joy, and equanimity, and I will encourage others to meditate on equanimity.

original: gzhan yang 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: I myself will always be absorbed in the meditative concentrations of infinite space, infinite consciousness, nothingness, and neither existence nor nonexistence, and I will encourage others to meditate on the meditative concentration of neither existence nor nonexistence.

original: bdag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la sgom pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la sgom pa yin /
translated: I myself practice the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment.

original: gzhan yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la yang dag par bskul ba yin /🔽bdag kyang @270a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la yang dag par bskul ba yin / bdag kyang @270a * //
translated: I also encourage others to practice the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la slob pa yin /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la slob pa yin /
translated: I myself practice the three doors of liberation.

original: gzhan yang rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: I also encourage others to practice the three doors of liberation.

original: bdag kyang 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / rnam par thar ba brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la slob pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / rnam par thar ba brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la slob pa yin /
translated: I myself practice the noble truths, the concentrations, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, the knowledge-spheres, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: gzhan yang gzungs kyi sgo rnams la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzungs kyi sgo rnams la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: I also encourage others to practice the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: bdag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la slob pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la slob pa yin /
translated: I too am training in the ten powers of the Tathāgata.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: I too am encouraging others to train in the ten powers of the Tathāgata.

original: bdag kyang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dras pa bco brgyad la slob pa yin /🔽gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la yang dag par bskul ba yin no //🔽bdag kyang skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu la slob pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dras pa bco brgyad la slob pa yin / gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la yang dag par bskul ba yin no // bdag kyang skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu la slob pa yin /
translated: I too am training in the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.🔽I too am encouraging others to train in the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.🔽I too am training in the thirty-two major marks and eighty minor marks of a great being.

original: gzhan yang skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: I too am encouraging others to train in the thirty-two major marks and eighty minor marks of a great being.

original: bdag kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i shes pa bskyed cing de la mi ngas pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i shes pa bskyed cing de la mi ngas pa yin /
translated: I too have generated the knowledge of the result of stream enterer and do not rest in it.

original: gzhan yang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'god pa dang / bdag kyang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i shes pa bskyed cing de la mi gnas pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'god pa dang / bdag kyang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i shes pa bskyed cing de la mi gnas pa yin /
translated: I also establish others in the result of stream enterer, and I have generated the knowledge of the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, and the result of arhat and do not rest in them.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu 'god pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu 'god pa yin /
translated: I also establish others in the result of arhat.

original: bdag kyang rang byang chub kyi lam bskyed cing de la mi gnas pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang rang byang chub kyi lam bskyed cing de la mi gnas pa yin /
translated: I too have generated the path of a pratyekabuddha and do not rest in it.

original: gzhan yang rang byang chub la rab tu 'god pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang byang chub la rab tu 'god pa yin /
translated: I also establish others in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening.

original: bdag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam bskyed pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam bskyed pa yin /
translated: I too have generated the path to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gzhan yang de la 'dems shing rjes su ston pa dang / gzhog cing 'dul ba dang 'god pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de la 'dems shing rjes su ston pa dang / gzhog cing 'dul ba dang 'god pa yin te /
translated: I also encourage, teach, establish, and train others in it.

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: from the time when they first begin setting their mind out

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gnas shing sems can rnams kyi don byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gnas shing sems can rnams kyi don byed pa'i tshe /
translated: on the Great Vehicle, they abide in the emptiness of inherent nature and work for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: nam yang las med par gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nam yang las med par gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: They never remain without activity.

original: gsol pa / @270b bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid lags na /
analyzed: gsol pa / @270b bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid lags na /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One, if all phenomena are emptiness of inherent nature,

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni sems can yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni sems can yang mi dmigs /
translated: in the emptiness of inherent nature sentient beings are not apprehended,

original: chos kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: chos kyang mi dmigs /
translated: phenomena are not apprehended,

original: chos ma lags pa yang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: chos ma lags pa yang mi dmigs na /
translated: and non-phenomena are not apprehended.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don du yang dag par zhugs pa lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don du yang dag par zhugs pa lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: Blessed One, how do bodhisattva great beings correctly engage with the knowledge of all aspects?🔽The Blessed One said, “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: ji skad du smras pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad du smras pa de bzhin no //
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: All dharmas are empty of own-being.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni sems can mi dmigs so //🔽chos mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni sems can mi dmigs so // chos mi dmigs so //
translated: In emptiness no dharma called ‘sentient being’ is apprehended,

original: chos ma yin pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa mi dmigs so //
translated: no dharma called ‘dharma’ is apprehended,🔽and no dharma called ‘non-dharma’ is apprehended.

original: rab 'byor gal re chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhig ma yin na ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal re chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhig ma yin na ni /
translated: Subhūti, if all dharmas were not empty of own-being,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la gnas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la gnas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: the bodhisattva, the great being, would not stand in emptiness,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang chos rnams rang bzhin gyis stong par mi ston to //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang chos rnams rang bzhin gyis stong par mi ston to //
translated: and having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, would not teach the emptiness of own-being of dharmas.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i chos de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i chos de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: And what are those dharmas that are empty of own-being?

original: rab 'byor gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: Subhūti, form is empty of own-being.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness are empty of essence;

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: the sense spheres, the elements, and dependent origination are empty of essence;

original: pha rol tu phyi pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyi pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: the perfections, the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment, and all the emptinesses are empty of essence;

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the ending of contaminants, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, the distinct attributes of a buddha, and great compassion are empty of essence;

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: the emptiness of essential nature, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of defining attributes, the emptiness of nonobservation, the emptiness of the essential nature of nonexistence, the emptiness of the essential nature of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic defining attributes, the emptiness of other things, the emptiness of nonthings, the emptiness of essential nature, the emptiness of nonapprehension, the emptiness of nonrepudiation, the emptiness of nature, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of their own characteristics, the emptiness of nonexistence, the emptiness of existence, the emptiness of self, the emptiness of other, the emptiness of what is not to be discarded, the emptiness of what is not to be attained, the emptiness of what is not to be destroyed, the emptiness of what is not to be diminished, the emptiness of what is not to be conceptualized, the emptiness of what is not to be differentiated, the emptiness of what is not to be abandoned, the emptiness of what is not to be accomplished, the emptiness of what is not to be obtained, the emptiness of what is not to be delighted in, the emptiness of what is not to be distressed about, the emptiness of the past, the emptiness of the future, and the emptiness of the present.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ni rang @271a * //🔽bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ni rang @271a * // bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are empty of inherent nature.

original: mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The thirty-two major marks and the eighty minor marks of a great person are empty of inherent nature.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: and the knowledge of all aspects are empty of a basic nature.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: phung po lnga ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //
analyzed: phung po lnga ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //
translated: they teach the doctrine that the five aggregates are empty of a basic nature.

original: skye mched bcu gnyis ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //
translated: They teach the doctrine that the twelve sense fields are empty of a basic nature.

original: khams bco brgyad ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //
translated: They teach the doctrine that the eighteen constituents are empty of a basic nature.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //
translated: They teach the doctrine that dependent origination is empty of a basic nature.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //
translated: “They teach the doctrine that all the perfections are empty of their own intrinsic nature.

original: stong pa nyid thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //🔽dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to // dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //
translated: “They teach the doctrine that all the emptinesses are empty of their own intrinsic nature.🔽“They teach the doctrine that the four applications of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four foundations for supernormal ability, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path are empty of their own intrinsic nature.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
translated: “They teach the doctrine that the four noble truths, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, the emptiness gate of liberation, the signlessness gate of liberation, and the wishlessness gate of liberation are empty of their own intrinsic nature.

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //
translated: are empty of a basic nature.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang ; btang snyoms chen po ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang ; btang snyoms chen po ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //
translated: “They teach the doctrine that the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity🔽are empty of a basic nature.🔽“They teach the doctrine that the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //
translated: are empty of a basic nature.🔽“They teach the doctrine that the thirty-two major marks of a great man and the eighty minor marks

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //
translated: are empty of a basic nature.

original: @271b rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //
analyzed: @271b rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //
translated: the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //
translated: and the knowledge of all aspects and the relinquishment of all propensities to the afflictions are empty of a basic nature.

original: rab 'byor gal te nang stong pa nyid rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhig ma yin na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te nang stong pa nyid rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhig ma yin na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Subhūti, if the emptiness of internal phenomena were not empty of a basic nature, then bodhisattva great beings would not teach the doctrine that all phenomena are empty of a basic nature.

original: gal te phyi stong pa nyid dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: gal te phyi stong pa nyid dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang /
translated: If you ask what is the emptiness of the external, the emptiness of the internal, the emptiness of the external and the internal, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great immensity, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of the conditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the emptiness of the unconditioned, the emptiness of what is beyond extremes, the emptiness of what is beginningless and endless, the emptiness of what is not to be discarded, the emptiness of intrinsic nature, and the emptiness of all things,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhig ma yin na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhig ma yin na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, the emptiness of essential nature, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities were not empty of an intrinsic nature, then the bodhisattva great beings would not teach the doctrine that all phenomena are empty of an intrinsic nature.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang bshig par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang bshig par mi 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, the emptiness of an intrinsic nature is not destroyed.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni 'jig par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni 'jig par mi 'gyur /
translated: The emptiness of an intrinsic nature is not destroyed.

original: rtag par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rtag par mi 'gyur /
translated: It is not permanent.

original: phyis med par 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: phyis med par 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: It does not go anywhere.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni yul na mi gnas /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni yul na mi gnas /
translated: Why is that?🔽It does not exist in a place.

original: phyogs na mi gnas te ;
analyzed: phyogs na mi gnas te ;
translated: It does not exist in a direction.

original: de ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba ma yin /
analyzed: de ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba ma yin /
translated: It does not come from anywhere.

original: gang du yang 'gro ba ma yin /
analyzed: gang du yang 'gro ba ma yin /
translated: It does not go anywhere.

original: de ni chos gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni chos gnas pa nyid do //
translated: That is the stability of phenomena.

original: de la ni chos gang yang 'phel ba dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: de la ni chos gang yang 'phel ba dmigs pa'am /
translated: In this, no dharma is observed to increase or

original: 'grib pa dmigs pa'am /🔽'grib pa'am / skye ba'am /
analyzed: 'grib pa dmigs pa'am / 'grib pa'am / skye ba'am /
translated: decrease,

original: 'byung ba'am / 'gag pa'am /
analyzed: 'byung ba'am / 'gag pa'am /
translated: to arise or cease,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: to be defiled or purified,

original: rnam par byang ba dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba dmigs pa med do //
translated: or to be produced or stopped.

original: de ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: This is the nature of dharmas.

original: de la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par 'jug ste /
analyzed: de la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par 'jug ste /
translated: Abiding in this, bodhisattva great beings enter into unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: chos gang la yang 'jug pa'am mi 'jug par mthong ba med do //
analyzed: chos gang la yang 'jug pa'am mi 'jug par mthong ba med do //
translated: They do not see any dharma to enter into or not enter into.

original: chos thams cad 'jug pa @272a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'jug pa @272a * //
translated: All dharmas are without entering

original: med cing gnas pa med pa ste /
analyzed: med cing gnas pa med pa ste /
translated: and without abiding.

original: de ni chos rnams kyi chos gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni chos rnams kyi chos gnas pa'o //
translated: This is the abiding of dharmas.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Therefore, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par mthong nas /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par mthong nas /
translated: seeing that all dharmas are empty by nature,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog go //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog go //
translated: they will not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar des sgrib pa'i chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar des sgrib pa'i chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: It is because they do not see any phenomenon that is an obstruction.

original: chos thams cad sgrib pa med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos thams cad sgrib pa med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
translated: They see all phenomena as unobstructed.

original: de ni 'di ltar rang bzhin stong pa nyid la ni bdag mi dmigs /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar rang bzhin stong pa nyid la ni bdag mi dmigs /
translated: It is because in the emptiness of the intrinsic nature they do not apprehend a self,

original: bdag tu btags pa yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: bdag tu btags pa yang mi dmigs /
translated: and they do not apprehend a designation of a self,

original: sems can dang / srog dang ; 'gro ba dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed can dang / shed bdag dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / tshor bar byed pa po dang / slong ba po dang /🔽kun nas slong ba po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba por yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: sems can dang / srog dang ; 'gro ba dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed can dang / shed bdag dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / tshor bar byed pa po dang / slong ba po dang / kun nas slong ba po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba por yang mi dmigs /
translated: and they do not apprehend a being, a living being, a creature, one who lives, a person, an individual, one with power over the aggregates, one with power over the sense spheres, a maker, a feeler, one who makes feeling, one who instigates,🔽one who instigates completely, one who knows, or one who sees,

original: mthong ba por btags pa yang mi dmigs /🔽gzugs kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: mthong ba por btags pa yang mi dmigs / gzugs kyang mi dmigs /
translated: and they do not apprehend a designation of one who sees,🔽and they do not apprehend form,

original: gzugs su btags pa yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: gzugs su btags pa yang mi dmigs /
translated: and they do not apprehend a designation of form,🔽and they do not apprehend

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang mi dmigs /
translated: feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not apprehended,

original: rnam par shes par btags pa yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: rnam par shes par btags pa yang mi dmigs /
translated: and consciousness is not apprehended as a designation;

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bar dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bar dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yang mi dmigs /
translated: up to the thirty-two major marks of a great person and the eighty minor marks are not apprehended,

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cur btags par yang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cur btags par yang mi dmigs na /
translated: and the eighty minor marks are not apprehended as a designation;

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la the tshom za bar 'gyur ba lta ga la'ang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid la 'god pa'i phrin las yin no /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la the tshom za bar 'gyur ba lta ga la'ang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid la 'god pa'i phrin las yin no /
translated: how could they have doubts about unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”🔽“Subhūti, it is like this:

original: // / rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: // / rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: for example,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pas /
translated: a tathāgata emanation🔽teaches the doctrine to many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of monks,

original: dge slong ngam /🔽dge slong ma'am /
analyzed: dge slong ngam / dge slong ma'am /
translated: nuns,

original: dge bsnyen nam /
analyzed: dge bsnyen nam /
translated: male lay followers,

original: dge bsnyen ma la bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mar rgyun du chos bstan na /
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma la bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mar rgyun du chos bstan na /
translated: and female lay followers for many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of eons.

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: What do you think, Subhūti?

original: sprul pa de dag la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu rjes su thob par 'gyur ba'i skal pa yod dam /🔽lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub bam /
analyzed: sprul pa de dag la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu rjes su thob par 'gyur ba'i skal pa yod dam / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub bam /
translated: Is it possible for those emanations to have the good fortune to attain the result of stream enterer?🔽Is it possible for them to have the good fortune to attain the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha’s awakening,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ba'i skal ba yod dam /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ba'i skal ba yod dam /
translated: or unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags te /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags te /
translated: “Blessed One, it is not,” he replied.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: “Why is that?” he asked.

original: 'di ltar de dag la dngos po ma mchis so //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la dngos po ma mchis so //
translated: “It is because they do not have any substance.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: @272b rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: @272b rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, that is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: That is so!

original: chos thams cad la dngos po med na sems can gang zhig byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /🔽lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: chos thams cad la dngos po med na sems can gang zhig byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: If all dharmas are without substance, what sentient being will bodhisattva great beings establish in the result of stream enterer,🔽the result of once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the result of non-returner,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /🔽rang byang chub bam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dam / rang byang chub bam /
translated: to the state of a worthy one,🔽to a pratyekabuddha’s awakening,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'god par bya ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'god par bya ste /
translated: or to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gzhan du na phyin ci log gis yongs su 'khris pa'i skye dgu dag phyin ci log med pa la gzhog go //
analyzed: gzhan du na phyin ci log gis yongs su 'khris pa'i skye dgu dag phyin ci log med pa la gzhog go //
translated: Otherwise, those beings who are entangled in error will be brought to non-error.

original: 'dul lo // rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: 'dul lo // rab tu 'god do //
translated: They will be disciplined. They will be settled.

original: phyin ci log gang yin pa de yang rtog pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir phyin ci log ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log gang yin pa de yang rtog pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir phyin ci log ma yin pa ste /
translated: And that error is not error because it arises from the cause of conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa ni phyin ci log ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa ni phyin ci log ma yin pa'o //
translated: The absence of conceptualization is non-error.

original: gang la phyin ci log med pa la bdag med do //
analyzed: gang la phyin ci log med pa la bdag med do //
translated: In that which is non-error, there is no self.

original: sems can med do //
analyzed: sems can med do //
translated: There are no sentient beings.

original: srog med do //
analyzed: srog med do //
translated: There is no life-force.

original: 'gro ba med do //🔽gso ba med do /🔽skyes bu med do //
analyzed: 'gro ba med do // gso ba med do / skyes bu med do //
translated: There is no person.🔽There is no human being.

original: gang zag med do //🔽shed can med do //🔽shed bdag med do //
analyzed: gang zag med do // shed can med do // shed bdag med do //
translated: There is no human.

original: byed pa po med do //
analyzed: byed pa po med do //
translated: There is no one who does.

original: tshor ba po med do //
analyzed: tshor ba po med do //
translated: There is no one who feels.

original: shes pa po med do //
analyzed: shes pa po med do //
translated: There is no one who knows.

original: mthong ba po med do //
analyzed: mthong ba po med do //
translated: There is no one who sees.

original: de la gzugs med do //
analyzed: de la gzugs med do //
translated: There is no form in that.

original: tshor ba med do //
analyzed: tshor ba med do //
translated: There is no feeling.

original: 'du shes med do //
analyzed: 'du shes med do //
translated: There is no perception.

original: 'du byed rnams med do //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams med do //
translated: There are no volitional factors.

original: rnam par shes pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med do //
translated: There is no consciousness.

original: de la skye mched dang khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: de la skye mched dang khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med do //
translated: In it there are no sense spheres, no elements, and no dependent origination.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams med do //
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams med do //
translated: In it there are no perfections, no emptinesses, and no factors of awakening.

original: de ni 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: de ni 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: It is not the noble truths, the dhyānas, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams med do //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams med do //
translated: or wishlessness. It is not the higher knowledges, the meditative stabilizations, or the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad med do //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad med do //
translated: In it there are no ten powers of the Tathāgata, no four grounds of self-confidence, no four unhindered discernments, no great love, no great compassion, and no eighteen special qualities of a Buddha.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du med do //
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du med do //
translated: In it there is no knowledge of all aspects up to no knowledge of the path.

original: gang la gzugs med pa dang / tshor ba med pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'du byed rnams med pa dang / rnam par shes pa med pa dang / gang la skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med pa dang /
analyzed: gang la gzugs med pa dang / tshor ba med pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'du byed rnams med pa dang / rnam par shes pa med pa dang / gang la skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med pa dang /
translated: In it there is no form, no feeling, no perception, no volitional factors, and no consciousness; in it there are no eyes, no ears, no nose, no tongue, no body, and no mind; in it there are no sights, no sounds, no smells, no tastes, no tangibles, and no dharmas; in it there are no eye consciousnesses up to no mind consciousnesses; in it there are no eye contacts up to no mind contacts; in it there is no contact-­born feeling; in it there are no internal sense fields and no external sense fields; in it there are no aggregates, no constituents, and no sense fields; in it there is no dependent origination; in it there is no past, no future, and no present; in it there is no Dharma and no non-­Dharma; in it there is no śramaṇa and no brāhmaṇa; in it there is no arhat and no pratyekabuddha; in it there is no bodhisattva and no buddha.

original: gang la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang @273a * //
analyzed: gang la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang @273a * //
translated: In it there are no perfections, no emptinesses, no doors of liberation, no dhyānas, no immeasurables, and no formless concentrations; in it there is no superknowledge, no clairvoyance, no concentrations, no spheres of totality, no spheres of mastery, and no spheres of totality; in it there is no knowledge of path aspects, no knowledge of all aspects, and no knowledge of the knowledge of all aspects; in it there is no knowledge of suffering, no knowledge of its origination, no knowledge of its cessation, and no knowledge of the path; in it there is no abandonment of afflictions, no abandonment of the residues, and no abandonment of the latent tendencies; in it there is no suchness, no reality-­limit, and no inconceivable realm; in it there is no perfection of giving, no perfection of morality, no perfection of patience, no perfection of perseverance, no perfection of concentration, and no perfection of wisdom; in it there is no emptiness, no signlessness, and no wishlessness; in it there is no emptiness, no form, no

original: chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams med pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du med pa de ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams med pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du med pa de ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid de /
translated: The nonexistence of the factors of awakening, up to the nonexistence of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is the emptiness of essential nature.

original: de la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: de la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
translated: Abiding in that, bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sems can phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnams sems can gyi 'du shes las 'grel to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sems can phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnams sems can gyi 'du shes las 'grel to //
translated: Practicing the perfection of wisdom, they liberate beings who have gone wrong from the perception of beings.

original: gzugs kyi 'du shes las 'grel to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'du shes las 'grel to //
translated: They liberate them from the perception of form.

original: gzugs med pa'i 'du shes las 'grel to //🔽zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad kyi bar las 'grel to //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i 'du shes las 'grel to // zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad kyi bar las 'grel to //
translated: They liberate them from the perception of formlessness.🔽They liberate them from all dharmas with outflows.

original: gang zag pa med pa'i chos 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang zag pa med pa'i chos 'di lta ste /
translated: They liberate them from all dharmas without outflows, such as

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang /
translated: the factors of awakening, the three gateways to liberation, the four noble truths, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, all the meditative stabilities,

original: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs ba bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad po de dag kyang de la don dam pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs ba bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad po de dag kyang de la don dam pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: all the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of correct knowledge, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas are not ultimate.

original: de ltar 'dus ma byas pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa de ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar 'dus ma byas pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa de ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
translated: That which is unconditioned, unborn, insubstantial, and non-arisen is the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub ste de la bdag med do //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub ste de la bdag med do //
translated: That is the enlightenment of the lord buddhas, and in that there is no self,

original: sems can dang / srog dang / skye ba po dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed can dang / shed bdag dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po med do //
analyzed: sems can dang / srog dang / skye ba po dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed can dang / shed bdag dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po med do //
translated: no being, no soul, no nourisher, no man, no person, no anyone, no one who owns, no agent, no experiencer, no knower, and no seer.

original: gzugs med do //
analyzed: gzugs med do //
translated: There is no form.🔽There is no feeling, no perception, no volitional factors, and no consciousness.🔽There are no eyes, no ears, no nose, no tongue, no body, and no mind.🔽There are no skandhas, no dhātus, and no āyatanas.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa med do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa med do //
translated: There is no emptiness, no sign, and no aspiration.🔽There is no perfection of giving, no perfection of morality, no perfection of patience, no perfection of perseverance, no perfection of concentration, and no perfection of wisdom.🔽There is no inner emptiness, no outer emptiness, and no emptiness of both inner and outer.🔽There is no emptiness of emptiness, no great emptiness, and no ultimate emptiness.🔽There is no emptiness of conditioned phenomena, no emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, and no emptiness of the unlimited.🔽There is no emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, no emptiness of non-discarded phenomena, and no emptiness of essential nature.🔽There is no emptiness of all phenomena, no emptiness of specific characteristics, and no emptiness of the composite.🔽There is no emptiness of non-entities, no emptiness of essential nature, and no emptiness of other-entity.🔽There is no suchness, no non-differentiation, and no non-falsehood.🔽There is no unaltered nature, no limit of reality, and no reality limit.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med do //
translated: There is no path, no arriving, and no arrival.🔽There is no buddha, no bodhisattva, and no bodhisattva training.🔽There is no buddhafield, no purification, and no sentient being.🔽There is no Dharma, no non-Dharma, and no Dharma and non-Dharma.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams med do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams med do //
translated: There is no suchness, no non-suchness, and no suchness and non-suchness.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du med do //
translated: There is no past, no future, and no present.🔽There is no Dharma, no non-Dharma, and no Dharma and non-Dharma.🔽There is no suchness, no non-suchness, and no suchness and non-suchness.🔽There is no past, no future, and no present.🔽There is no Dharma, no non-

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid yongs su shes pa las ma gtogs pa lam gyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi don du 'jug pa med de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid yongs su shes pa las ma gtogs pa lam gyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi don du 'jug pa med de /
translated: That bodhisattva great being does not engage in the meaning of the path for the sake of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening except for the thorough knowledge of the emptiness of a basic nature.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid de yang snga nas kyang rang bzhin gyis @273b stong pa nyid /🔽phyin chad kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid de yang snga nas kyang rang bzhin gyis @273b stong pa nyid / phyin chad kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid /
translated: That emptiness of a basic nature is also from the beginning empty of a basic nature.🔽It is also in the future empty of a basic nature.

original: bar du yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: bar du yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid de /
translated: In the middle it is also empty of a basic nature.

original: de nam yang rang bzhin gyis mi stong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de nam yang rang bzhin gyis mi stong ba ma yin no //
translated: It is never not empty of a basic nature.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva great being, practicing the perfection of the emptiness of a basic nature,

original: sems can du 'du shes pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems can gyi 'du shes yongs su dgrol ba'i phyir lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod do //
analyzed: sems can du 'du shes pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems can gyi 'du shes yongs su dgrol ba'i phyir lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod do //
translated: practices the knowledge of path aspects in order to free the discriminations of beings who have the discrimination of beings.

original: de lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽'di lta ste /🔽nyan thos kyi lam dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang / lam thams cad la spyod do //
analyzed: de lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod pa'i tshe / 'di lta ste / nyan thos kyi lam dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang / lam thams cad la spyod do //
translated: When they practice the knowledge of the aspects of the path,🔽they practice all the paths,🔽namely, the Śrāvaka path, the Pratyekabuddha path, the Bodhisattva path, and all the paths.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: Having completed all the paths,

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas /
translated: having brought beings to maturity,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas nas /
translated: and having purified the buddhafield,

original: des tshe'i 'du byed byin gyis brlabs te /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: des tshe'i 'du byed byin gyis brlabs te / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: they exercise power over their lives🔽and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'di lta ste /
translated: Having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood,

original: sangs rgyas kyi tshul rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi rgyun mi gcod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi tshul rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi rgyun mi gcod do //
translated: they do not cut off the stream of the way of the buddhas, namely, the emptiness of inherent nature.

original: de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi tshul te /
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi tshul te /
translated: This is the way of the buddhas, the transcendent conquerors.

original: 'das pa'i dus kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig byung ba de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi tshul yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig byung ba de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi tshul yang 'di lta ste /
translated: The way of the buddhas, the transcendent conquerors, who have appeared in the past is as follows:

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do //
translated: it is emptiness of inherent nature.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig 'byung bar 'gyur ba de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi tshul 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig 'byung bar 'gyur ba de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi tshul 'di lta ste /
translated: The way of the buddhas, the transcendent conquerors, who will appear in the future is as follows:

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do //
translated: it is emptiness of inherent nature.

original: da ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi tshul yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: da ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi tshul yang 'di lta ste /
translated: The way of the buddhas, the transcendent conquerors, who are present in the world systems of the ten directions is as follows:

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid de /
translated: it is emptiness of inherent nature.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid las gzhan du ni 'jig rten du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid las gzhan du ni 'jig rten du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Apart from emptiness of essential nature, the Blessed Buddhas of the world would not appear.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis thams cad du ji ltar spyad na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba de ltar rang bzhin stong pa nyid la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis thams cad du ji ltar spyad na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba de ltar rang bzhin stong pa nyid la spyad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva great beings should practice emptiness of essential nature in such a way that, practicing everywhere, they do not fall away from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi bar pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ste /🔽de la spyod pa'i byang chub sems @274a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi bar pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ste / de la spyod pa'i byang chub sems @274a * //
translated: They should practice the perfection of emptiness of essential nature.

original: dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva great beings who practice that do not fall away from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,🔽“Lord, if all dharmas are empty of all dharmas, how can you apprehend a bodhisattva?

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi chos thams cad la spyod cing gzugs kyang gzhan no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi chos thams cad la spyod cing gzugs kyang gzhan no //
translated: Blessed One, if that is so, then bodhisattva great beings practice all phenomena of the emptiness of inherent nature, while form is one thing,

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan no //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan no //
translated: and the emptiness of inherent nature is another.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang gzhan no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang gzhan no //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are one thing,

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan no //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan no //
translated: and the emptiness of inherent nature is another.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang gzhan no //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang gzhan no //
translated: The sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination are one thing,

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan no //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan no //
translated: and the emptiness of inherent nature is another.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyang gzhan no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyang gzhan no //
translated: The perfections, all the emptinesses, and the factors of awakening are one thing,

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan no //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan no //
translated: and the emptiness of inherent nature is another.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the deliverances, the complete liberations, the meditative absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyang gzhan no //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyang gzhan no //
translated: wishlessness, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways are one thing,

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan no //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan no //
translated: and the emptiness of intrinsic nature is another;

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dras pa rnams kyang gzhan no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dras pa rnams kyang gzhan no //
translated: the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are one thing,

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan no //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan no //
translated: and the emptiness of intrinsic nature is another;

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang gzhan no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang gzhan no //
translated: and the knowledge of all aspects is another.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan no zhes bgyi bar rang bzhin stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrug par mi bgyid kyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan no zhes bgyi bar rang bzhin stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrug par mi bgyid kyi /
translated: “The emptiness of essential nature is not disturbed by saying that form is not one thing, and the emptiness of essential nature another.

original: gzugs nyid kyang rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs nyid kyang rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
translated: Form itself is the emptiness of essential nature.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so //
translated: The emptiness of essential nature itself is form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa nyid kyang rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa nyid kyang rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are the emptiness of essential nature.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang rnam par shes pa'o //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang rnam par shes pa'o // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of essential nature itself is consciousness.🔽Up to: the knowledge of all aspects is the emptiness of essential nature.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bgyi bar spyod pa ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bgyi bar spyod pa ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: The emptiness of essential nature itself is the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //🔽de de bzhin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no // de de bzhin te /
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!🔽It is just as you have said!

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin no //
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: rab 'byor gal te gzugs kyang gzhan la rang bzhin stong pa nyid @274b kyang gzhan /🔽tshor ba yang gzhan /
