analyzed: rab 'byor gal te gzugs kyang gzhan la rang bzhin stong pa nyid @274b kyang gzhan / tshor ba yang gzhan /
translated: Subhūti, if form were one thing and the emptiness of inherent nature another,🔽if feeling were one thing,

original: 'du shes kyang gzhan /
analyzed: 'du shes kyang gzhan /
translated: if perception were one thing,

original: 'du byed rnams kyang gzhan /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyang gzhan /
translated: if volitional factors were one thing,

original: rnam par shes pa yang gzhan la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang gzhan la /
translated: if consciousness were one thing,

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan /
translated: and the emptiness of inherent nature another,

original: phung po dang khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang gzhan la /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang gzhan la /
translated: if the aggregates, constituents, sense fields, and dependent origination were one thing,

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan /🔽pha rol tu phyin pa yang gzhan la /🔽rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan / pha rol tu phyin pa yang gzhan la / rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan /
translated: and the emptiness of inherent nature another,🔽if the perfections were one thing,🔽and the emptiness of inherent nature another,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyang gzhan la rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyang gzhan la rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan /
translated: if the factors of awakening were one thing and the emptiness of inherent nature another,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang /
translated: wishlessness, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love,

original: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang gzhan la /
translated: great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are one thing,

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan /
translated: and the emptiness of a basic nature is another.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang gzhan la rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang gzhan la rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Up to and the knowledge of all aspects is one thing, and the emptiness of a basic nature is another.”🔽“Subhūti, it is not so that the perfections are one thing, and the emptiness of a basic nature another.

original: gal te gzugs rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhig ma yin na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ste /🔽rab 'byor gang gi phyir gzugs rang bzhin gyis stong pas na de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar khong du chud par byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par
analyzed: gal te gzugs rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhig ma yin na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ste / rab 'byor gang gi phyir gzugs rang bzhin gyis stong pas na de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar khong du chud par byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par
translated: If form were not empty of essence, then the Bodhisattva, the great being, would not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: Subhūti, because form is empty of essence, the Bodhisattva, the great being, having understood that form is empty of essence, fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: gal te tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam pa shes pa rang shes pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhig ma yi na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ste /🔽rab 'byor gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa rang bzhin gyis stong pas na de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par shes pa rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar khong du chud par byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs🔽pa'i byang chub tu mngon par @275a * //
analyzed: gal te tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam pa shes pa rang shes pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhig ma yi na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ste / rab 'byor gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa rang bzhin gyis stong pas na de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par shes pa rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar khong du chud par byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par @275a * //
translated: If feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness were not empty of inherent existence, then the bodhisattva great beings would not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: Subhūti, it is because consciousness is empty of inherent existence that the bodhisattva great beings, having understood that ‘consciousness is empty of inherent existence,’ fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor gal te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhig ma yin na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhig ma yin na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi
translated: Subhūti, if up to the knowledge of all aspects were not empty of a basic nature, then the bodhisattva great being would not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rgya ste / rab 'byor gang gi phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rang bzhin gyis stong pas na /
analyzed: rgya ste / rab 'byor gang gi phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rang bzhin gyis stong pas na /
translated: Subhūti, it is because the knowledge of all aspects is empty of a basic nature

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar khong du chud par byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar khong du chud par byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: that the bodhisattva great beings, having understood that the knowledge of all aspects is empty of a basic nature, fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: rab 'byor gal te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhig ma yin na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang🔽mi rgya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhig ma yin na ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ste /
translated: Subhūti, if unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening were not empty of an intrinsic nature, then bodhisattva great beings would not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor gang gi phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rang bzhin gyis stong pas na /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang gi phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rang bzhin gyis stong pas na /
translated: Subhūti, because unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is empty of an intrinsic nature,

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar khong du chud par byas shing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su 'thob par byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar khong du chud par byas shing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su 'thob par byed de /
translated: bodhisattva great beings, having understood that unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is empty of an intrinsic nature, attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong ba nyid la ni chos gang yang rnam par 'jug par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong ba nyid la ni chos gang yang rnam par 'jug par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: In emptiness of an intrinsic nature, no dharma whatsoever is engaged,

original: rtag tu gnas pa'am 'gro ba med de /
analyzed: rtag tu gnas pa'am 'gro ba med de /
translated: nor does it abide or go.

original: gzhan du na lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang bdud dang tshangs par bcas pa'i 'jig rten rnams 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: gzhan du na lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang bdud dang tshangs par bcas pa'i 'jig rten rnams 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: Otherwise, the world with its gods, its Māras, and its Brahmās, the world with its religious wanderers and Brahmins, its gods, humans, and gandharvas, would not understand form to be:

original: bdag gi gzugs so //
analyzed: bdag gi gzugs so //
translated: “This is form.

original: bdag ni gzugs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni gzugs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: I am endowed with form.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i bar ro //🔽bdag gi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i bar ro // bdag gi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: This is consciousness.

original: bdag ni rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'o snyam du rmongs shing /
analyzed: bdag ni rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'o snyam du rmongs shing /
translated: I am endowed with consciousness.”

original: de dag gzugs la mngon par zhen /
analyzed: de dag gzugs la mngon par zhen /
translated: They are confused about form,

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar la mngon par zhen te /🔽bdag tu bya ba dang bdag gir bya ba la spyod do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar la mngon par zhen te / bdag tu bya ba dang bdag gir bya ba la spyod do //
translated: up to and confused about consciousness.🔽They engage in the notion of “I” and the notion of “mine.”

original: bdag tu bya ba dang bdag gir bya ba la mngon par zhen nas phyi nang gi dngos po la mngon par zhen cing chags so //
analyzed: bdag tu bya ba dang bdag gir bya ba la mngon par zhen nas phyi nang gi dngos po la mngon par zhen cing chags so //
translated: They cling to the notion of “I” and the notion of “mine,” and they cling to and are attached to inner and outer things.

original: de ltar mngon par zhen cing chags nas skye ba'i skye mched dag tu gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la nye bar len te /
analyzed: de ltar mngon par zhen cing chags nas skye ba'i skye mched dag tu gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la nye bar len te /
translated: Thus, having become attached and clinging in this way, they appropriate form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness in the sense spheres of rebirth.

original: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags @275b 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa las yongs su mi 'gro la /🔽'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba las yongs su mi 'grol lo /
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags @275b 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa las yongs su mi 'gro la / 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba las yongs su mi 'grol lo /
translated: They do not go beyond birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, dejection, and anguish.

original: // / bam po bdun cu pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bdun cu pa /
translated: They are not liberated from the five forms of life in saṃsāra.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod cing /🔽gzugs stong pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod cing / gzugs stong pa'am /
translated: Therefore, bodhisattva great beings practice the perfections of the emptiness of inherent nature🔽and do not get agitated, thinking, “Is form empty

original: 'on tam mi stong zhes bya bar rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'on tam mi stong zhes bya bar rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: or is it not empty?”

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa'am /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa'am /
translated: feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are empty.

original: 'on tam mi stong zhes bya bar rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //🔽skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams stong pa'am /
analyzed: 'on tam mi stong zhes bya bar rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do // skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams stong pa'am /
translated: He does not get agitated, thinking, “Are form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness empty or not empty?”

original: 'on tam mi stong zhes bya bar rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams stong pa'am /
analyzed: 'on tam mi stong zhes bya bar rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do // pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams stong pa'am /
translated: He does not get agitated, thinking, “Are the constituents, the sense fields, and dependent origination empty or not empty?”

original: 'on tam mi stong zhes bya bar rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'on tam mi stong zhes bya bar rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: He does not get agitated, thinking, “Are the perfections, the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening empty or not empty?”

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: He does not get agitated, thinking, “Are the noble truths, the dhyānas, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the deliverances, the complete conquerings, the emptiness, the signless, and the wishless empty or not empty?”

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams stong pa'am /🔽'on tam mi stong zhes bya bar rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams stong pa'am / 'on tam mi stong zhes bya bar rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: the emptiness of the faculties,🔽the emptiness of the powers,🔽the emptiness of the branches of enlightenment,🔽the emptiness of the path,🔽the emptiness of the fruit of entering the stream,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad stong pa'am /🔽'on tam mi stong zhes bya bar rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad stong pa'am / 'on tam mi stong zhes bya bar rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: the emptiness of the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth,🔽the emptiness of the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth,🔽the emptiness of arhatship,🔽the emptiness of individual enlightenment,🔽the emptiness of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,🔽the emptiness of the buddhas,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du stong pa'am /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du stong pa'am /
translated: the emptiness of the qualities of the buddhas,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the disciples,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the pratyekabuddhas,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the buddhas,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the bodhisattvas,

original: 'on tam mi stong zhes bya bar rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'on tam mi stong zhes bya bar rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: the emptiness of the qualities of the ordinary person,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the śrāvakas,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the pratyekabuddhas,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the buddhas,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the bodhisattvas,

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: the emptiness of the qualities of the ordinary person,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the śrāvakas,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the pratyekabuddhas,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the buddhas,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the bodhisattvas,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the ordinary person,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the śrāvakas,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the pratyekabuddhas,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the buddhas,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the bodhisattvas,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the ordinary person,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the śrāvakas,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the pratyekabuddhas,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the buddhas,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the bodhisattvas,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the ordinary person,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the śrāvakas,🔽the emptiness of the qualities of the pratyek

original: 'di ni gzugs kyi stong pa nyid do zhes gzugs rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs kyi stong pa nyid do zhes gzugs rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: He does not disturb form by saying, “This is the emptiness of form.”

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni 'di ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni 'di ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The emptiness of own-being is as follows: “These are feelings, perceptions, formative factors, and consciousness.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid do zhes rnam par shes pa rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid do zhes rnam par shes pa rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: He does not disturb consciousness by saying, “This is the emptiness of consciousness.”

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni 'di dag ni skye mched dang / khams dang / rten @276a * //🔽cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni 'di dag ni skye mched dang / khams dang / rten @276a * // cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The emptiness of own-being is as follows: “These are the sense fields, elements, and dependent origination.🔽These are the emptiness of dependent origination.”

original: 'di dag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i stong pa nyid do zhes rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i stong pa nyid do zhes rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: He does not disturb dependent origination by saying, “This is the emptiness of dependent origination.”

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni 'di dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni 'di dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams so //
translated: The emptiness of own-being is as follows: “These are the perfections, emptiness, and the factors of awakening.

original: 'di dag ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi stong pa nyid do zhes byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'di dag ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi stong pa nyid do zhes byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: “This is the emptiness of the nature of nonproduction,” and they do not confuse the nature of nonproduction.🔽“This is the emptiness of the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the deliverances, the complete liberations, the meditative stabilizations, and the absorptions,” and they do not confuse the meditative stabilizations and absorptions.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: “This is the emptiness of the emptiness, signless, and wishless gateways to liberation,” and they do not confuse the emptiness, signless, and wishless gateways to liberation.🔽“This is the emptiness of the ten powers of the tathāgatas,” and they do not confuse the ten powers of the tathāgatas.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams so //
translated: “This is the emptiness of the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,” and they do not confuse the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: 'di dag ni gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi stong pa nyid do zhes gzungs kyi sgo rnams rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'di dag ni gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi stong pa nyid do zhes gzungs kyi sgo rnams rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: “This is the emptiness of the emptiness of the gateway to the dhāraṇīs,” and they do not confuse the gateway to the dhāraṇīs.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so //
translated: The emptiness of essential nature is the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid do zhes sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid do zhes sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: The emptiness of the essential nature of those is the emptiness of the distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni 'di dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang byang chub bo //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni 'di dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang byang chub bo //
translated: The emptiness of essential nature is the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, and complete buddhahood.

original: 'di ni byang chub kyi stong pa nyid do zhes byang chub rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub kyi stong pa nyid do zhes byang chub rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: The emptiness of awakening is awakening.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: nam mkha' ni nam mkha' rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni nam mkha' rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: space does not disturb space.

original: nang gi nam mkha' ni phyi'i nam mkha' rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: nang gi nam mkha' ni phyi'i nam mkha' rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: The space inside does not disturb the space outside.

original: phyi'i nam mkha' ni nang gi nam mkha' rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: phyi'i nam mkha' ni nang gi nam mkha' rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: The space outside does not disturb the space inside.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du gzugs kyang stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du gzugs kyang stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, form does not disturb emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: Emptiness does not disturb form.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de dag la gang 'di ltar 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de dag la gang 'di ltar 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ni stong pa nyid do zhes rnam par 'khrug par mi byed pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa nyid do zhes rnam par 'khrug par mi byed pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin med do //
translated: Because they do not disturb each other in such a way that one is this and the other is that.

original: de bzhin du chos @276b thams cad la sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos @276b thams cad la sbyar ro //
translated: The same goes for all phenomena.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness do not disturb emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang rnam par shes pa rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang rnam par shes pa rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: emptiness does not disturb consciousness.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams kyang stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams kyang stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: The sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination do not disturb emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyang stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrug par mi byed /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do // pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyang stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrug par mi byed /
translated: Emptiness does not disturb dependent origination.🔽The perfections, all the emptinesses, and the factors of awakening do not disturb emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: Emptiness does not disturb the factors of awakening.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /🔽smon pa med pa dang ; mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyang stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrug par mi byed /🔽stong pa nyid kyang gzungs kyi sgo rnams rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang ; mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyang stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrug par mi byed / stong pa nyid kyang gzungs kyi sgo rnams rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: the noble truths,🔽the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the correct and discerning knowledges,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyang stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyang stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: the meditative absorption of the emptiness of emptiness, the meditative absorption of the emptiness of the highest point, the meditative absorption of the emptiness of the conditioned, the original: stong pa nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: emptiness does not disturb the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang ; rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang ; rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang stong pa nyid rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: The fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment, and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening do not disturb emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: Emptiness does not disturb unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag la gang 'di ltar 'di ni gzugs /
analyzed: de dag la gang 'di ltar 'di ni gzugs /
translated: Because in them this is form,

original: 'di ni stong pa nyid do ;
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa nyid do ;
translated: this is emptiness.

original: /'di ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa 'di ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: /'di ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa 'di ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: This is feeling, this is perception, this is volitional factors, this is consciousness, this is emptiness.

original: 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du 'di ni stong pa nyid do zhes rnam par 'khrug pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du 'di ni stong pa nyid do zhes rnam par 'khrug pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin med do //
translated: up to ‘this is unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,’ and ‘this is emptiness,’ there is no such nature.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das gal @277a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal @277a * //
translated: “Blessed One,

original: te chos thams cad dbyer ma mchis na ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs te /
analyzed: te chos thams cad dbyer ma mchis na ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs te /
translated: if all phenomena are not divisible, why would a bodhisattva great being think, ‘I am engaged in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes bgyi bar sems par 'gyur /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes bgyi bar sems par 'gyur /
translated: I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening’?

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub ni gnyis su dbyer ma mchis te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub ni gnyis su dbyer ma mchis te /
translated: Blessed One, awakening is not divisible into two.

original: gnyis su dbyer ma mchis pas ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: gnyis su dbyer ma mchis pas ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
translated: Because it is not divisible into two, it cannot fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /🔽byang chub ni gnyis su dbyer med pa ste /
analyzed: de de bzhin te / byang chub ni gnyis su dbyer med pa ste /
translated: It is just so, Subhūti.🔽Awakening is not divided into two.

original: gnyis la spyod pa la byang chub med do //
analyzed: gnyis la spyod pa la byang chub med do //
translated: Awakening is not for those who practice dualistically.

original: rab 'byor byang chub ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub ni byang chub bo //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub ni byang chub bo //
translated: Subhūti, awakening is not dual; it is not made into two. Therefore, the awakening of bodhisattva great beings is awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya bar gnyis su bya ba la mi spyod do /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya bar gnyis su bya ba la mi spyod do /
translated: They do not practice dualistically, thinking, ‘This is a bodhisattva,’ or ‘This is awakening.’

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub de ni gzugs la mi spyod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub de ni gzugs la mi spyod do //
translated: The awakening of bodhisattva great beings does not practice with form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi spyod do //
translated: It does not practice with feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams la mi spyod do //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams la mi spyod do //
translated: It does not practice with the sense fields, elements, or dependent origination.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la mi spyod do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la mi spyod do //
translated: It does not practice with the perfections, all the emptinesses, or the factors of awakening.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la mi spyod do //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la mi spyod do //
translated: wishlessness, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, or the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la mi spyod do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la mi spyod do //
translated: He does not practice the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: And why?

original: byang chub ni bdag gam bdag gir bya ba med pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub ni bdag gam bdag gir bya ba med pa ste /
translated: Awakening is not a self or something pertaining to a self.

original: bdag gis gzugs la spyad par bya'o zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag gis gzugs la spyad par bya'o zhe'am /
translated: He should not think, ‘I will practice with form,’

original: bdag gi gzugs so zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag gi gzugs so zhe'am /
translated: or ‘Form is mine,’🔽or ‘Form is not mine.’

original: bdag gi tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la spyad par bya'o zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag gi tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la spyad par bya'o zhe'am /
translated: I should practice with regard to my feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness.

original: bdag gi rnam par shes pa'o zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag gi rnam par shes pa'o zhe'am /
translated: This is my consciousness.

original: bdag gis @277b skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la spyad par bya'o zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag gis @277b skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la spyad par bya'o zhe'am /
translated: I should practice with regard to the sense fields, the components of the sense fields, and dependent origination.

original: bdag gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o zhe'am /
translated: This is my dependent origination.

original: bdag gis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la spyad par bya'o zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag gis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la spyad par bya'o zhe'am /
translated: I should practice with regard to the perfections, all the aspects of emptiness, and the elements leading to enlightenment.

original: bdag gi byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams so zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag gi byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams so zhe'am /
translated: These are the elements leading to enlightenment.

original: bdag gis 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: bdag gis 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the complete freedoms, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyad par bya'o zhe'am /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyad par bya'o zhe'am /
translated: wishlessness, the superknowledges, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: bdag gi gzungs kyi sgo rnams so zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag gi gzungs kyi sgo rnams so zhe'am /
translated: These are my dhāraṇī gateways.

original: bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang ; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyad par bya'o zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang ; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyad par bya'o zhe'am /
translated: I should practice the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad do zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad do zhe'am /
translated: These are my eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.’

original: bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar la spyad par bya'o zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar la spyad par bya'o zhe'am /
translated: I will practice up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bdag gi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo zhes bya bar bdag dang bdag gir bya ba med do //
analyzed: bdag gi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo zhes bya bar bdag dang bdag gir bya ba med do //
translated: Or, ‘My unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub ni 'dzin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub ni 'dzin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: The awakening of bodhisattva great beings does not practice with grasping.

original: mi 'dzin pa la yang mi spyod do //
analyzed: mi 'dzin pa la yang mi spyod do //
translated: It does not practice without grasping.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub 'dzin pa la'ang mi spyod mi 'dzin pa la'ang mi spyod na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub 'dzin pa la'ang mi spyod mi 'dzin pa la'ang mi spyod na /
translated: “Lord, if the awakening of bodhisattva great beings does not practice with grasping and does not practice without grasping,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub ci la spyod pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub ci la spyod pa lags /
translated: what does the awakening of bodhisattva great beings practice with?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa'i byang chub 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa'i byang chub 'dzin pa'am /
translated: Does the awakening of a tathāgata emanation practice with grasping or

original: mi 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: mi 'dzin pa'am /
translated: without grasping?

original: ci la yang spyod pa yod dam /
analyzed: ci la yang spyod pa yod dam /
translated: Is there any practice at all?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: He replied, “No, Blessed One, there is not.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /🔽dgra bcom pa'i rmi lam gyi blo 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems / dgra bcom pa'i rmi lam gyi blo 'dzin pa'am /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: mi 'dzin pa'am gang la yang spyod dam /
analyzed: mi 'dzin pa'am gang la yang spyod dam /
translated: Do the thoughts of an arhat in a dream grasp or not grasp anything, or do they practice anything at all?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags te /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags te /
translated: ” He replied, “Blessed One, no, they do not.

original: dgra bcom pa @278a * //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa @278a * //
translated: An arhat

original: la yong ye nyal ba yang ma mchis na /🔽de'i rmi lam gyi blo 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: la yong ye nyal ba yang ma mchis na / de'i rmi lam gyi blo 'dzin pa'am /
translated: does not sleep at all,

original: mi 'dzin pa la spyod par 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: mi 'dzin pa la spyod par 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: so how could the thoughts of his dreams grasp or not grasp anything, or practice anything at all?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyang 'dzin pa'am mi 'dzin pa la spyod pa med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyang 'dzin pa'am mi 'dzin pa la spyod pa med do //
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, the awakening of bodhisattva great beings does not practice grasping or not grasping anything at all.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub 'dzin pa la yang mi spyod mi 'dzin pa la yang mi spyod /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub 'dzin pa la yang mi spyod mi 'dzin pa la yang mi spyod /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Blessed One, if bodhisattva great beings do not engage with the apprehension of awakening, nor with the non-apprehension of awakening,

original: gzugs la yang mi spyod /
analyzed: gzugs la yang mi spyod /
translated: and if they do not engage with form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la yang mi spyod /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la yang mi spyod /
translated: feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness,

original: skye mched dang ; khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la yang mi spyod /
analyzed: skye mched dang ; khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la yang mi spyod /
translated: and if they do not engage with the sense sources, elements, or dependent origination,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la'ang mi spyod /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la'ang mi spyod /
translated: and if they do not engage with the perfections, all the emptinesses, or the factors of awakening,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: and if they do not engage with the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la yang mi spyod /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la yang mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice the emptiness meditative stabilization, signless meditative stabilization, or wishless meditative stabilization; they do not practice the five eyes, six clairvoyances, four fearlessnesses, four detailed and thorough knowledges, or eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha;

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la yang mi spyod /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la yang mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice the ten powers of a tathāgata, four fearlessnesses, four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, or eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha;

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la yang mi spyod na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la yang mi spyod na /
translated: they do not practice up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad /
translated: So how do bodhisattva great beings practice the six perfections?

original: stong pa nyid bcu bzhi dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bcu bzhi dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad dang /
translated: They do not practice the fourteen emptinesses, thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, three gateways to liberation, or all the meditative stabilizations, liberations, concentrations, and meditative absorptions;

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang ; byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyad /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang ; byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyad /
translated: the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, great loving kindness, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu yongs su rdzogs par bgyis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu yongs su rdzogs par bgyis /
translated: and they have completed the ten bodhisattva levels.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga la gnas /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga la gnas /
translated: They have stood in the five kinds of supernatural knowledge,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par zhugs /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par zhugs /
translated: have entered into the maturity of the bodhisattvas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par @278b bgyis sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyis /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par @278b bgyis sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyis /
translated: have purified a buddhafield, and have brought beings to maturity.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yongs su bsgrubs shing /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yongs su bsgrubs shing /
translated: They have accomplished the thirty-two major marks and eighty minor marks of a great person,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /
translated: and they will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa drug la ma spyad /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa drug la ma spyad /
translated: Blessed One, they have not practiced the six perfections,

original: stong pa nyid bcu bzhi la ma spyad /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bcu bzhi la ma spyad /
translated: I did not practice the fourteen emptinesses.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la ma spyad /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la ma spyad /
translated: I did not practice the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: rnam pa thar pa'i sgo gsum la ma spyad /
analyzed: rnam pa thar pa'i sgo gsum la ma spyad /
translated: I did not practice the three gates of liberation.

original: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad la ma spyad /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad la ma spyad /
translated: I did not practice all the concentrations, liberations, samādhis, and absorptions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la ma spyad /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la ma spyad /
translated: I did not practice the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu yongs su rdzogs par ma bgyis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu yongs su rdzogs par ma bgyis /
translated: I did not complete the ten bodhisattva levels.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga la ma gnas /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga la ma gnas /
translated: I did not remain in the five clairvoyances.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par ma zhugs /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par ma zhugs /
translated: I did not enter the bodhisattva’s faultlessness.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par ma bgyis /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par ma bgyis /
translated: I did not purify a buddhafield.

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par ma bgyis /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par ma bgyis /
translated: I did not bring beings to maturity.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yongs su ma bsgrubs par ni /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yongs su ma bsgrubs par ni /
translated: without having accomplished the thirty-two major marks of a great person and the eighty minor marks,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
translated: one is not able to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //🔽de de bzhin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no // de de bzhin te /
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!🔽It is just as you have said.

original: ji skad du smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad du smras pa de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par ma byas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par ma byas /
translated: Without having completed the six perfections,

original: stong pa nyid bcu bzhi dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bcu bzhi dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad dang /
translated: without having completed the fourteen emptinesses, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the three doors of liberation, all the concentrations, liberations, meditative stabilizations, and absorptions,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dan /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dan /
translated: the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, great loving kindness, great compassion,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par ma byas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par ma byas /
translated: and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas are not completed,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu yongs su ma rdzogs /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu yongs su ma rdzogs /
translated: the ten bodhisattva levels are not completed,

original: mngon par shes pa lnga la ma gnas /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga la ma gnas /
translated: they do not remain in the five kinds of supernormal knowledge,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par ma zhugs /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par ma zhugs /
translated: they do not enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par ma byas /🔽sems can rnams yongs su @279a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par ma byas / sems can rnams yongs su @279a * //
translated: they do not purify a buddhafield,

original: smin par ma byas /
analyzed: smin par ma byas /
translated: they do not bring beings to maturity,

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yongs su ma bsgrubs par ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yongs su ma bsgrubs par ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus te /
translated: and they do not accomplish the thirty-two major marks and eighty minor marks of a great person, they are not able to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
translated: all the emptinesses, the four establishments in mindfulness, up to the eightfold noble path, the emptiness gate of liberation,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang ; snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang ; snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang /
translated: the signless gate of liberation, the wishless gate of liberation, the concentrations, the deliverances, the meditative stabilizations, and the absorptions, the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and the ten bodhisattva levels,

original: mngon par shes pa lnga la gnas /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga la gnas /
translated: and they stand in the five clairvoyances.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs /
translated: he enters into the secure state of a bodhisattva,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas /
translated: he purifies the buddhafield,

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas /
translated: he matures beings,

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yongs su bsgrubs /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yongs su bsgrubs /
translated: he accomplishes the thirty-two marks and eighty signs of a great person,

original: mi nyams pa'i chos nyid dang / rtag tu btang snyoms su rnam par spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: mi nyams pa'i chos nyid dang / rtag tu btang snyoms su rnam par spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: he perfects the nature of non-forgetfulness and the constant practice of equanimity,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: and he attains the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor de yang gzugs kyi rang bzhin la gnas /
analyzed: rab 'byor de yang gzugs kyi rang bzhin la gnas /
translated: Subhūti, that is based on the nature of form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin la gnas /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin la gnas /
translated: based on the nature of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar gyi rang bzhin la gnas te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar gyi rang bzhin la gnas te /
translated: up to based on the nature of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: rang bzhin de yang nye bar zhi ba ste /🔽chos gang yang 'phel par byed pa'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin de yang nye bar zhi ba ste / chos gang yang 'phel par byed pa'am /
translated: “That nature is also peaceful.🔽There is no increase or decrease

original: 'grib par byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'grib par byed pa'am /
translated: of any dharma,

original: skye ba'am / 'gag pa'am /🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: skye ba'am / 'gag pa'am / kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: no arising or ceasing,

original: rnam par byang ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'am /
translated: no defilement or purification,🔽no attainment or clear realization.”

original: thob pa'am / mngon par rtogs par byed pa med do zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i chos la 'god pa'i phrin las yin no /
analyzed: thob pa'am / mngon par rtogs par byed pa med do zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i chos la 'god pa'i phrin las yin no /
translated: This is the activity of establishing nondual dharmas.

original: // / rab 'byor de yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du btags pa'i @279b chos nye bar bzung nas /
analyzed: // / rab 'byor de yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du btags pa'i @279b chos nye bar bzung nas /
translated: “Subhūti, that is also a dharma that is imputed as a conventional designation of the world.🔽Bodhisattva great beings fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'i don dam par ni gzugs sam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'i don dam par ni gzugs sam /
translated: But ultimately there is no form,🔽no feeling,

original: tshor ba'am / 'du shes sam /
analyzed: tshor ba'am / 'du shes sam /
translated: no perception,🔽no volitional factors,🔽and no consciousness.”

original: 'du byed rnams sam /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams sam /
translated: the compounded elements,

original: rnam par shes pa'am /🔽skye mched dam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'am / skye mched dam /
translated: consciousness,🔽the sense-spheres,🔽the elements,

original: khams sam / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: khams sam / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'am /
translated: the dependent origination,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams sam /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams sam /
translated: the perfections,🔽all the emptinesses,

original: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams sam /
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams sam /
translated: the factors of awakening,🔽the noble truths,🔽the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the serial absorptions, emptiness,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams sam /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams sam /
translated: wishlessness, the superknowledges, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang ; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams sam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang ; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams sam /
translated: the powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar ram /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar ram /
translated: up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: gang byang chub tu spyod pa'i chos de lta bu yang med de /
analyzed: gang byang chub tu spyod pa'i chos de lta bu yang med de /
translated: or the dharmas that are practiced for awakening, do not exist.

original: chos de dag thams cad ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad nye bar bzung ste btags pa yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //🔽de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad nye bar bzung ste btags pa yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no // de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: All those dharmas are imputed by taking up worldly convention, but not ultimately.🔽Therefore, starting from the first production of the thought,

original: byang chub tu spyod kyang sems de dag mi dmigs te /
analyzed: byang chub tu spyod kyang sems de dag mi dmigs te /
translated: the bodhisattva great beings practice for awakening without apprehending those thoughts,

original: sems can rnams dang byang chub dang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sems can rnams dang byang chub dang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' yang mi dmigs so //
translated: and do not apprehend beings, awakening, buddhas, or bodhisattvas.

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: gang gi tshe rab 'byor khyod kyis 'jig tshogs la lta ba spang ba'i phyir dbang po rnams thob par 'gyur ba dang / bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rab 'byor khyod kyis 'jig tshogs la lta ba spang ba'i phyir dbang po rnams thob par 'gyur ba dang / bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'am /
translated: When, Subhūti, you obtain the faculties for the sake of abandoning the view of the perishable collection, and the uninterrupted meditative stabilization, and obtain the result of stream enterer,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba de'i tshe rmi lam mam /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba de'i tshe rmi lam mam /
translated: the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, and the attainment of arhatship, at that time would a dream,

original: sems sam / lam mam /
analyzed: sems sam / lam mam /
translated: or a thought, or a path,

original: 'bras bu dmigs par 'gyur ba yod dam /
analyzed: 'bras bu dmigs par 'gyur ba yod dam /
translated: or a fruit be apprehended?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: He replied, “No, Blessed One.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'o na ci ltar rab 'byor zhes bya ba'i ming can gyi gnas brtan khyod kyis dgra bcom pa thob bo zhes btags pa yin /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar rab 'byor zhes bya ba'i ming can gyi gnas brtan khyod kyis dgra bcom pa thob bo zhes btags pa yin /
translated: “Well then, how is it that you, the elder named Subhūti, are designated as having attained arhatship?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das @280a * //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das @280a * //
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad nye bar bzung nas lags so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad nye bar bzung nas lags so //
translated: it is in terms of worldly convention.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du btags pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du btags pa'o //
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, a bodhisattva great being is a designation in terms of worldly convention.

original: gzugs kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du btags pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du btags pa'o //
translated: Form is also a designation in terms of worldly convention.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du btags pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du btags pa'o //
translated: perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are designations in terms of worldly convention;

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du btags pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du btags pa'o //
translated: the sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination are designations in terms of worldly convention;

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du btags pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du btags pa'o //
translated: the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the factors for enlightenment are designations in terms of worldly convention;

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang ; ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du btags pa'o //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du btags pa'o //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du btags pa'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang ; ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du btags pa'o // de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du btags pa'o // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du btags pa'o //
