original: chos kyi rang bzhin nye bar bzung nas chos rnams kyi chos kyi rang bzhin de yang ma dmigs na /
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin nye bar bzung nas chos rnams kyi chos kyi rang bzhin de yang ma dmigs na /
translated: When the nature of phenomena is apprehended, even the nature of phenomena is not apprehended.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te de ni gnas med do //
translated: How could the generation of the first thought be apprehended? That is not possible.

original: sa bcu pa'i bar dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i bar dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te de ni gnas med do //
translated: How could the ten levels, the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening be apprehended? That is not possible.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa @280b nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa @280b nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: How could the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the deliverances, the sequential meditative absorptions, emptiness, signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams su dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams su dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te de ni gnas med do //
translated: How could they possibly apprehend the applications of mindfulness, the correct exertions, the supports for miraculous ability, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the three gateways to liberation, the eight aspects of liberation, or the nine serial steps of meditative absorption?🔽How could they possibly apprehend the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, the four kinds of correct understanding, great loving kindness, great compassion, or the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas?🔽How could they possibly apprehend the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, the four kinds of correct understanding, great loving kindness, great compassion, or the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas?🔽How could they possibly apprehend the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, the four kinds of correct understanding, great loving kindness, great compassion, or the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas?🔽How could they possibly apprehend the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, the four kinds of correct understanding, great loving kindness, great compassion, or the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te de ni gnas med do //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te de ni gnas med do //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te de ni gnas med do //
translated: How could they possibly apprehend the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, the four kinds of correct understanding, great loving kindness, great compassion, or the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas?🔽How could they possibly apprehend the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, the four kinds of correct understanding, great loving kindness, great compassion, or the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas?

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te sems can rnams kyi don byed do zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te sems can rnams kyi don byed do zhes bya ba ni
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, having practiced the six perfections, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, acts for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: brdar btags pa'i shes pa la 'god pa'i phrin las yin no /
analyzed: brdar btags pa'i shes pa la 'god pa'i phrin las yin no /
translated: This is the activity of establishing in nominal knowledge.

original: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid bcu bzhi dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid bcu bzhi dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang /
translated: Blessed One, if the bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the six perfections, the fourteen emptinesses, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the three doors of liberation,

original: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa dang /
translated: and the gateways of dhāraṇī,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod pas byang chub kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par bgyis kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba ma mchis na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod pas byang chub kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par bgyis kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba ma mchis na /
translated: and the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, great loving kindness, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, they will not have the good fortune to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ci ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ci ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba lags /
translated: “Blessed One, how do bodhisattva great beings fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽thabs mkhas @281a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / thabs mkhas @281a * //
translated: “Su­bhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom,

original: pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang sbyin pa'i bdag po dang len pa yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang sbyin pa'i bdag po dang len pa yang mi dmigs /
translated: they practice the transcendent perfection of generosity with skillful means, but they do not apprehend a giver, a recipient, or a gift.

original: chos de dag las gzhan du yang mi spyod na de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos de dag las gzhan du yang mi spyod na de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: If they do not practice anything other than these attributes, at that time the bodhisattva great beings will attain the path to enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na thabs mkhas pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na thabs mkhas pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom like that, they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening through skillful means.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang /
translated: they practice the perfection of morality,

original: tshul khrims dang tshul khrims dang ldan pa'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang tshul khrims dang ldan pa'ang mi dmigs /
translated: but they do not apprehend morality or someone with morality,

original: chos de gnyis las gzhan du mi spyod na de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos de gnyis las gzhan du mi spyod na de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: and they do not practice apart from those two phenomena. At that time, bodhisattva great beings attain the path to awakening.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na thabs mkhas pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na thabs mkhas pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom like that, they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening through skillful means.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang ;
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang ;
translated: they practice the perfection of patience,

original: bzod pa dang bzod pa dang ldan pa yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: bzod pa dang bzod pa dang ldan pa yang mi dmigs /
translated: but they do not apprehend patience or someone with patience,

original: chos de gnyis las gzhan du yang mi spyod na /
analyzed: chos de gnyis las gzhan du yang mi spyod na /
translated: and they do not practice other than those two dharmas.

original: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: At that time bodhisattva great beings attain the path to awakening.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na ;
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na ;
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom like that,

original: thabs mkhas pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: and through skill in means they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang /
translated: are practicing the perfection of effort,

original: brtson 'grus dang brtson 'grus rtsom pa yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang brtson 'grus rtsom pa yang mi dmigs /
translated: they do not apprehend either effort or the one who makes the effort,

original: chos de gnyis las gzhan du yang ma dmigs na /
analyzed: chos de gnyis las gzhan du yang ma dmigs na /
translated: and they do not apprehend anything other than those two dharmas.🔽At that time bodhisattva great beings acquire the path to awakening

original: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: and, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that🔽through skill in means fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”🔽“Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom🔽are practicing the perfection of patience,🔽they do not apprehend either patience or the one who is patient,🔽and they do not apprehend anything other than those two dharmas.🔽At that time bodhisattva great beings acquire the path to awakening

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod @281b na ;
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod @281b na ;
translated: and, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that

original: thabs mkhas pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: through skill in means fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang /
translated: they practice the perfection of concentration,

original: bsam gtan dang bsam gtan pa'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang bsam gtan pa'ang mi dmigs /
translated: but they do not apprehend concentration or one who concentrates.

original: chos de gnyis las gzhan du'ang mi spyod na de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos de gnyis las gzhan du'ang mi spyod na de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: When they do not practice other than those two dharmas, at that time bodhisattva great beings attain the path to awakening.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom like that,

original: thabs mkhas pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening through skillful means.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom yang shes rab dang shes rab dang ldan pa'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom yang shes rab dang shes rab dang ldan pa'ang mi dmigs /
translated: and also meditates on the perfection of wisdom, but does not apprehend wisdom or one who has wisdom,

original: chos de gnyis las gzhan du'ang mi spyod na /
analyzed: chos de gnyis las gzhan du'ang mi spyod na /
translated: and also does not practice other than those two dharmas,

original: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: at that time the bodhisattva great being will obtain the path to awakening.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom like that,

original: thabs mkhas pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: they will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening through skillful means.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la spyod kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la spyod kyang /
translated: they practice up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa sgom pa yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa sgom pa yang mi dmigs /
translated: the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and the meditation on the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are non-apprehensible,

original: chos de gnyis las gzhan du'ang mi spyod na /
analyzed: chos de gnyis las gzhan du'ang mi spyod na /
translated: and if he does not engage with anything other than those two dharmas,

original: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi lam 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time the bodhisattva mahāsattva will attain the path to enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom in that way,

original: thabs mkhas pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: they will, through skillful means, fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Śāriputra said to the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha @282a * //🔽rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha @282a * // rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Lord, how do bodhisattva mahāsattvas

original: byang chub kyi lam la brtson par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam la brtson par bgyid pa lags /
translated: strive on the path to enlightenment when they practice the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Śāriputra, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: thabs mkhas pas gzugs la mi sbyor mi 'byed de /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas gzugs la mi sbyor mi 'byed de /
translated: do not join with or separate from form.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni 'di ltar gang sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar gang sbyar ba'am /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbye bar bya ba'i gzugs la ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: dbye bar bya ba'i gzugs la ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: It is because form has no intrinsic nature to be joined with or separated from.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi sbyor mi 'byed de /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi sbyor mi 'byed de /
translated: They do not join with or separate from feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar gang la sbyar ba'am dbye bar byed pa'i rnam par shes pa la ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gang la sbyar ba'am dbye bar byed pa'i rnam par shes pa la ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: It is because consciousness has no intrinsic nature to be joined with or separated from.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams la mi sbyor mi 'byed de /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams la mi sbyor mi 'byed de /
translated: They do not join with or separate from the sense spheres, elements, or dependent origination.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar gang la sbyar ba'am dbye bar bya ba'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gang la sbyar ba'am dbye bar bya ba'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: It is because dependent origination, which is what is connected or separated, has no intrinsic nature.🔽“They do not connect or disconnect the perfections,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la mi sbyor mi 'byed de /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la mi sbyor mi 'byed de / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: all the emptinesses, or the dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: de ni 'di ltar gang la sbyar ba'am dbye bar bya ba'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gang la sbyar ba'am dbye bar bya ba'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: If you ask why, it is because the dharmas on the side of awakening, which are what are connected or separated, have no intrinsic nature.🔽“They do not connect or disconnect the noble truths,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang ; mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang ; mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the deliverances, the sequential meditative absorptions, emptiness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la mi sbyor mi 'byed de /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la mi sbyor mi 'byed de /
translated: signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, or the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni 'di ltar gang sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar gang sbyar ba'am /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbye bar bya ba'i gzungs kyi sgo rnams la ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: dbye bar bya ba'i gzungs kyi sgo rnams la ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: It is because the dhāraṇī gateways that are united or differentiated have no intrinsic nature.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la mi sbyor mi 'byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la mi sbyor mi 'byed do //
translated: He does not unite or differentiate the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, great loving kindness, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni 'di ltar gang sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar gang sbyar ba'am /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbye bar bya ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: dbye bar bya ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: It is because the distinct attributes of a buddha that are united or differentiated have no intrinsic nature.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das chos gang la yang sbyar ba'am dbye bar bgyi ba'i ngo bo nyid ma mchis na /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das chos gang la yang sbyar ba'am dbye bar bgyi ba'i ngo bo nyid ma mchis na /
translated: Śāriputra then asked, “Lord, if there is no intrinsic nature that unites or differentiates any dharma,

original: gang la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bgyi ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu @282b phyin pa ji ltar mngon par sgrub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bgyi ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu @282b phyin pa ji ltar mngon par sgrub par 'gyur /
translated: How will the perfection of wisdom be accomplished by the bodhisattva great being who is to train in it?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma bslabs par ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma bslabs par ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
translated: Without training in the perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattva great being cannot fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin no //
translated: The Lord said,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: “So it is, Śāriputra, so it is!

original: ji skad du smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad du smras pa de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma bslabs par byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma bslabs par byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus te /
translated: Without training in the perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattva great being cannot fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de yang thabs mkhas pas yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang thabs mkhas pas yin gyi /
translated: But that is through skillful means.

original: thabs mi mkhas pas ma yin no //
analyzed: thabs mi mkhas pas ma yin no //
translated: not without skillful means.

original: sh'a ri'i bu gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Śāriputra, if a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: chos gang la la zhig gi ngo bo nyid dmigs na ni de'i phyir 'dzin par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: chos gang la la zhig gi ngo bo nyid dmigs na ni de'i phyir 'dzin par mi 'gyur na /
translated: were to apprehend the intrinsic nature of any dharma at all, then for that reason he would not be a holder.

original: 'on te mi dmigs na 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: 'on te mi dmigs na 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: But if he does not apprehend it, then what is there to be held as ‘this is form,’

original: 'di ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshor ba'o //
translated: ‘this is feeling,

original: 'di ni 'du shes so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'du shes so //
translated: this is perception,

original: 'di ni 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'du byed rnams so //
translated: this is volitional factors,

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya bar yang ci zhig bzung /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya bar yang ci zhig bzung /
translated: this is consciousness,’

original: 'di dag ni skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
translated: ‘these are the constituents, sense fields, and dependent origination,’

original: 'di dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams so //
translated: ‘these are the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the factors of awakening,’

original: 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: These are the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the complete liberations, the emptiness, the signless,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang ; ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams so //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang ; ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams so //
translated: the wishless, the superknowledges, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so //
translated: These are the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽These are up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'di dag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ro zhes bya bar yang ci zhig bzung ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ro zhes bya bar yang ci zhig bzung ste /
translated: What is it that is apprehended?

original: sh'a ri'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bzung du med do //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bzung du med do //
translated: Śāriputra, the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended.
